Also, we had the 3 pancake sampler! Peanut butter, mocha, sweet potato pancakes. Sometimes eating normal size pancakes is too much and makes you feel bloated. But these were the perfect size to share, try different flavors and fulfill a pancake craving.  SERVICE -- P-h-e-n-o-m-e-n-a-l ! And fast! Our drinks and food came out quick. Most of all, our server was Nikki and she was the BEST!! She was so genuine, personable, friendly, and kind. If there's anyone that knows the art of customer service in the restaurant industry, it would definitely be her. This lovely woman deserves a raise or a promotion (and employee of the month - we nominate her!),  because she knows customer service like no other. Nikki made my husband and I feel so comfortable and right at home. Because of her and the superb brunch food, we will be back and want to be usuals!  Thank you SO much to Nikki for the amazing, 5 star customer service!! And to Snooze for the wonderful brunch!

I love this new place especially the location is perfect right off the 51. My first time coming in and I met a wonderful elderly couple as much as I enjoyed my breakfast I enjoyed them so much more. Great service great employees, everyone is so friendly. You won't be disappointed.

Snooze is a fun place. There's sort of a vintage, 60s vibe about it. Personally, I love the sweet stuff, so I usually get a flight of pancakes (you can pick any three pancakes you like!) My boyfriend likes to get something more savory, like a burrito or chilaquiles. I feel like there's something for everyone at snooze!   It's usually super busy, but it's worth your wait.
Best breakfast around! My brother and I go every Sunday and I look forward to it all week. Great menu, something for everyone, and lots to try! Great friendly service as well. Love this place

The food here is great! Only disappointments about this place is that every time we have gone it's about a hour wait. Once we were finally seated they take another 20-30 min to bring out the food. I understand they are busy but it really takes way too long to actually get your food at the table. If you have time to wait and have patience for the food to come out, the food is worth it!

We stopped by this place for a quick breakfast while staying in Phoenix. The place is nice and has a welcoming atmosphere. It's relaxing with a pingpong table and other games for customers to play and chill out. The service was good and quick.  The food is ok. I had the benedicts half ham and half chilaquiles. The ham was good but the chilaquiles was a little plain. My friend got pot pie and I think it has a better taste than the bendicts. In general the place is ok for casual breakfast with typical dishes.  Other thoughts: they have a list of very interesting drinks/cocktails. I didn't try any of them since I was on a rush to see other places in the city, but I would definitely try some of them next time when I have more time

I had an amazing experience !! Server was amazing! FOOD WAS EXCELLENT!! DRINKS WHERE AMAZING!!! DEFINITELY GO HERE!!! The wait time was 30 minutes , but it was certainly worth the wait. I would come back and recommend to all my friends!!

The food here is great! This was the best restaurant I went to breakfast for in Arizona! The service was great, the food looked and tasted beautiful. By the time we were done eating there was almost nothing left on the plates. I hope I can come here again when I come back to Arizona. I definitely recommend the blueberry danish pancake, and the Bella Bella Benny. It was great! I would get it medium though, not their normal because it was too runny in my opinion.

This place is not like your typical breakfast/brunch place. The menu is very different and the flavors are robust. Great place for out of town guests or a lazy Sunday. Always a wait, so plan on 30-45 mins for a table. Well worth the wait however and there are games to keep you occupied.

Came here and had breakfast on a turnaround trip with my sister and it was by far one of the best places I've ever had breakfast. They give you free coffee while you wait and waiters circle around while you wait for your table asking you if you need anything from the bar. Five stars all the way
Loved everything about SNOOZE!!  Mimosas were delicious!  Fun atmosphere and great food!  Will be back!!
Retro look, great menu and excellent food.  Only downfall was the bathroom wasn't too clean...
This place's food is sooo good. Very good eggs benedict, very good peanut butter pancakes. These people got it going on, I highly recommend going here.
Food was cool and mostly flavorless. This is our third trip and we won't be coming back. Denver location is awesome, five star, PHX needs to go for lessons in food prep and customer service.

Just ate here based on all the great reviews. It's Saturday so we expected a wait but we don't mind waiting for great food. I ordered the Chili Verde Benny and my husband got the Corned Beef Hash. The Corned Beef Hash was a huge disappointment so I ended up giving my husband half my Benny. The Benny was good but NO part of our meal was worth the 1 hr and 15 min wait.

Snooze is perfect for breakfast. This location is always packed since it's so good! Definitely worth the wait if you have time. Side of hash browns are amazing and served different than any other restaurant! You'll have to see the hipster breakfast joint for yourself!

I finally decided to stop in and have breakfast here on a Sunday. I was not surprised by the wait and line once I arrived. I knew that this location is ALWAYS busy. Surprisingly, I got a table within ten minutes of checking in with my husband. Yay! Once we arrived at our table our waitress came to take our drink and breakfast order. Minutes later...our food was already delivered at our table. Talk about FAST! Our food came out so delicious. So delicious that I don't want to order anything else on the menu because I already fell in love with the first item I tried. I recommend coming early because they don't take reservations in advance, they're kind of a first come first serve type of restaurant. They're dog friendly. So, come and bring your pooches! If you're unable to find parking, the best option is to park at the nearby parking garage. Not many restaurants offer military discounts, but this Snooze location does!

Amazing addition to the Biltmore area! This is the best breakfast place around (get here early to avoid a long wait, especially on  the weekends). But to fill the void of waiting, Snooze so kindly enough has complimentary coffee from Guatemala for the customers waiting.   I have been here numerous times already and everything we tried is delicious. Highly recommend the pancakes. The pancakes are light, fluffy, sweet and never get soggy. OMG French toast is another hit. Corned beef hash, eggs Benedict, just plain eggs, Juans breakfast tacos would all be ordered again!  Make sure to come on an empty stomach - it's worth it!

So yummy! Good coffee, had a Bananutella pancake and a breakfast taco. The pablano hollandaise sauce makes the taco. If you're new to this place, they will do half orders on nearly everything, and make just about everything tailored to taste. Good service too. Will be back!

We came here for a Sunday brunch and decided to share something sweet apart to having our Benedict eggs. We wanted pancakes but then something on the menu called our attention: the O.M.G. French toasts. We decided to give it a try, admittedly a bit skeptical. We were blown away and we were constantly mumbling "Oh My God! this is amazing"! We had to come again the next day before leaving Phoenix back home. This time I wanted the full order for myself so I didn't  have to share it!   I would give it 5 stars because of the OMG French toasts, the Benedicts were great and tasty. The MMM mimosa was great too. The service is great and friendly. However, my only complaint was that I ordered an OJ and asked the waiter whether it was freshly squeezed OJ, he said that it was, but when I tried it, it tasted like tropicana orange juice, which is good but not what I wanted or had in mind. Other than that it is the perfect place for your breakfast and brunch cravings.

Tried this place for the first time last week and the food was great but the service wasn't the best. Even though we were seated right away, it took eight minutes before a server greeted us. After ordering, there seemed to be confusion as to who's section we were in between 2 servers and host. My family and I had to repeat our order on two different occasions along with drinks. The food deserves 5 stars but due to the service I received I only gave this restaurant three stars. Hopefully the Gilbert location will be better.

My friend and I had just flown into Phoenix from Indianapolis by way of Cincinnati in the early morning. We had a lengthy flight and had been up for quite a while without sleep or food. While picking up our car rental from Turo, the car's owner recommended this place for some coffee and breakfast, and I'm sure glad he did. The service was spectacular, the house blend coffee was fantastic, and the food was delicious. Our server, Angela, was as polite as could be and even brought us out a free sweet potato pancake fresh from the kitchen for us to try. She made us feel very welcome from the get-go. The food was simply incredible. My friend got the Snooze Classic and I got the half-and-half order of Eggs Benedict with the Chili Verde and Steak & Eggs. Everything on my plate was fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The steak was cooked a perfect medium-rare which suit the dish very well, the grilled asparagus and onions were an excellent compliment, and the pico de gallo tasted like it was picked fresh from the garden. The menu has plenty of options for every palette and the cocktail bar will satisfy anyone as well. I would definitely recommend Snooze for breakfast if you're in the Tempe area, I'd eat breakfast here every morning if I could.
Great meal with the customer service to match. My new favorite go to place for breakfast.

My husband and I have been trying to make it to Snooze for the last couple months after friends have raved about how delicious it is. We finally went this last Sunday and it didn't disappoint.   First let me say if you are looking for a quick in and out breakfast this is not your place. Expect to wait. They quoted us a 90 minute wait time. They get your cell phone number and text you when you table is ready. This works out great if you want to go next door and browse around at Nordstrom Rack. They texted us in just over an hour that our table was ready.   Service was great and the server was very knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered the Snooze spuds deluxe which was so delicious! We also ordered the pancake flight with a pineapple upside down pancake, a sweet potato pancake and a candied apple pancake. All were to die for!   This place is definitely worth the wait and I can't wait until the one in North Scottsdale is open in Kierland!
Thanks for forgetting the pico de gallo with my take-out order and not melting the cheese. Highly disappointing.

Always asking my self why this place is always busy bc after all its breakfast food  Simple eggs , simple oJ . Everything is simple  After visiting this place 5 times I think it's all  The colors of this place are very warming , the service is good and smily , the food is fresh  and come fast  Overall by far the best breakfast you can ask  The best part is the atmosphere Enjoy

I went to Snooze a few weeks back for brunch with a friend. Of course, I made the mistake of going on a Saturday morning so it was incredibly busy, but that was my own fault. I was told it would be a 20 minute wait but was seated in 10 - hooray! However, I do not like their "text" feature for alerting you when your seat is ready. At all. I much prefer the traditional method of calling out your name... Anyway, was seated and greeted by my waitress promptly, but it became apparent over the course of my visit that she was very overwhelmed. There was not an empty table the entire time I was in the restaurant. If I were a waiter there, I'd be overwhelmed too. It took quite a long time for my friend and I to get our "specialty" order drinks - chai tea - and it was not very good. Extremely bland and at $4 a glass, I had hoped for more. The French toast was delicious but the serving size was small for the price. My water was only refilled once and I left the restaurant very thirsty. All in all, I'd go back. I really would. But not on a weekend morning when the wait staff is too busy to refill drinks.

My wife and I visited around 7:00 on Labor Day. I really wanted to like Snooze.   Very nice decor and a friendly waitress, but the food let the team down.  I ordered eggs over medium with chicken sausage and an english muffin.  The eggs were over easy.  The english muffin was slightly warm, but not toasted.  I had to ask for jam. The chicken sausage was  very peppery, cayanne, maybe.  The peppery sausage taste mystified our waitress who cheerfully offer to bring me something else.  But the replacement sausage links never arrived.  The only really good thing on my plate was the hash browns which were quite nice.  She ordered the blueberry danish pancakes.  They were dry enough that she had to request syrup on the side.  One or two bites of the pancakes tasted like onions/peppers.  Something was off in the kitchen.

Checked in at 9:14am. 50 min later got the table. At 10:30 still waiting for food. Did not expect 2 hours to get granola with yogurt to be served which requires zero cooking...last time I visited this eatery. If you have hours to kill then please come again. If you want food in reasonable time, please check liberty market or other eateries.
Seriously, Snooze is the best. Food is awesome, service is friendly, atmosphere is great. Love this place!

The décor in this restaurant was so cute; it was very retro.  The breakfast menu was extensive making it hard to make a decision. We ended up with the breakfast burrito (very good, the green chili made it) and the homemade granola (awesome) along with 1 flight sized pineapple upside down pancake, which was the best pancake I have every had!  I also like the option to get a flight of pancakes to try all of their wonderful varieties.  The coffee was also very good and our server was very friendly and helpful.  I cannot wait to visit AZ and hit this place up again!

I like Snooze. First time I tried it was in North Park in San Diego. I'm deducting 1 star because I found the OMG French Toast at this location to be more undercooked and less tasty than the one in San Diego. My advice: get here early like I did unless you want to wait outside in line for a seat. Happy eating

The food was what got this place up to two stars. It was pretty tasty if you are willing to spend half your day on breakfast. This is probably the most poorly managed restaurant I have been to in years. Put your name down and go have breakfast somewhere else. By the time your name is called it should be time for lunch. After years in the industry restaurants are all about the experience and less about the food. The food was good here for the most part aside from the hash browns. For a larger sized restaurant serving breakfast food I do not understand how on earth anyone would have to wait any longer than 40 minutes, but this seems standard to Snooze. I guess if you have a half a day to spend and your bored it's a great place for people watching and you will get to eat eventually. I won't be back again.
i fucking love this place!!! it is a foodgasm in your mouth!! bloodies are to die for. hollandaise is sent straight from the gods  i love you guys

Can you say overrated? Why people eat here will always puzzle me. I would rather go to Denny's because at least their food comes out warm and the hash browns have some flavor. Tried this place twice now and will not return.

Definitely not worth it! After going to snooze I was disappointed in the food. I ordered the Danish Blueberry pancakes and they were cold when served and bland. I maybe ate half of the plate and didn't even want to take the rest home. I also ordered a side of hash browns and two scrambled eggs. The hash browns had no flavor and were too soft for my liking. The eggs weren't even good. I honestly wish we had gone to IHOP instead and that is saying something.

I had some frittata and absolutely loved it. Boyfriend had corn beef hash and said it was also amazing. Drinks were awesome, don't get the bourbon bloody though. Yuck! We sat at the bar, and service was good.  Wish their menu was more easily readable, but the excellent food will be enough to bring us back.
Great food and atmosphere. Juana tacos were my favorite but I also tried two varieties of eggs Benedict which were also great.
Service is very good but the wait time was a lot. However, they had ping pong table so it wasn't very boring to wait. Food is good but the portions are very small.
The food was really yummy and the restaurant was really cute. However the bacon had a odd taste which was a little disappointing.

Such a cool atmosphere! Reminded me of the Jetsons cartoon in some ways. Great place to share the food. I'd back off on the peanut butter on the pancake by like 75% haha soooo good. They also have gluten free options here. Great to see them on top of their game with that becoming more popular.   Service was very fun and friendly and we all know what it takes for that this early in the morning.. #appreciated haha

This is my new favorite breakfast spot. The menu has such a wide variety of dishes to choose from. I had the pancake flight and it was absolutely delicious! Service was great, tasty food, fun atmosphere...what else could you possibly need? Yum! Will be back for sure!

Whenever I come to Arizona I visit Snooze for breakfast! I come 4-5 times a year. The food is so good! The service is even better! I return and ask for Paige when I'm here. She remembers me and really makes me feel like a VIP. I love the OMG the most! Paige recommended it. I have tried nearly everything on the menu. It's all amazing, but the OMG is still number one!
there coffee is amazing- food and service amazing love this place. The waitress was a little snobby and stuck up when I was trying to be friendly and talk to her but whatever

Best breakfast place in Phoenix.  The wait is usually pretty long, but it is well worth it.  Staff is friendly and will make balloon animals while you wait.  We have had the eggs benedict, many types of pancakes, and french toast and everything has been amazing.
Very cool atmosphere. I like the round tables. Very good customer service. Nice menu that has a variety of new breakfast ideas.

I love breakfast, but hate pancakes. Snooze has now changed my mind on pancakes because they're freaking amazing!! Sweet potato pancake & the cinnamon roll one are to die for! The portions are huge, which is nice to leave breakfast/brunch without already thinking of lunch. A new location just opened in Gilbert & I will be frequenting that location to get my fill of all these delicious breakfast offerings.
Be prepared to wait, but it's worth it. This is far and away the best breakfast place around. Everything is good here, especially the bloody marys.

Been there a lot of time with my friend Michelle service has always been great we usually go on a Saturday or Sunday worth the 30 minute wait staff is friendly and helpful the managers Matt and Ramon are the best

This was my second visit here, after a not so great first, and couldn't be happier. The food was absolutely delicious. I had the Ham Benedict III and my woman had the Egg omelet. We also split the pancake of the day which was a raspberry with almonds.   Karla was our waitress and was an absolute killer. She checked on us multiple times, offered input on what we should get and explained the pancake of the day in detail. Have not had a better waitress than her in a very long time!

Service was superb - and sitting on the patio in a warm spring morning was nothing short of inspiring.    I ordered the Snooze Spuds Deluxe with the green chili.  Everyone at the table ordered something different - i apologize profusely I don't remember their orders - but I do remember mine - very very very (did I say Very?!) good!  Wow - great combination of flavors, perfectly cooked, spiced just right, and the right amount to fill a big boy like me without overdoing it.  Server was there just enough to take care of us and ensure drinks were filled and any needs taken care of.    I'll be back.

Make sure you get here early if you want a table without having to wait for at least an hour. (Although they take your number and since it's in an outdoor shopping center you can pass time by shopping).   I'm on a no caffeine and low salt diet. Unfortunately they do not have an online nutrition menu - really wish they did! However the waitress told me they could cook my hash browns without any salt which was great! Loved how crunchy it was! A little on the greasy side, but it didn't taste like it was drenched in it. I ordered a decaf iced vanilla latte, she said they only had decaf in hot but offered to put that over ice for me and it worked great! I would definitely come back again!
Cool vibe however, my mimosa wasn't cold, my food wasn't warm and the pancakes were dry --- other than the pineapple upside down pancake. A little bit over priced for what you're getting.

If you like salmon try the Benny Goodman. It is awesome. I know this place is eco-friendly but this is Arizona - get a misting system on your patio or you are going to be sued for people and dogs dying waiting on their food.  The shade on the patio area is extreme inadequate,

First time here and it was simply the best breakfast I've had in AZ .  I got the 1/2 and 1/2 Benny's with Ham Benedict III and Winter Harvest Benny. We also got the Corned Beef Hash and they even gave us a free pancake to try.. Let's just call it the world perfect pancake .. There were about 10 other things we wanted to try .. But next time .. Our server was Kate and she made us the most amazing Boss Hog Bloody mary's .. The whole staff was professional and considering it was a mid day Sunday morning, we got top notch service .. the food was hot and delicious and fast !! This takes a team effort .. This is because of a great management by Candace .. the place ran like a charm .. Thank  Rylie & Kate .. we loved it!! PS please recreate the Breakfast shot It would. be perfect for your place .. The one with OJ Butterscotch schnapps, bourbon strawberry liquor and hot bacon on top .. You could name it after me lol
Always a great breakfast.  Highly recommend giving it a try. You will leave fulfilled...and maybe ready for a nap.

I can't believe this place is rated so high?!?! I was there for Easter, we showed up about 7:45 am. The restaurant was only about 1/3 full when we arrived, so we were excited that there was no wait. We were seated at a table very quickly when we walked in. Soon after the whole experience went in the toilet! We were seated at the very end of the restaurant furthest from the front door. This was not an issue, there were several tables that had patrons as well as the tables on both side had families. We looked over the menu and waited patiently for the server. We sat for 15 minutes before I got up to find the manager. It would have not been so bad if the servers taking care of the tables around us had at least acknowledged us. When I did get to talk to the manager I completely unloaded, I ! I went back to the table, just as a server showed up. He took our order and was trying to make things better. After a little while he showed up with a special treat to make things better, it would have been great if our food had not showed up at almost the same time. Oh wait, they took our food to the table next to us and started setting it down, as the people told them they had already eaten. To finish this long post up the food was ok but it was probably made worse because of the beginning experience. I won't be recommending the place to anyone I know, especially since we never spoke to the manager after I let him have it. He never came back over to check on us.

2 words...raw pancake. And other words to add: slow wait, incorrect wait times, uncomfortably close seating.   The food in unique and tasty, never had an issue until my 4-5th time here (the wait to me was always worth it) when I got my pancake served raw and uncooked. :( sad to say that (as well as birds attacking us on the patio) may have been the finally verdict on us never returning.

We were here recently while celebrating our anniversary, and the customer service was AMAZING. Blake went above and beyond and really turned what could have been a negative experience into the opposite. We'll definitely be back   The food: Husband built his own omelet and loved it. I got the salmon plate and it was goooood and surprisingly filling! The palomimosa and Bloody Mary were  too
This place is very good for breakfast but the wait time is almost unbearable. The food is good and the atmosphere is awesome just know you will probably wait a good 30-45 minutes for a table.

I've always heard good things about Snooze but was quite hesitant because it was still kind of pricey for breakfast. My friends and I decided to go to this location knowing the one in Tempe was going to a really long wait.  We were seated almost right away around 8:30.  I got the blueberry danish pancakes (the two full sized ones) and I definitely underestimated the sizing. I definitely have a sweet tooth and the sweetness of the toppings of the pancakes were to perfection. The pancakes were actually pretty thick and fluffy. Because of the size, i would assume that it would be slightly dry or burnt but it wasn't at all. Both pancakes were fluffy and soft. Overall, I would definitely come here again.

I always take pictures of my food but at snooze I straight up didn't have time the first time because it was so freaking delicious. I have since been at least a few times and have some more to say   I haven't seen anyone talking about their shrimp and grits but it's really good! Perfectly spicy. I'm saying that as someone from NOLA!   The hot chocolate is also delicious! Strong recommend!   The sweet potato pancake is a must! We have ordered it a la carte and it was worth the almost $5. I couldn't have 3 myself just because I can't handle that must sticky, thick sweet. The pancake itself has the perfect amount of sweet though. Sometimes we get it in the flight if we are really feeling ambitious. It goes well with the pineapple upside down!    I will say their hash browns really aren't something to call home about. It's the only part of the meal I felt we could've done without.   Service was good, prompt, kind. Seated outside which can sometimes be hazardous (they have bee problems like everywhere else in Tempe). It's a good place to take someone to Brunch if you want to seem hip.

This was my second time here. The atmosphere is pretty busy being next to the campus! Very lively. The only thing I didn't like is that our mimosas came  out warm so I wasn't able to drink it. The French toast was better the first time I came. I had the make your own Omelet and that was pretty tasty with jalapeños and barbecoa! I will be back.
Excellent eatery. Good energy and chill. Great food. Always come back to where the belly is satisfied.

They have some cool stuff on their menu. As a vegan, Im glad they have options like Soyrizo and Tofu Scramble. If you see these items ala carte they are a few bucks but for some reason when you order them they end up being around $10-15. Sort of strange.

Took my daughter to breakfast waited an hour. The service was amazing the food looked and tasted superb!! Only complaint I had was the food arrived  luke warm and I thought it should have been a little warmer.  Other than that we had a wonderful time! We will be back.
Waited over an hour for the table.  Food was good but not worth the wait in my opinion.  Did like that they can cater to the gluten free pretty easily.
Had a delicious breakfast in a lovely open-air atmosphere. The service was fantastic and the manager Garrett was awesome!!

My review is super late (sorry) as this was from my one and only visit last Fall.  I had a girlfriend in from out of town and decided to try this place as it was new in Gilbert.   I wish we had gone a little further down the block to a restaurant I had already dined at.      We were there on a Friday morning   We got there after what I figured was the early rush but still had to wait 15 mins to be sat despite all the open tables (we counted 5 people ahead of us at the counter waiting to be sat).  We sat outside as it appeared to be the least busy (bar was wide open and I wish we had sat there, but since she's from a cold weather town we figured let's sit outside).  The coffee was undrinkable.  I'm not sure where they get it from, but even an artificial sweeter wouldn't help improve the flavor.  Our order was pretty straight forward - nothing special or altered from the menu.  Yet we waited over 25 mins for the food.  Our server never offered an explanation as to what the delay was.  When the food finally arrived,  my friends omelette was not cooked all the way.  She didn't want to risk sending it  back as we were supposed to be on the road for a day trip to Flagstaff 15 mins. prior.  She picked the ingredients out of the omelette that she could eat and finished my toast,   I haven't been able to work up the nerve to go back and try them again.  I see the crowds of people waiting outside every Saturday morning as I head into Postino's for my breakfast.  I stick with what I know and what hasn't let me down.

So , just got sat down at snooze for our early Mother's Day , breakfast for the wife . The wait was a bit long , but as expected for a weekend . The staff at snooze is , well , awesome . They saw that I was a bit perturbed about something and boy did they come through and throughly make me feel better . The brought me a sinister pancake off their secret menu . Yes , they have a secret menu . And the sinister pancake is awesome ! Both my kids and wife enjoyed it , as did I . On a side note I was drink

If your not in a hurry and you don't mind to wait a while for your food. This is a great place for breakfast. Minus a star because we had to wait at the door for someone to help us and there were plenty on open tables. Our food took for everyone come out. My silverware was dirty. The food was okay. I would recommend them and come again.

Food was subpar. Background music was so loud that I couldn't hear myself think or talk to my friends across the table. There are tons of consistently reliable breakfast places in this town. This is not one of them.

This place is awesome,had the best breakfast tacos I've ever had in my life, cappuccino on point, left there feeling like I just took a mini vacation! Special thanks to Lyle for incredible service, and Cameron for running such a great place! I'll definitely be back soon

I couldn't decide between the blueberry pancakes and the pumpkin. The waiter suggested one of each, which I found a wonderful option....until 2 pancakes the size of my head arrived. Oh my, way too much, but delish! Oh....go with the blueberry......yum!
Great social place!  Even offers vegan options.  Waitress was knowledgeable and super friendly.

Everything I've tried here has been pretty darn amazing! Yes they have a long wait and are very busy, especially if you go on a weekend, but the food and friendliness of the staff is worth the wait to me.
Was pleased with the atmosphere and service. Food was outstanding. Loved the welcoming attitude on the patio towards people with dogs.  This is a place I will go back to often.

This place is out of this world! My wife and I visited on a weekday morning, and it was packed. Luckily there was only about a 15 minute wait. We managed to pass the time by playing ping pong on the patio. I got the pancake sampler including Sweet Potato Pancakes! It was delicious. Very comfortable setting, nice attentive staff. I will definitely be returning.

A little late on my review but this place is great for breakfast/brunch. It does get very busy so expect a wait. I ended up coming about an hour before they close and was able to get a seat at the bar straight away.   The mimosas are totally worth it. I think they were about $6 but they are big and you can tell there is enough champagne in there.   Highly recommend the eggs Benedict. I had the dui of Bella Bella benny and ham benedict III. The Bella Bella was my favorite. Definitely get the hash browns extra crispy... tastes way better.   There is so much to choose from and everything that came out of the kitchen looked delicious.

Our pineapple upside down cake had chocolate in it...  I think when they're busy it's a little too overwhelming and things might get confused aka extra ingredients that arnt suppose to be there... Amazing pancake still

Usually quite packed in here and very noisy. All of the employees are casual and upbeat. The food comes out fairly quick, and drinks are always being refilled. The hash-browns always seem to be overly salted/seasoned making them hard to enjoy. The cinnamon roll pancakes are very good and have a little bit of crunch to them!

I have eaten at Snooze three times and each time I have been so impressed. Be prepared to wait as this place is popular. But once you are seated the service is excellent. With how busy they are, I am so impressed with how fast they come out with the beverages and food. The servers are super helpful and friendly. As a vegan I am grateful for their tofu scramble and soy chorizo. They know what vegan is and can make the appropriate modifications without hesitation. And did I mention the food is delicious? I also love their fun cocktails and coffee drinks.
Snooze is a breakfast spot for every time i visit Tempe. Amazing breakfast tacos and cute retro look. Wait staff is also very friendly and helpful.

My family's go to breakfast spot!! Seriously delicious food and a very relaxed atmosphere! But be prepared to wait-- usually a 40minute wait, even closer to lunchtime. I love the fact that they rotate the menu seasonally! Makes for awesome and delicious choices. My current favorite are the chilequilles Benedict (it has a fancier name but whatever). Instead of English muffin, the base is a delicious layer of corn tortillas and it's stuffed with barbocoa and cheese and an amazing green chili hollandaise. Sooooo good! I also love the fact they let you mix and match different types, so you can really customize to your taste bud's delight! Don't forget to do the pancake flight! The blueberry Danish pancakes are amazeballs-- not for the faint-hearted sweets hater. Also, not for diabetics. ;) Can be pricey for the overall meal, but very much well-worth it!!

Worst service I ever had.  Toast wasn't even toast it was just slices of bread.  The bacon was hardly cooked and flimsy, and it was cold.  Eggs were scrambled and cold.  Very disappointed i would highly recommend Denny's over Snooze any day of the week.

Food is pretty good. The hostess table is run AMAZINGLY!!  The issue is the service.  It just feels like everyone could use training.  I will say the blueberry pancakes are AWESOME!! They actually have blueberries in them!

My friend and I stopped here for brunch and it was really good! It was a Saturday, late morning, and my first thought when walking in was, "Call ahead of time for a reservation." The place was incredibly packed and they don't have a ton of room inside to wait for a table to open up, but the wait time was around 40-50 minutes at 10am. So just make a mental note of that being the number one thing to do when coming here  My second recommendation would be to not sit outside. My pregnant friend was getting rather hungry so we agreed to be seated outside. Alas, when you live in Arizona and the sun is the devil himself at times, that was not such a good idea. Normally they have misters and shade but our little spot was out of reach for both, thus naturally we were quite sweaty by the end of the meal. Not worth it. Just call ahead for an inside spot.   Overall, the food was good! We split an omelette and the O.M.G. french toast, with the french toast living up to its fame for sure. Omelette was good also, I wish they would allow more toppings though (you can pick three, the rest are about $.75 extra to $1.50). My one biggest complaint has to be how much everything is on the side. Meals themselves are decently priced, around $9-$12, but to get something like pico de gallo (just a little cup) is $.75 and orange juice for one glass was $3, so we found that to be a bit too much. Waitress and hosts were friendly, however; the store in the front is so jam packed it gave a very chaotic feel to the front of the house which is the other thing I wasn't impressed with. It took a while just for us to be on the waiting list.  So, final thoughts on Snooze: We will be returning. Mostly because the french toast was delicious. Omelette was tasty but there is only so much you can do to one, and it wasn't anything to write home about. If you are coming here get something exciting because if the rest of their pancake and waffle dishes are like the O.M.G. one, you won't be disappointed. Not bad for an Instagram restaurant!
Worth the wait! Try the strawberry fields pancakes - such a unique combo. The outdoor seating is fun.

Coffee. Donut. Pancakes. Together in one marvelous dish. Breakfast is my favorite meal, so I have high standards, and this place met every one of them. Not only is it located in a trendy area near ASU, but the whole place is well-branded with their logo on everything. They had coffee available while you wait for a table. At 10AM on a Saturday, we only had to wait 15 minutes for a table for 3. The coffee and donut pancakes were amazing -- made with Granny Smith apples and served with a coffee cream to be used like syrup. My sister got a breakfast sandwich on a pretzel bun, which was unique and good. Their hash brown were also really good. Very friendly service! Highly recommended.

It was 11 on a Friday; no wait.  I was seated right away even though I was still waiting for a friend- so maybe the complaints about not being seated until the whole party arrived has to do with really busy times! Fun, energetic servers... The food was delicious!  My friend had a Benedict duo and I had a breakfast burrito.  It really was a great time.

Went with a friend for brunch.  The food was inventive and delicious!  Many ingredients are locally sourced and nothing was just "run of the mill". It seems like everything has a special touch or detail. We ate so much and were beyond stuffed. Service was lovely and prompt, server was engaged and friendly. We would love to go back!

Absolutely love this place.  Worth the wait.  Love that they text you when they are ready to seat you.  Have eaten there twice recently with friends and they all raved about it as well.  My favorite so far is an omelette with chorizo, spinach, and barbacoa.  So good.

I took a chance even though this was our 1st meal of 2014, but after reading all the other glowing reviews and viewing the menu I couldn't resist.  I'm soo glad because this was hands down the best breakfast we have ever had!  I'm not going to get too descriptive but instead state that in every category they score 5 out of 5 stars!

Wow.   Can I take this place back to Alabama with me?   Seriously though. This dining experience was well worth the 30 minute wait! The code was delicious,  the service was excellent and the food was delicious!   What we ordered: Corned Beef Hash (substituted the Candy Apple Pancake for the toast....trust me, it is worth it!)  Chilaquiles Benny  The only down side for me was that I ordered my eggs over medium and they were brought to me over easy.

Snooze is the real-deal breakfast spot. I'm so happy to have finally made it here, and even happier that it's so close to the Arcadia area.  The corned beef hash was amazing and definitely made in house which is an absolute "must". The bacon, thick cut and seasoned perfectly. I came here with my brother and he had a combination of two different eggs benedict (awesome that you can combine two different ones into a single dish) and a pineapple pancake. Every single part of the meal was fantastic.  To top it off the coffee was served hot and the service was on point with recommendations and timeliness. Definitely recommend if you can stand to wait at least 10-15 minutes even if it's not a busy weekend morning - this place gets packed quick, and for good reason!

It's ok.  So many good brunch places in Phoenix. I won't be back. Long wait yet tables were always empty. Take to long to seat. My French toast was not that great. Maybe someone else will have better luck.

Delicious and cute retro breakfast spot! I had the Benny duo, Eggs Benedict one traditional style and the other was with lochs & capers, with hash browns & coffee. I was more than satisfied with this dish.
We are here for he first time last weekend and everyone in our party (6 total) were extremely pleased with our meals! We had the nicest server, and we can't wait to go back!

I wish i could give 10 star.  Having brunch with my mom today.  And I just witness the most spectacular touching moment.  This gentlemen walked into the restaurant, I mean barely walked in.  He had a hard time sitting down.  One of the employees quickly walked up to him and made sure he wouldn't fall off his chair.  He ordered his meal. His meal came out, not long after this woman came up and asked if he needed help cutting his sandwich.  She cut it and he started to eat. (Our tears began rolling). This gentlemen was struggling. Before I knew it this young woman was walking up with gloves in her hand to help him eat.   Yes,  I was in major tears by now.  I offered to pay for his meal but Snooze, an A.M. Eatery told me they would take care of it.   Not only does this establishment have delicious food, but honestly even if they didn't, they just gained a faithful customer.   Every employee that crossed passed with this man was caring and showed empathy.  Most amazing act of kindness ever!

My wife and I talk about going here all week. When Saturday comes we jump out of bed so we can get there early and skip the crowds. I won't bother to recommend anything because we've both had almost everything on the menu and I have yet to be disappointed. If you're into breakfast then this is a place you HAVE to try.

Great place with a small but tasty menu and craft cocktails for breakfast. The breakfast pot pie is awesome and so are the Chilaquiles! seating and parking (at the tempe location) are always a gamble though.

This place is a little pricey for me personally (I'm pretty cheap) but god is it good. The Spuds deluxe is to die for but I'd recommend a half-order if you don't plan on sharing. Also highly recommend treating yourself to a mimosa. Friendly staff, good atmosphere/music. Don't really love the patio but its pretty necessary as the place is quite small.

Seriously?????? People don't have a clue about food. You put up a cute interior that looks like the "Jetson's" cartoon and they will come regardless of food and service. Wife and I arrived on a Thursday around 9:30 and they put us on a wait list and said it would be 15 minutes. They call u by texting your cell. Problem was that after 40 minutes I went in to see what was going on and the host said he texted me 10 minutes ago. Well he wrote down the wrong cell # and said "oops, will put u back on the list". I told him "so for your mistake u want me to wait again?" He realized that wasn't right so he sat us. After we sat, the waitress greeted us 5 minutes later and we ordered coffee. Which btw, the little cue card on the table says the owner searches all over Costa Rica for the right coffee beans. Hmmm, then he must have went to Folgers plant located there cause it ain't nothin special. Again, 10 minutes pass and we get to order. I had a scramble and the wife had the corned beef hash. Trying to flag down our waitress for a coffee refill was difficult as she was more concerned on how she looked in her LuLu lemon yoga pants rather than on the customers.  Food arrives.  My scramble was slopped together overcooked dry and the potatoes are put in a mold to look fancy, not!  Wife's corned beef....in edible, tasted like it was sitting out for hours & extremely sour. Waitress never bothered to ask how the meal was or thank you, just put check on table. $30 for 2 pathetic excuses for food and 1 "mystery" coffee. We got duped!!!!!  Be wise and take a stand, no more eating at places just cause it looks "cool".  Yeah.. I guess u could say I was pissed writing this review. In closing Snooze, is the correct name for it..snooze.
First time here, a must is the Breakfast Pot Pie my friend got that plate and it was delicious! I even wanted to trade him for my Snooze Spuds Deluxe.

The Ambience was casual and quaint. The food was good, rich and tasty, bold and colorful. I gave four out of five stars due to the proportion size. It was about an hour wait at 9:30 in the morning. Service was good as well as the prices  were decent

If I could give this place a 10, I would! This place was just phenomenal.. from the ambience.. really open and airy (if that even makes sense) it has a nice outdoor seating area and even a boche ball game for you to play.. to the friendly and fast service( despite the 30 min wait.. which let's fave it.. all good spots will have a wait) and the most important.. FOOD!  Now the food.. my god! The flavors in our meals.. were just the BOMB! I had some benedict.. with a green sauce, pico de gallo and tortillas..can't remember NAMES RIght now.. but let's just say I didn't leave one BIT behind! The mimosas were phenomenal.. not too much OJ and not too much bubbly(even tho I wouldn't have complained for that lol) overall the food was so good, that I can't wait to bring my NY friends here since were such brunchers out there lol

We sat for 10 min before asking someone if we could get a drink order in. Other tables sat after us were served drinks and food before we even got our drinks. Food was decent. The cold brew coffee is horrible would not recommend that to anyone. Cool spot with a cool vibe just disappointing service.

We went here for the first time and loved it! We had to wait about 20 mins for a table but it went pretty fast the place was very very packed we got a nice table outside. I had eggs sausage and pancake very very good loved it all. We will for sure be going back to this place for some great breakfast and mimosas. They are also dog friendly so feel free to bring your dog!

Disappointed. While a cute place (branding and decor), this restaurant should have spent a little more time and money on training their wait staff on efficiency and service. After being seated it was 15 minutes before our server greeted us and once he greeted us took our drink order & food order - that was the last time we saw him until it was time to pay the check (which came LONG after we were finished with our meal). No checking in, no refilling of beverages...bum deal.  The food - eh. Ordered the Reuben & Sweet potato pancakes. Ruben was cold, dry, and really lacked in flavor, the pretzel bun was just ....overwhelming. Pancakes were surprisingly flavorless - this was really a drag as we were so looking forward to them.   Summary: 1st and last visit complete for this place.
Best breakfast in town. Do yourself a favor and get the sweet potato pancake. Wait time has been half as long as they told us. Great service!
Fun place. Was bit of a wait to be seated but the food was very good. Another great eatery in downtown Gilbert!! Service was also very friendly. Will go back again.

I have been to Snooze at both the Tempe and this location, the service is very good along with the food. The only instance I had bad service the manager was nice enough to pay for the entire meal. I really love the taste of the coffee at this restaurant as well. My server the other day was Molly and she was great!
This is my favorite spot for Breakfast. Great service, delicious food, and yummy drinks. Highly recommend this location. I go here at least once a week.

The place is definitely a cute place to come eat, great atmosphere and friendly servers. The food wasn't exactly up to par. I was hearing a lot of rav about this and decided to check it out. The food was all that great like everyone says, I think it's just the atmosphere that made up for it. Overall this place was ok in the food department

Satisfied brunch.  I tend to steer clear of chains and when a friend suggested we go, I honestly let out a sigh. The wait was long but the food was surprisingly worth the wait. I wanted a little salty and sweet combo so they let me upgrade my Benny hash browns for a piece of French toast (at an up charge). It was too much to eat at once but my cold leftovers were just as delicious. The price is reasonable and everyone in our party left very satisfied.

I came here today and got the Winter Harvest Benedict and it was the best I've ever had, along with the Gazpacho Bloody Mary which was extraordinary... But what I really want to point out is the service. It was on point. Olivia was my server and along with her warm and welcoming attitude, she made it a great experience. I'll definitely be coming back for all of the above. Ask for Olivia, she's amazing! :)
Is I lived in Phoenix, this place would be a staple for me. I had eggs and hash and my friend had eggs Benedict. Loved them both.

IN THIS CASE IF YOU SNOOZE YOU DON'T LOSE!  I've been to the Snooze in San Diego a couple times and absolutely loved the place.  In that Yelp review I said I was happy that they didn't have one here in Phoenix.  Cause if they did then I would turn into a fat ass from being there so much. So when I saw they opened up a Snooze out here I had to go.  This Snooze doesn't look as good or as big as the one in San Diego. But I came here for the food and the food did not completely disappoint.  What drew me there to begin with was the pineapple upside down pancakes.  I had a pancake flight, which allows you to pick 3 different pancakes.    I got the pineapple upside down, the carrot, and sweet potato pancakes along with the Green Eggs and Hammich.  The sandwich was good, but it wasn't anything great on the same level of the pancakes.  My girlfriend had the Sandwich I am and it was pretty bland.  I ended up being a good boyfriend and switching sandwiches with her since she liked mine.  Her daughter got chocolate chip pancakes.    The reason i couldn't give this Snooze 5 stars is because of the service and the wait time.  We had to wait for about 45 minutes for a table on a Saturday morning. Now granted it was Saturday and even the Snooze in San Diego you had to wait a while for a table.  But the difference with that one was every seat was packed. And when they told you that your table was ready, your table was ready.  Here they text you to let you know that your table is ready. Then we had to wait another 5 minutes for our table to ready. The Snooze out here looked like it still had quite a bit of room to seat a good portion of people who were waiting to get tables. We sat on the patio cause it was quicker and they still had a whole other corner that could be used for seating.  For some reason they have a ping pong table taking up that whole area instead.  The other reason is the service.  Our waitress was nice but she was very neglectful, at least to our table anyway.  She brought the chocolate chip pancakes with no syrup.  she didn't come back around to ask us if we wanted anymore water, napkins, or anything else. I had to get up and grab some hot sauce from the service cart myself.  She was going around to all the other tables around us asking them if they needed anything, going over menu items with other patrons.  The 2 ladies who sat across from us had a dog with them and the dog got better service than us.  Speaking of dogs, i love dogs. If you want to bring dogs into the restaurant that's all fine and good. But to have the dog sitting at the table with you while you eat (and not a little dog either) that's a bit much.   Like i said she wasn't mean by any means, but she was not a good waitress. Will i be back at Snooze? DUH! Does a frog bump its ass when he hops?  Of course i will be there again.  The pineapple upside down pancakes are what brought me there and the pancakes are what will keep me coming back.
Pancakes and hot chocolate are out of this world. One of my favorite breakfast spots!

Snooze is a great breakfast spot. They have something for everyone and their seasonal pancakes are always on point.  They also have some of the best breakfast drinks I've found. The mimosa is solid, they make a mean greyhound and the mayan mocha will really wake you up!  Be prepared to wait for seating - this place is BUSY (but worth it).

If you're craving a delicious breakfast, Snooze has you covered.  They have something for everyone  - sweet pancakes, traditional eggs and sausage, and even some spicy eggs benedict. Plus, Snooze has a full bar and they make a mean Greyhound.  Snooze is always busy, so make sure to get there before you're starving. We've had to wait just under an hour on a busy Saturday morning, but it's worth the wait!

One of my favorite new brunch spots! Unfortunately, it's always packed (both this location and the one in Gilbert), but that's a good thing :) Amazing food, amazing mimosas! The people at both locations are awesome, too. If you get there early, you'll be in and out. But pretty much anytime after 8am, expect a long (but well worth it) wait.

One of my favorite new brunch spots! Unfortunately, it's always packed (both this location and the one in Tempe), but that's a good thing :) Amazing food, amazing mimosas! The people at both locations are awesome, too. If you get there early, you'll be in and out. But pretty much anytime after 8am, expect a long (but well worth it) wait.

All breakfast-focused eateries has to be compared to Matt's Big Breakfast, and Snooze is a worthy contender.  Snooze just opened and is really popular.  We suffered through a 45 minute wait for two.   Gave them my cell phone saying they would text me when a table was ready.   This works better than the buzzer system because it give us range to explore Town & Contry Shopping Center.  I settled on the tasty Breakfast Pot Pie with a cup-shape of hash browns.  Yes, a cup   Every other hash brown I had was low and float like a pancake.  Snooze's hash brown was in the shape of a small bowl.  Whatever the shape, it was good!    Snooze is busy, slow (in service)  and loud.    Still, I like this place.   They have a number of menu items I would like to try when I return.  To get to five stars, tighten up the service (which was slow) and find a way to lighten up on the noise and we got something pretty special here.

I came here again with a large group of people on a Sunday morning. Our seating was a bit awkward in that staff moved a u-shaped table up to a booth so we all could be together. I'm not complaining about that as that's just how things work when a place is busy. My biggest complaint in my original review was the awful music. I upgrade this to 4 stars as the music was a bit kinder and gentler this time around.

Five stars for our server Kaitlyn, she was excellent. It was busy, as to be expected on a Saturday or Caturday as all the girls wear t-shirts with cats on them, but she was still super attentive. My husband and I shared Juan's Tacos and a flight of pancakes consisting of Pineapple Upside Down, Blueberry & Strawberry Shortcake.  The toppings on the pancakes were all amazing, Blueberry was my favorite. The pancakes themselves were ok, I would never order them plain, they are small and something you could make at home. The tacos came on corn tortillas, we added bacon (which was done to perfection), with eggs, pico and a tasty green chile hollandaise. We added sriracha to make them even better. My only complaint about the tacos were the giant chunks of onion in the pico, they were so large it was like I asked for extra onion.  The place is super loud as many other reviews have stated, so don't expect to have intimate conversation, and it's decor is cheesy ultra-hipster.

Came here on a Sat morning after hiking A mountain. Got here about 8:30am and no wait and got seated immediately. We asked to be seated outside because the weather was gorgeous after it rained the day before.  My friend ordered the Breakfast Pot Pie which was a lot of food that filled up her plate. I ordered Juans Breakfast tacos which comes in a trio. It was a little on the lighter side but my friend and I shared plates. Highly recommend the Mmm  Mmm mimosas which has OJ and Pomegranate liqueur....So good and refreshing!

I love breakfast and I think Snooze does a decent job. But only when I go in. When I call ahead, 50% of the time my order is incorrect. It's small things like forgetting cheese in my scramble or my extra hollandaise, but these kind of things add up. The food is consistently good, though the hash browns are sometimes a bit undercooked. It's good, but try some other breakfast places before you make up your mind to wait an hour.

I had a great first visit to this breakfast eatery.  I had a cheese potato and ham breakfast.  My buddy had the corned beef hash.  We were both very happy with our meals and our coffee.   I would like to try this place out a couple more times just to make certain before I give it five stars.    As a side note, a famous former Phoenix Sun was also eating here and was kind enough to take a photo with us.
Very nice to site outside in a shaded area. Food and service was outstanding will come back

Came here early on a Saturday morning. Sat at the bar and Ordered two coffees and breakfast. My significant others coffee was awful.  We informed the girl working behind the counter (Leia? Leigh? Lea?) that he didn't like his drink. She immediately fixed the problem and gave him samples of coffee to try to rectify the problem. Food was good, always is. The kitchen is quick and does their job correctly. Good place for breakfast!

I have to give 3 stars. Food was really good when you dine in. Not as good for take out. It doesn't seem to travel well. Our waitress today(monday so slow day with wait staff wrapping silverware) never came back to refill drink and I left thirsty so that wasn't great. We waited a while for the check. Rrally enjoyed the food though. French toast and my son had tomato soup and geilled cheese.
YES to their pancakes YES to their sandwiches. Eggs Benedict wasn't my favorite. If you're looking for some tasty breakfast you didn't have to make yourself, it perfectly hits the spot.
Super fun place to eat!! Great menu and great service!!! Bloody Mary with Bacon!!!!!! Yes!!!
Came to eat here with my girlfriend. The service here is unmatched and the food was delicious! Definitely plan on coming back (:
The art of Hollandaise is incredible! Pretty noisy but the food is worth it. The drink menu is fantastic.

We did not have great service so that could have made the difference but our portions were small and over priced. Drinks were really good and food was just ok. Probably should have gotten the pancakes... We won't be rushing to come back here... Interior and atmosphere was very nice

Slow service, small portion, coffee unfilled. Average food.  Could not get an English muffin right. Uncooked, then burnt. Server was kind of clueless.   To charge high price they need to deliver a good experience. Failed to do so.
Such an awesome selection of food and always high quality. Their soy chai's are amazing! If you haven't been... You should! Your tummy will thank you.
Delicious and staff is unbelievably friendly! Ready for some decadent modern pancakes? This is your spot. Everything is tasty!!!

Snooze Gilbert is a wonderful place to eat, with a vibrant atmosphere. From the quaint handmade coffee mugs to the life changing pancakes, this place is where you need to be for breakfast!   Suggestions :)  Try the breakfast tacos with bacon and avocado on them or sweeten things up with a cinnamon roll pancake (best thing ever)!  Between the food and the service you won't be let down!
Great service and food as always was amazing the Bella Bella benny my favorite! My girlfriend got the Choco chip pancakes and her first time and she was satisfied!

Have seen this place several times when visiting the area, but it has always been closed. Happens that it's only breakfast til 2ish, but I'll be making frequent visits here. Def an add to the fav breakfast spots.   Friendly staff, great ambiance, and delicious Eggs Benedict. Flavorful coffee and a nice Bloody Mary to get the Saturday started.

Very trendy and cute outside with games and nice outdoor seating. The service was great but food fell short... Good but not anything to rave about. We had Nutella French toast situation - I don't think there was much actual Nutella. There was some other chocolate conception over it which was not as good as Nutella would have been ....  Also tried the breakfast burrito- good flavor, kinda soggy. Nothing amazing.   Overall trendy cute place with decent food.
HUGE pancakes!  Amazing bloody mary's (my favorite is the Bangkok)!  You can eat healthy or indulge.  It's always packed, so come planning to be leisurely.  Service is efficient.
My favorite breakfast spot in town.  Their pancakes are amazing and so many unique choices.  You won't be disappointed with any of the menu items.  My favorite hash browns by far!

I'm not totally getting the hype here. However, it is tasty enough and worth a visit.   The food: Everyone in my party ordered different types of eggs Benedict. I think between the three of us we tried every single flavor. They were all delicious! The salmon one... was a little weird and I would not recommend it. I felt the menu was a little misleading in that the salmon wasn't pieces but more of a salmon patty.  The hashbrowns were extremely salty but I'll write more about that below.   The drinks: YUM (and affordable!). I ordered a straight up bloody mary with an added strip of bacon for an extra $1.25. I wouldn't recommend adding that extra slice of bacon but the drink was overall tasty.   The service: The service was what made me bump this review from 3 to 4 stars. We were told the wait would be 15 mins but we were seated in less than 5. Our server (I can't remember his name..) was attentive and friendly. My server even put all of my sauces on the side because I said I had a slight dairy allergy. I complained about my hashbrowns being salty and he promptly got me a new batch of them. Deeply appreciated and no hassle! He also offered us water since it was a hot AZ summer day. Overall, the best service I've had in a long time.   Stop by and try some of the dishes! But beware... there's not much here that's dairy-free. You might have to do some improvising.

Snooze is a must. Let's start with the service. When we got there, the super friendly waiter/host asked if he could get us a drink while we were waiting.....since we had just ran a half marathon, we said YES. Many choices of mimosas...we have Guava Mimosas and they were delicious. Our waitress was kind, friendly and attentive. We ordered our food and didn't have to wait too long. Which was surprising considering how packed the place was. We had OMG! french toast, breakfast tacos, Huevos Rancheros, Breakfast pot pie...everything was sooooooooooo good! Then the waitress brought over the biggest pancake (for free) for us to try. It was THE BEST pancake any of us have ever had...hot, fluffy, great flavor. This place is worth the wait!
Great post hike brunch n they are super dog friendly..amazi g food n super relaxing..great staff

This place is horrible.  In addition to cranked up night club music blasting,  the food took forever, and the English muffin took 10 minutes longer to arrive after my poached egg languished on the table.  I had already left in disgust.  My companions continued their experience there,   We we all in agreement:  I would never return even if it was free.  Dismal!

I meant to write this review earlier but I am just waking up from the breakfast induced coma caused by this place.  I'm going to start eating here at night as a means to address my insomnia.  Great creative menu, good execution, and some of the best benedict in town.  Just don't eat here prior to any important meetings or events.

Do yourself a favor and order the cinnamon crunch pancakes. They are a hidden gem, barely mentioned in the menu but oh, so worth it. The waitress said they were the best thing in the place. She did not lie. at all. trust.

Love this restaurant! Although a franchise, Snooze is one of the best things to happen to Phoenix! The wait is never too long, and we are always seated and served accordingly. I always order the iced vanilla lattes and famous Breakfast Pot Pie! Always a great place for brunch or breakfast with friends. Mimosas are wonderful too. Highly recommend Snooze and their staff!

YOU MUST GO! Diverse menu, amazing coffee and wonderful portion sizes.  My friend and I ordered the Breakfast tacos and the French toast and split them. Both were great. Also, sit on the patio if you can.  The weather + the view of the campus and its surroundings are wonderful.

This place is wonderful!  Best breakfast place we have been to in the East Valley. Not a negative thing to say and couldn't find an area needing improvement; hope they sustain this level of customer satisfaction. The menu for food and drink is varied and very flavorful. My wife had the eggs Benedict and liked the concept of mixing two choices from the selection. I had the sweet potato pancakes with a side of bacon;  incredible! The cocktails we had were flavorful and reasonably priced. We shall return many times and look forward to those visits.
I love the vibe here, I'm here every Tuesday with my boyfriend. Their food is amazing. I've tried all their pancakes! They're all delicious.

Best breakfast place ever. This is the only place I go to to get breakfast. I usually get the eggs Benedict, , sausage, and an omelet. Then take home the leftovers. Haha, service is always great and clean environment. Just be prepared to wait to be seated. As it's always busy because it's so good.
5 stars !!! The food is amazing !! Sweet potato pancake and OMG French toast is to die for . The staff is awesome, Bianca is the best !

The service was absolutely terrible.  The servers were doing their checkouts while our drinks died in the well, 15 minutes for a glass of champagne, 10 for my greyhound.  The saving grace is how delicious the food is.  Our server was very friendly, but everyone else in the restaurant seemed "checked out."
Great place to eat! Great service. Traveler to the area so didn't know what to expect. A+. Place was packed.

FOOD IS GREAT...TOO LOUD. I like to Relax and be able to Hear each other while eating - the trend of 'let's be hip' by having clatter, noise...and a 'frenetic feel'...I understand - Many of us mistake 'noise' for Aliveness. Did love the food, had the Benny Goodman and Bella Bella split plate breakfast...will try to find a quiet corner if possible next time...if there is one.

So, Dirty has been here a few times and suggest we go. Upon arrival it's a 30 minute wait and there are five open tables and no one in line... I asked what about those tables? We waited our 30 minutes and got a text message our table is ready. Out back patio seating with a nice view of the alley, perfect.   The server "service" at the table was Outstanding!  First up "the coffee"... with this nice little trifold sitting on the table with a write up about Snooze coffee you know it's got to be good right? Wrong. We thought at first it was just watery. Dirty and I requested new cup from a fresher pot. Well that did not help. We changed it up with a Americano/Espresso and Perfect.    Corned Beef Hash is SPOT ON! I could of eaten two servings.  Snooze's signature shredded hash mixed with artisan corned beef, caramelized poblanos and onions. Topped with two eggs your style & toast or tortillas. YuM!   3 Egg Omelet or Scramble nicely done with fresh spinach, perfect farm fresh eggs with a choice of three fillings served with hash browns and choice of toast or tortillas **Now available as a tofu scramble!** Tofu is really not good for you.   Our coffee was compensated, thank you very much. it only takes a moment to make a difference.  Breakfast marks the beginning of a new day. Thank you see you again soon We're sure...
Great food!!! Affordable price!!! And very upbeat and happy! All the employees seem to enjoy working there! If you go, save room for a brunch desert and get the French toast it is amazing!!!
Delicious all around! Celebrating my husband's bday while visiting from Chicago and this was a perfect spot for brunch! Food, drinks, service - all around wonderful. Thank you Snooze!

AMAZING!!! Service Was top notch ... And the food was well worth the visit! I would suggest the peach pancake it was worth the taking ur time to savor the taste of such a great mixture of flavors. The salted caramel latte was extremely delicious will deff go back again and again!

This place is nicely decorated, layout is nice, and its not dark inside. They have a ping pong table setup outside as well. I thought that was pretty cool.   Food was flavorful! Everything we chose was surprisingly good! Presentation was also nice! I wish menus would have pictures though. I would give me an easier time to choose what i want to eat.  Servers were welcoming, helpful, and very attentive. There was so many servers so i dont think service would be a problem.   The place was alil loud, but what do you expect when its a yummy place to eat.   I gave five stars cuz i had no complaints at all.
Love love love the food. Big portions and great drinks. Come here with family every other Sunday and it is always amazing. The breakfast burrito is my favorite!

There's a name they give their regulars and while I may not be one in Tempe I am at their location off Camelback.  I love the breakfast tacos when I added sausage and I blow through a few vanilla lattes and mmmmimosas. The service staff is the best especially when seated at the bar, you get casual and attentive service and the managers usually swing by to say hey and make sure life is good.  Check out the daily pancake because usually it's the most creative and legit inspiration to start your day.

Love this place.  The food is perfect. Today I went with an open faced Cuban and it had the perfect pickles and pulled pork that you'd expect. My juice was fresh and my. Jody had a beermosa.   Plan on waiting because even at noon on a Wednesday there's a wait.  It's that good. Keep it up!

Probably the best breakfast spot in phx! Always so good! Friendly service and amazing food! The only downside is that it is always busy so it can be hard to get a table but you can normally snag bar seats if you don't mind that!  The corned beef hash is my favorite thing it's what really keeps me coming back!  And I also love to see and try their featured pancakes!

We tried Snooze for the first time this morning.  I'm starting with 4 stars, but if the service and food are as good the next time, I'll upgrade to a five star rating.  We arrived at 6:40 on a Saturday, shortly after they opened.  There were already 10-12 people in the restaurant.  We were seated immediately, and had a server get our drinks as soon as we sat.  She took our food order promptly, and the food arrived about eight minutes later.    I had the corned beef hash.  The eggs were done perfectly at over-easy, and the hash was as good as the corned beef hash at Butter's in Scottsdale (the best I've had up to now.  My wife had the pretzel roll breakfast sandwich. She specifically asked for hard cooked bacon, and it was cooked exactly as she asked.   The server brought the bill as she noticed we were done, and she handled it quickly.  The total tab for two with drinks was $22.58.  This is the same as we normally spend at any other local breakfast restaurant.  There were about 30-40 people in the restaurant by 7:15 when we finished, and more were arriving steadily.  It's certainly popular.  The décor is reminiscent of The Jetsons - a blend of retro sixties with a modernistic setting (circular booths in the middle of the restaurant).  There is a substantial bar focused on morning alcoholic drinks, and there is a reasonable selection of specialty drinks.    There is a small fireplace near the entrance with sofas for anyone waiting to be seated.  We added Snooze to the ranks of Biscuits, Black Bear Diner, T.C. Eggington's, and Liberty Café.  We'll be back, and I'll update the rating based on future experiences.

Worth the Wait  It can be said that there's no shortage of breakfast eateries in the valley, however, Snooze an AM eatery stands out above the rest.  If you decide to visit Snooze you better be hungry, or plan on sharing your dish with someone else, because the portions are large and the food is delicious. This place was crowded and ee had to wait to be seated but it was worth the wait.  I highly recommend the "pancake flight", three pancakes of your chosing. I went with the peanut butter pancake, pineapple upside down, and sweet potato pancakes. All the pancakes were delicious but the peanut butter will knock you out. My lunch companion decided to go with the ham and eggs benedict and he said it was the best he's ever had.  Service was friendly. With no complaints from either of us, definitely looking forward to my next visit.

This was my first time at Snooze with my wife. "Cup of Joe" was our server and he was amazing. If you do go to Snooze make sure you ask to sit in Joe's section! I honestly thought he was a manager the second we sat down. He came over, welcomed us and gave his recommendations since it was our first time there. Hopefully he'll become a manager soon and make Snooze an even better place to eat at.  I had their Corn Beef Hash and I was glad I did. I also had a Snooze Fashion. I am a connoisseur of Old Fashions so I figured I should try it with coffee. I'm glad I did! The longer the drink sat the better it got!  My wife had their Bella! Bella! Benny! (Mind you she doesn't like eggs Benedict AT ALL!) and she thought it was phenomenal! She also ordered a gluten free pancake which turned out to be amazing and very fluffy for being gluten free! She had some of their mimosas and really enjoyed the MMM MMM Mimosa. She said it went down really smooth. Maybe that's why she ordered more than one.  We will be returning to Snooze again, not only to sit in Joe's section, but to enjoy some more amazing food and drinks!

Yea, very unlikely that I will eat here again. The wait was 45 minutes which makes one think the food is going to be freakin' fantastic but it was just normal, regular old food.  The omelette was good but not outstanding, and I tend not to trust any food that is molded into a shape like the hash browns were.  The service added to the meh. When the server came around she used condescending pet names like "love" and "sweetie", which was annoying.  In addition, I was not given any creamer for my coffee or any jam for my toast and the music is way too loud to have a conversation.

I ate at Snooze for the first time on Sunday, and enjoyed the experience. I love all of the little restaurants in the downtown Gilbert area, and Snooze is a great addition. The atmosphere is great, and the service is good! We went early so we were seated right away, but as we were leaving there seemed to be a little wait.   The reason I am giving 3 stars is because the breakfast burrito I ordered was VERY spicy, so much so that I did not eat much of it. The server really wanted to take it back and give  me something else, but I really do not like to do that or waste food, so I brought the rest home. There should be a warning in the menu about how spicy it is! Our server said a lot of people have been saying that recently, so hopefully they do!   I plan to come back and try it again because my Mom loved her pancakes, and I really want to try one of the morning cocktails!
Yummmm, I'm in love with the lattes and both the blueberry danish pancakes & OMG, french toast are amazingly delicious, My Sister & I came across this little place in Tempe yesterday and we love it.

I really want to like this place but every single time I have gone there has been a hair in my food. It totally ruins my appetite :/ and I feel like I've given the place a fair shot!   I say skip it and go somewhere else!

So it's a Monday .... I have been a snooze customer at this specific location since they opened and until today I haven't had a horrible experience. I'm not the type of person to write a review , which I suppose that's how it starts!   Today my boyfriend and I got sat as soon as we walked in the door, which is always nice .... 5 minutes goes by.... no server. 10 minutes goes by, the tables around us are being attended and yet we still don't have a server. Not once "hey, I'll be with you in a minute!", nothing . 15 minutes and someone walks by and asks if we have been helped , which at this point I'm beyond irritated , which it's not this persons fault but "Alex" who has been to tables on either side of us , is now aware we are waiting... 5 more minutes and still nothing . Needless to say, we left. As we left I let the hostess know and I felt bad for her with a this look of panic on how to handle the situation and all she could come up with was "I'm sorry" .
The egg white omelette with three savory flavors (aka meats etc) was really delicious. The hash browns were really golden hash browns cooked to perfection. The mimosas were good too.

Really cool retro ski cabin feel. I dig it! Great location. They have a corn hole game on the patio, nice touch. The most decadent pancakes!!!   Now I'm vegan and unfortunately their Veg options are pretty sad. Tofu scramble consists of big plate of whisked tofu (unseasoned or sauces) and a sprinkle of cooked veggies with toast :(   Hopefully they update their menu to offer more Veg friendly options soon. Miss that place.

Always a good time! Tried the corned beef hash for the first time and it's very flavorful. The eggs were cooked great! The sourdough toast and jam were amazing as well. Definitely come back again. Play some ping pong while you're waiting too! Also very great atmosphere. The only downside is it's mostly busy everyday and wait will be long.

Food is 3.75 stars, check in people 5 stars, our waitress 2 stars. We felt good going into this restaurant and excited for their breakfast options. Wait was about 45 min Saturday morning which seems about right for a new restaurant in downtown Gilbert. The hostess party was very enthusiastic and delightful to deal with. Once we were seated the experience started to slip, our waitress was very obviously tired of working all morning and it not only showed on her face but in her attitude as well. She was short with her answers and seemed to get annoyed at any questions. Her attitude leaked into my dining experience and I was unable to enjoy my meal. Next time we come back we will try to sit in a different area.
