My very first time at Snooze as at the Gilbert location, and that day, all of our orders were incredibly salty. I've also had some rather curt servers there. However, the staff (servers and chefs) here at the Tempe location know what they are doing. The food came out better than I expected and the servers were friendly. Although we waited an hour to be seated (this was a Saturday morning at 10 am), it was definitely worth it. Next time I am feeling in the mood for brunch at Snooze, I will pick this location over the Gilbert one.

Everyone talks about Snooze for brunch, so I came with some friends to try it out. We came right at the rush, and the place was packed. Luckily the first person who arrived already put down a table, so we waited probably 20-30 minutes at most. While you wait, help yourself to coffee, which is off to the right when you walk in. I thought it was a very nice note of hospitality to customers.  We got seated to a nice comfy booth, but since we were catching up with each other, it took us a while to make our orders. Nonetheless, the server was patient with us. Some friends who had visited before said that the eggs Benedict were good, so I went with the Ham Benedict. It was definitely true to legend, and I ate it all up! The eggs were the perfect level of runny, and the English muffin sopped it up nicely. The only thing that was a little off was the hash browns were a bit salty, and that was the general opinion around the table, but we are all looking forward to brunch here again!

A lot of hoopla from my Denver friends so I had to check it out. High hopes ends in disappointment.   First issue, unorganized front desk. Seating people out of check-in order (same size party) makes for a frustrating experience. Four tables sitting empty for nearly 10 minutes with people waiting  (that never makes sense to me). From what I could tell, the front desk nedeed "one" person to take control. In a nutshell, too many employees standing around staring at the iPads.  After a 25 minute wait (we were advised 10-15) we make it to the table and I ordered a glass of cranberry juice. Whatever you do, don't order it! When it arrived in a tall glass it was nearly clear with a hint of pink. I knew at that very moment we had a problem. I took a sip and as I expected it was watered down and barely resembled cranberry. Why would you serve this? I then ordered the Bella Bella which was quite good. I would definetly recommend it.   So would I visit again? No

Crazy good!   Now we are crazy full!   Our server Britt was very helpful, responsive and a delightful person.  We had green eggs and hamwich, breakfast burrito,  sammy I am, and flight of pancakes.   Place has a cool vibe and a good pace of service.   Great meal and experience.   Would come back in a heartbeat.

My girlfriend and I came here for the first time the other day, and the food was awesome! I got the grilled cheese sandwich with tomato soup, and a cinnamon pancake (random, I know), and she got the OMG French toast. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because there was stuff floating in my water, and there still was even after they replaced my drink. Definitely give this place a try!
The pancakes were terrible. They have a strange taste to them and the portion sizes are not very large. There are better breakfast places near by that are well worth your money. Go to them instead.

My friend and I went to breakfast here today. I know they're packed on the weekend, but during the week it's almost empty first thing in the morning.   I had the OMG French toast. It was dessert for breakfast: French toast with mascarpone, caramel sauce, and strawberries. My dining partner had the breakfast pot pie - it looked delicious.   Our coffee cups were always full. Our server was attentive but not overbearing.  I may not be back on the weekend because of how busy it gets, but I'll be back.

I frequent Snooze Town and Country once a week since they opened. The service has always been great until today. Food took over 40 minutes and the waitress Shelly disappeared the entire time not even filling our teas. I finally found her and asked why the entire patio received their food except me and I was there first. She checked in the back and told me they were out of poached eggs and it would be another 3-5 minutes. The food came out finally and it was delicious however we never saw Shelly again. I hope she splits tips with Charles because be picked up her slack big time. She finally dropped the bill and we asked for a refill which we never got. I decided to let the manager know so other guests dont have our experience and her response is "she is trying and Snooze is a beast of a restaurant". I guess maybe Shelly learned from the manager. I will take my business elsewhere.

Extremely disappointed in their lack of customer service and dishonesty here. Im from Los Angeles and was visiting some friends this weekend in Phoenix. We had a 3pm flight to catch so we got to the restaurant at 1030am. We assumed from the number of yelp reviews that it was popular and would have a wait so we were pleasantly surprised when they told us 15-20 mins. 30 mins later when we asked about our table they said there were 3 tables in front of us and it should be another 15-20 mins. I specifically asked asked are you sure, you don't think it's going to be longer? And they said no, about 15-20 mins. Another 45 mins later we were told there were 6 tables in front of us and it should be 15-30 mins. At that point we didn't want to risk it and just found another spot to eat. An hour and a half from when we put our name down we got a text that our table would be ready soon. An hour and a half!  I completely understand long waits, especially for good food and trendy restaurants. What I don't understand is giving false wait times to your guest. If we were told an hour to an hour and a half wait at the beginning we would have realized we couldnt wait that long and just left, no harm. But to give your guests unrealistic wait times is not good customer service. In addition, I don't understand how it jumped from 3 tables to 6 tables ahead of us. It was suppose to be on a first come first serve basis so I hope we weren't discriminated against for having 2 children with us.  I was very excited to try this place but will never come back here and our friends who live in Phoenix will spread that word too.

A bit disappointed with this place - menu seemed so awesome, I thought they might have a shot at dethroning Butter's as my breakfast favorite in Phoenix.  Alas, it wasn't to be.  The benny we had was good but not great, and the pancake flight underwhelmed.  Pineapple upside down pancake was watery and the sweet potato pancake didn't have any sweet potato taste at all.  And my lord the ginger butter was way over the top.  Also, their hash browns look pretty but are a pile of mush.  Boo...  Place seemed trendy and most folks were sipping mimosas and bloody Mary's.  Maybe that's our mistake, this one's for hair of the dog not great eats.

We were visiting from Hawaii for the GCU winter graduation. We googled places nearby to where we were staying and chose Snooze. At first we were worried about the wait time but when we got there we arrived right before the crowd and only waited 15 minutes. Our server was friendly and we also said hello to another server  (Jenna) originally from Hawaii. The food was great. The Benny Duo Benedict, Snooze Classic a d Corn Beef Hash were all winner selections.  I loved the atmosphere!  Great breakfast/brunch selections

This place is the bomb! Someone recommend I come here for breakfast and I'm glad I did! Beautiful atmosphere, customer service was excellent, and the food was to DIE FOR! It doesn't get better than this! Please give this place a try; you won't be sorry you did, and you'll be back for sure!

You tell them you are here, they text you when they can seat you, and they give you free coffee to keep you awake while you wait!  Then, it gets even BETTER!  The food is innovative and delicious.  I love breakfast, but there is usually one thing on the plate that could be prepared a bit better. Not here.  Our food came out hot and perfect.  I had the breakfast pot pie - puff pastry covered with a mild sausage gravy and a perfect over-easy egg.  Puff pastry crunchy and flaky?  Check.  Sausage gravy smooth and just the right thickness?  Check.  Egg cooked just over and hot?  Check.  Then, to top it all off, a round mold of the most delicious, perfectly crisped hash browns ever!    My husband had the breakfast burrito.  Not original, you say?  Think again.  Fluffy, creamy eggs, with onions, chorizo and hash browns in a soft, soft, soft (not mushy, soft) burrito with a salsa verde on top.  I do not like chorizo or onions, but on this burrito, it was a perfect combination.  I wanted to eat slowly so I would never finish this meal.  The menu is so innovative and everything looks and sounds delicious.  We watched people rave to one another about the sweet potato pancakes and the Bella=Bella Benny.  The wait is more than worth it - but if you hate to wait, come early.  You will be happy you did.

Me and my wife went back for our second visit. We arrived just after 11am on  Friday, 7/24/2015. I would have sworn it was Mothers Day Sunday, it was crazy busy. We were told a 20 minute wait, it was longer. Once again, the music is so loud, along with the people noise, it's just to loud. We finally get a table, a half booth with a bench and a funky, uncomfortable plastic chair, Our server was so nice, but I had to have him repeat what he said a few times due to the noise.   My wife ordered the "Breakfast Pot Pie Snooze's homemade rosemary sausage gravy smothers a flaky puff pastry, topped with an egg your style (we'd say sunny side up!). You've reached breakfast bliss, complete with hash browns. $9.00. She was not impressed. No Bliss reached here. How can you call a puff pastry, that has nothing on the inside, but has gravy over the top a "Pot Pie"? I had a bite, and I too, thought it was plain.  I had the "Snooze Breakfast Burrito Burrito Filled with scrambled eggs, hash browns, house black beans, cheddar & jack cheese, topped with pico de gallo and choice of green chili or ranchero  (psst, love your veggies & meats)"  I added pulled pork. It is rather large, topped in green sauce. I cut it open down the middle, and I could see the shredded cheese, it had not melted. This is a giant pet peeve of mine. The inside had spots that were warmer then others, but the cheese not melted, still looking like it just came out of a bag, not good. I ate some of the giant tortilla, but then just the insides.  I did not finish, lost my appetite, my wife didn't want a bite. Its not vey appetizing to look at. I think they need to put this in a very hot oven, to really get it HOT inside. I didn't tell our server, we had waited long enough.   We shared the "Pineapple Upside Down Pancakes Buttermilk pancakes with caramelized pineapple chunks, housemade vanilla crème anglaise and cinnamon butter". This was the best part of our breakfast. The pineapple chunks were warm, no way were the caramelized. $7.50 for two pancakes. Very sweet, gooey, Good!.  After trying Snooze for a second time, I have lowered my rating to "2 Stars".  The loud music, loud chatter noise, long wait turned me way off. { I don't mind a long wait if the end result is satisfaction} If the food was Great, then maybe, maybe, I would over look the other things, but with this much going against it, we won't be back.   I now , along with my wife, give Snooze a big "DOH!"
Snooze is so good. Very high quality ingredients and presentation. A wide variety of choices and gluten free options!!! A long wait sometimes especially on weekends but the food is worth it.
They have the most amazing upside down pineapple pancakes ever!. I go to this place for brunch at least once a week because the taste is just incredible and I can't complain about anything.

We love snooze! It's a great place to bring friends and family! They have a great menu with a wide variety for all! The only downside is that they have a massive wait time, all the time. I would likely recommend implementing some sort of app reservation/checkin service. Erika helped us today and even brought us a complimentary pancake, super awesome service!
It's a solid breakfast spot that offers better variety than some of the other places around.

Went to Snooze this morning for a work meeting. This was my third visit and, as usual, the food was amazing! But what really made this visit phenomenal was our servers, Vincent and Katie. Both of them went above and beyond, from Vincent bringing me a sweet potato pancake (which was to die for) to try while I was waiting for my colleague to join, to Katie giving us to go cups at the end of our visit, I can't think of a thing that could have been better. I stopped on my way out to talk to the manager and thank her for having such amazing people. This visit made my week! I definitely recommend Snooze and the Gilbert staff!
One of the best breakfasts in town. The corn beef hash is to die for. The service was spot on, great toast, great coffee, even has great swag. Not one to miss!
Best pancakes as we tried the blueberry Danish pancakes and the banana french toast!  Not to mention best service from Lolita!!
It's worth the 30 minute wait!  Breakfast burrito was awesome. People were hip and not stuck up. Mimosas to die for. I'd suggest this place to anyone. Bon appetite!

even though it is nice to have a new eatery in the neighborhood...and we wish them good luck..they need to work on the food.. nice waitress but she was even embarrassed....took forever for order to arrive and not all in party were served at the same time...food was tasteless...hashbrowns just bronw on outside..raw on inside..other foods cheese was burned...sandwich tasteless..not sure what ingredients the chef used in that ruben but it was a gagger...  waitress tried to resolve with chef but no relief was offered...businesses are built on return customers and referrals..but I don't see us returning there or making positive referrals..sorry  UPDATE: Others in the party contacted the restaurant. The management/owners? contacted her . They were very receptive to the comments and critique and our concerns and wanted to make it right. People in our party will try the new place again (ON THE HOUSE) and hope that event was just a fluke. Hope the new restaurant continues to try and improve service and food.

Chilaquiles- 8/10 Breakfast pie - 7/10 Sweet potato pancakes- 9/10 Burrito - 7/10 (it's hugeee) Men's bathroom 8/10 (small, but clean.. Also they have a baby changer, soooo get to it dads!) Women's bathroom-  (I couldn't get it, I'm man) Overall great place.

I can't stop thinking about my amazing breakfast!!  This was our second time at Snooze. Though I felt the service was just ok our first visit, it was incredible this time around. There seemed to be a super long wait (10:30am on a Sunday), but when I went to put my name on the list, I was given the option to sit immediately at the breakfast bar, the best of inside and outside; a seat in the restaurant,  fully open to the patio and street traffic. A nice spot for just the two of us, maybe not ideal for larger groups.   Our server, Kaitlyn, was awesome - super friendly and helpful. I had the spicy Bloody Mary to start. One of the best parts of the menu is the ample vegetarian offering. This time I had the Snooze Spuds Deluxe with Soyrizo and Poblano Peppers mixed in, scrambled egg added on top. Heaven! Between this and the bloody, my hangover was cured. Unfortunately, I'm plagued with an obsession over this food and can't wait to go back!!

Hands down our favorite place! Fantastic food , tons of options but I do love the breakfast burritos! Such a great energy there and awesome staff . We also love it because we can enjoy our weekend with our four legged children

Service could have been better. They did not refill our waters and never asked if we wanted another coffee or drink. Food was ok menu was very plain. Not worth the wait that they normally have. Daily dose was a shorter wait and better menu.

FANTASTIC!!!  I am so happy to find a breakfast place worth raving about.  In a sea on boring breakfast options, my sister introduced me to this gem.  I don't care if the wait is always 45 minutes.  I'll wait.  It's worth it.  I talked about their chorizo breakfast tacos to anyone that would listen for weeks.  The porridge is amazing, sweet potato pancakes delicious.... I have yet to find something not unbelievable on the menu.    If you're looking for breakfast, go here.  Do some shopping while you wait, then come enjoy the deliciousness while you are sitting out on their patio area enjoying the sunshine.

First impression: girl who greeted and sat us looked like she just rolled out of bed and hadn't brushed her hair for a few days. Floor under our table was dirty.   Some food was good; some was just ok. Enjoyed the BLT type sandwich but hash browns were lacking.

I had never eaten here before, however, when I heard my friend had a job here, I decided to stop by. I ordered eggs Benedict and added cooked spinach, and OH MY LORD... I have never seen eggs cooked quite so perfectly... The dish was creamy and absolutely delicious. I recommend swapping out the side of hash browns with the pesto tomatoes. My waitress Gloria was not only quick, but also chatty, kind, and funny! Ask for her next time you go!

It was our first time since this restaurant closes at 2:30pm every day & we are not morning people. This was a graduation celebration & it was recommended by a friend. Overall, I was not happy with the small portions for the amount of money we spent or the inattentive waitstaff. My daughter & I always split our meals because neither of us eat very much but here she was just barely full & I only had 1/4th of her french toast, so I would guesstimate that the portions are half the size of almost every other breakfast restaurant we have been to.  Once we realized how small her portion was I was prepared to order another meal but the waiter never came by to ask us how our food was or how we were doing until everyone was almost done eating & it was too late to order something else.

This is my new favorite breakfast place. Everything is cooked PERFECTLY. I had the make your own omelette and the hashbrowns are like a big hashbrowns cake - cooked perfectly. The eggs are so silky and tasty.   We got our food quickly too. We shared an order of the pineapple upside down pancake- great choice. So tasty and no syrup needed. Every bite was savory. Service was outstanding.

I've brunched at Snooze a handful of times, and ranked it 4 stars...up until my last visit. We had been waiting for almost an hour for a table (you can expect this if you come any time before 11:30 a.m. on a weekend), and when we were seated, the manager comped us a "pancake flight" with three full-size Snooze specialty pancakes - just as a thank you for waiting! My group inhaled them faster than I could snap a picture, but they were incredible. Service is always great here - you can tell that the servers and hosts really enjoy their jobs, and it's a fun and quirky place to be!
This is the best breakfast place ever! The food is sooooo good, you have to try the hash.

After reading the reviews and seeing the long lines I was ready to enjoy a really good breakfast boy was I disappointed   I ordered something call the potato mix it came with cheese, scallions and 2 choices so I had spinach which there was 4 pieces of it then I added chicken sausage  which wa tough and no flavor oh and it had 2 eggs on top, I bought it would come with toast and boy was I wrong so I added an order of toast and received 1 piece! What ever happened to 2 slices of toast? Well back to the potatoes they had just been shed or frozen and barely warmed on the grill I was so hungry  after the wait to be seated and he wait time for the food I just ate what I could. When the waiter brought the bill he saw that I couldn't eat my potatoes and let him know that they were undercooked and he said maybe next time they would be better and walked away.  I couldn't believe it!! Don't worry I won't be back!!! The place is loud, and not close to being worth the wait! Save your time and money
Pretty long wait on weekends but the food and service are amazing every time and there are so many options.

If you want an incredibly sweet and savory breakfast, this is the place to go!!! My boyfriend and I shared the OMG French Toast and after the first bite, I said OMG this is SO good! We also shared the Sandwich I Am, which was a sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich on top of a pretzel bun. The servers were very nice and made sure our order was correct when we received our food. It was conveniently located right by ASU sports facilities, which we visited afterwards.

I'm absolutely obsessed with Snooze and cannot wait for their Gilbert location to open! The décor reminds me of retro modern and the servers here are fun with great personalities! My party decided to order and share so I was able to try multiple things on the menu. Their flight of pancakes is a great deal- we got the pear, pineapple and blueberry streusel. All of them are great but the pear was my favorite! The brioche French toast is outstanding as well. The benedicts are great too because you can order both the same or 2 different ones. I went with the ham and chilaquiles and I loved the chilaquiles one! Hash browns are also great!   I really don't have a negative thing to say about this place. As a tip, they do get very busy so call ahead or be OK with a wait.  Can't wait to eat here again!

It was good. The ambiance here is very similar to the Camelback location. Just more of a different crowd (of course being in a college town). Business crowd at lunch time. Service and work ethic is at every snooze location is to be expected the same at every location.   Food, solid (as usual, stays consistent from each location). Food came rather quickly. Very nice surprise.   Cheers to the staff and their smiley faces!

So this time was one of the worst times since me and my girlfriend has been here. Katy (tall light black skinned lady) was really unattentive (from getting back to us about what to order) to the food taking a very long time to come out (mind you we've been here 2 other times, busier, and have gotten our food faster than this.)   This time they failed us.  BUT Echo saved the day. She came to our table and sat down, talked to all of us, even took care of our whole bill. I will give this place 4 stars because of that right there. Professionalism. Thanks Echo.  Definitely for those of you reading this review, if you haven't tried this place, come and try it out!

Went at open and smelled like food was being prepped :) Ordered peanut butter pancakes and they were Gluten free also. They 2 pancakes like a big plate size , could only finish 1 and half . Bud got pot pie, the hash brown was moist and creamy .

What a cute place!  The atmosphere outside was relaxing, and the outdoor heaters warmed up a slightly chilly morning.  The food was very good, and there were some really original dishes on the menu.  The staff was very nice and as attentive as they could be on such a busy morning.  The whole restaurant was very clean and trendy. Very family friendly.
Great food, fun environment. I love this place and their breakfast pot pie is great!  Totally recommend this place, it has quickly  become a favorite!

Service was good until it came time to close out, another server came by and made it seem like it was unreasonable to ask for my tab before paying, which really soured the experience. I get being busy before close but when 5 of you are clustered just chilling and talking while we wait on a check it's a problem. The host was really good, very engaging on our way to the table.

My husband and I went to Snooze in Gilbert for breakfast. I had the pumpkin pancakes and my husband had French toast. Both were delicious. The service was great, too. They have a good menu and a full bar as well as some specialty drinks.
Love!  But do NOT take any staff recommendations. Go with what you like.  I'd been suggested items twice & they were not great.  The Benedict's & Bloody's are bomb

Don't snooze on Snooze. it is DELICIOUS! I get a half order of the OMG French toast and a half order of the breakfast tacos and by the end of it, my plates are bare. the sauce in the tacos is just magical. and the syrup mixed with the cream cheese or WHATEVER IT IS, that's on the French toast just melts me. I really enjoy snooze. (and the tacos are vegetarian. PLUS!)
These out-of-towners from L.A. lved our meals! The wait was torturous (because of hunger) but worth the wait! If this is what the locals wait up to an hour, then it must be good right?!

This place has the worst service and constantly messes up my order through the to go service. I've had my to go order messed up at least 7 times now. I've probably only ordered there 10 times in all. My boss loves the food so I continue to pick up food from them but I am constantly trying to fix errors with them. My boss's card was overcharged today and then after making a phone call about the incorrect order and incorrect charge, they told me I should be thankful for the extra food. This is so infuriating as it wasn't "extra" food. It was the wrong order and a waste of food.

The pancakes are outrageous, however if you are looking more for savory than sweet you might have a more difficult time finding something to eat.  It is a fun place to eat, crazy busy on the weekends.

I'm visiting for graduation weekend and we headed to this place for a late Sunday brunch. We were quoted a 35 minutes wait but it was actually closer to 20 which was great for us. Our waitress was a little spacey and kept forgetting to pick up my friends Chai from the bar but over then that we had no issues. I ordered a Snooze Double Stack that I stuffed with sausage and onions and my companions had OMG French Toast, and the Ham Benedict and it was all delicious and I felt well priced

When it come to their food I would definitely say 5 stars but when it comes to service I would say 2 stars. I'm in town visiting a friend and came to have breakfast here. I was super excited to have breakfast and mimosas and when they asked for my ID the waitress made a big deal because i'm from California and I don't have an Arizona ID. She went to ask a manager which I thought was ridiculous as I'm over 21 and comes over and says they will let it slide but it's not allowed due to them not wanting to lose their license and like I said IM OVER 21!? So apparently you have to be from Arizona to drink in Arizona? After that I felt very uncomfortable as she was just talking to my friend and would barely even look my way even to ask me my order. I ordered the Chile Verde Benedict but I have never had eggs Benedict so I asked it the egg was runny and she said,"Girl have you never had an eggs Benedict because of course it's runny!" It made me feel even worse so I just asked for it over hard. I will say it was the best thing I have tried. But If I ever come back I would definitely get my food to go!

I find this restaurant overrated and overhyped. They have cute decor and a nice patio but I think the atmosphere is better than the actual food. The mimosas were good, hard to screw that up, but our server was pretty aloof and  my sister had to literally flag him down to let him know he forgot to order hers. My dish was good not great, and my sisters (marscapone?) pancakes were way too sweet and rich.  I think there are way better brunch places in Tempe and you won't have to deal with paying for parking (they don't validate) or long waits.
The food is delicious, drinks are made with love and service pretty chill friendly. For Drinks i had mayan mocha.

I had my first experience with Snooze when I was in Denver last year so was thrilled to see that there were several in the Phoenix area on a recent trip!   And, seeing as how I won't get my fix until my next trip out west in May, I made the most of it with a pancake flight (blueberry Danish, pineapple upside down cake and molten chocolate lava).  Seriously the best gluten free pancakes EVER and the pineapple upside down was hands down the favorite.  Also, I love that they have gluten free toast for the benedicts, and that you can mix and match.  I got the Bella Benny and one with lox.  Perfectly seasoned everything, and my only regret is again, that there isn't one in my hometown.  If you don't have a Snooze near you, you owe it to yourself to make a trip when you find one near!

Ok, you Phoenix locals, quit hogging the good dining spots.  Snooze AM is the kind of diner that I wish we had back in my hometown. Solid food, some nice surprises and a edgy decor.  We visited on a Monday morning for breakfast and were greeted by an almost full restaurant. Finding a spot at the bar we were quickly welcomed by a friendly staff and provided good coffee and a selection of tea.  The menu has some standards, but we were recommended to try their special focus - Benedict.  I thoroughly enjoyed my blend of two different dishes  - one was a barbacoa and the other was a mushroom and asparagus. Outstanding.  Important to note is that they are willing to accept special requests. Need a half sized portion? No problem. Want to try a split dish? Do it. Have an original idea for a dish? Bring it on.  They are also a brunch place with great options for adult beverages, including Bloody Marys, Beer and Wine on Tap.  So, do yourself a favor, bust in on the locals hiding place and enjoy some great food and a cool dining experience.

Go EARLY and avoid the wait to be seated. We sat at the bar to avoid waiting for a table. I had the pancake flight (one was the French toast) with a side of bacon. Everything was favorable down to the thick cut bacon. The Mister had egg white omelette with veggies, hash brown and toast. He enjoyed his food as well. The atmosphere is what you would expect in a college area...casual, hip and busy. Wasn't too thrilled with having to watch  the Nickelodeon channel at the bar while drinking our mimosas. Would have preferred sports highlights or national news.
The only down side is you can almost always expect to wait about an hour to eat here, but the food is great. Get a pancake for the table to share - it's a must!

I am always up for a good breakfast place and Snooze AM Eatery is no exception.  They've been open for about three weeks now, and they are definitely doing something right.  Luckily, when I went by with a colleague on Friday morning, we just missed the rush; there was only a few minute wait to get seated at around 9:30am.  The name "Snooze," may conjure up the image of someone sleeping in, but the staff at this place is high energy and full of smiles.  The hostess, server, and all of the staff we encountered were super friendly.  The atmosphere is bright and cheery -- clean too.  Our coffee and water were constantly being refilled and our food arrived pretty quickly after we ordered as well.  I had an omelette with egg whites, spinach, mushroom and jack cheese with tomatoes and multi-grain toast.  I know, I know... boring but healthy and made just right.  I was a happy camper.  My dining companion had the Upstream Benny.  We also shared a side of the signature "Sweet Potato Pancake."  Mmmmmmmm - I highly recommend it!    I don't know that I'd go wait in line to eat at Snooze on the weekend, but I totally recommend it as a weekday option.  I noticed they have plenty of bar seating - a nice option for anyone that may be dining solo.  Seeing that this is their 9th location (they've got several in Colorado and California), I have a feeling this place will do just fine and I look forward to returning sometime soon!

We had been to the Snooze in Fort Collins, CO and loved it. We were looking for breakfast nearby and saw Snooze and decided to give it a try. The over easy eggs I ordered were cooked perfectly. The flight of pancakes were great. Service was great and we were very happy at Snooze again!

Who the heck sits people outside in the SUN at NOON in The DESERT and then acts rude and indignant because you'd rather sit inside!?!? The manager was rude!!! I have no idea what the food taste like and really don't care... I realize it's new and very popular right now but they should get a clue and not treat their customers like they're are doing us a favor... We are not cattle!!!! Eco Friendly establishments with no misters should not have outside seating during the summer!! Way to go not impressing new patrons!!
Definitely one of my favorite places for breakfast/brunch. Love the brewmosa as a morning cocktail and just tried the chile verde benny with soyrizo and oh my gosh.  can't wait to come back.

Overall good place to check our for breakfast. Good food and nice atmosphere.  I had the green eggs and hammie, delish. There was a long wait time to be seated which speaks to the restaurant's popularity but the reason for the 3 stars is the less than great service once inside. Service was slow and seemed unorganized, the waitress was inattentive, and the food took 30 minutes to come out. If you have the time to spare, this is not a bad spot to check out.

I like this place a lot, but I don't feel there's a great deal to say. Just that it's a really, really good place for brunch. It's fancy food in a casual setting, so you get the best of both worlds!  The food is great and there is a wide variety of inventive eggs benedict and pancakes to choose from, so you're all set whether you like sweet or savory for your morning meal. The coffee is good, and the servers are nice. Sometimes service is slow when they're really busy, but anyone who genuinely complains about that is a terd.  This place is also exceptionally vegetarian friendly, which I find is a tendency among breakfast joints, but it's still worth noting.   I've never had the cocktails here, so I can't speak to them, but I'm sure they're also delicious.  tl;dr You'll drop a pretty penny for breakfast/brunch/lunch at Snooze, but it's familiar food that's done well, and so it's well worth it. If you have friends visiting that appreciate good food but want to stick to something they know and keep it casual, Snooze is one of your best bets in the Valley.

Gluten free pancake sampler was DELICIOUS: blueberry Danish, pineapple, and sweet potato (the winner was served in maple syrup and candied nuts). Guatemalan coffee was Americano style; go for Expresso if you need more than colored water served luke warm. Busy place but we were seated immediately at 1pm on a Monday. Environment is bright diner style with nothing to absorb sound tho we could converse OK in a side booth. There's a huge parking lot to the west and this is a great addition to downtown Gilbert.

Snooze is a decent place to go for brunch if you don't mind splurging around $30 - $40 for two people. This is one of those restaurants I'll go to if I have the extra cash for a every-few-months treat. They have a laid back, somewhat retro atmosphere. Waits are never too long.   Their pancakes are fluffy with a variety of new, interesting flavors to choose from. I tried the Blueberry Danish  and a couple of others, although the Blueberry Danish sticks out in my mind the most. Sweet blueberries and tart lemon actually compliment each other very nicely.   I'm also not a fan of overly-dressed up hash browns (Snooze's include onions and spices which can be somewhat overwhelming, if I remember correctly. Honestly, it could have just been the day we went.). That's not to say that their hash browns are bad (they definitely aren't!), I'm just more of a purist when it comes to my potatoes. Give me salt and pepper.   I'd say give Snooze a visit at least once to try their unique menu and come to your own conclusion.

The food is always good, we are never disspointed with our choices and the atmosphere is a blast to say the least. But they don't seem to seat very fairly occording to how long we waited on one of our last visits. We waited 45 mins for an inside table after over 5 parties, who checked in after us, were seated ahead of us. It was a frustrating experience since none of the hostesses informed us that we could get seated faster if you were not specific about our table choices. Otherwise this is a wonderful breakfast joint for the entire family and it will still be a favorite of mine

Had a wonderful New Years brunch with JellyBean as my server. She was great and the reason why I will return! The rest of staff was also very friendly. Food selections normal for a breakfast place, but delicious.

Overrated.   Nothing really special.   Eggs are eggs, pancakes are pancakes, bacon is bacon.   If you want a plain breakfast, you can go anywhere for that, otherwise you are just paying for location and atmosphere.

pineapple pancakes are absolutely my favorite! ordered it again today and it was just as good as last time. my friend and i ordered the breakfast buritto (it had hash browns and salsa inside) we kept on saying "i love it" "this taste so good" lol! pretty reasonable price too :) servers were so busy they got a wrong drink, etc. but we will come back for the food

Very trendy modern spot that is still fairly new in the Biltmore area. We used to frequent this place at least once or twice a week however after 2 bad services in a row and a few others here and there. We made a decision to just give our gift card the manager gave us to someone else. We rather go somewhere the employees at least have an appearance that they somewhat enjoy their job and the people they are servicing. I would suggest looking into retraining your staff. Smiles, attentiveness, and being nice are part of a servers job. If you have 1 bad seed, it can spread. I believe this is the case here. It's really too bad, great looking spot, good food and drinks......the rest is just ok.

If you have time to wait, or get up early everyday then sure head over to Snooze. But, if you like to enjoy brunch on the weekend or are in a hurry, I recommend some other place. The wait time here is sometimes unruly. I can understand a brunch/lunch rush but being quoted over an hour seems a little ridiculous.   Their breakfast is decent. It isn't something I will wait an hour and a half to eat but if it looks like there may be enough seating for them to seat me I will head in. It doesn't mean because there is open seating that they will seat you, which I never understand. I have been here countless times now and have experienced the issue of time and seating nearly every single time. I really wanted to love the place, I really did.  Their Mmm Mmm Mimosa with pomegrante liquor is pretty good. I tried their spicy Bloody Mary and their Gazpacho Bloody Mary and  was unimpressed by both. I don't know if it is their mix or their bartender but it has been decided this is not a place for me to get Bloody Mary's.    On the last trip I had the Benny Goodman Benedict, "Lox style" salmon and tiny crostini rye toasty pucks. I must have missed the "style" portion of the description and could be wrong but I thought Lox were a salt or sugar cured salmon? Not cooked but cured giving it that smoked salmon textural  likeness? I could be wrong but this to me was just cooked salmon, not lox. It was alright....  I had previously had their duo combo Benedict and at the time I believe they may have had a corned beef hash Benedict which I no longer see and the Bella Bella Benny. I was far more impressed with those two than the Benny Goodman "lox" style breakie I had.  The kid had the pineapple upside down french toast and loved it! Almost ate all of it. Would be stoked if I offered the spot up to him again....  I don't know, I think this just isn't my favorite spot to grab breakfast or brunch. Maybe you will feel differently about it? It was loud, the staff was reasonable after being seated it's just too much fluff...

OMG OMG! This place is the best! You walk in and they were rocking some old school MJ first thing in the morning; that was the first plus. They have these booths that are set up like a circle so everyone gets a comfy  seat ; second plus. The service is great the waitress was so nice and attentive; third plus. Then, oh and then, the food.... The breakfast burrito, taking a bite of that will set off every taste bud in your mouth. The pancakes are good too, not the best I've ever had, but the toppings make up for it. To top it all off, they have amazing drinks, and it's all really affordable! Can't wait to go back!

I've been 3 times to this location.  The first two visits were fine, nothing to write home about.  It's a bit far from my home so I never made it a point to go here, but I needed to go to Nordstrom rack and I was a 1/2 hour early on their opening time so I went over to snooze to grab something to eat (solo with an infant in tow).  1. Service was fantastic.  Super friendly helpful staff. Got me a big comfortable table even though it was just me an a carseat with my baby.  My waitress was super friendly and chatty and another member of staff even stopped and chatted about my cute little bundle of joy.  In my opinion it's nice to go somewhere where the staff seems to enjoy their jobs and being at work and are engaging with the patrons that come in.  It definitely gives the place a positive vibe.  2.  I found my "reason to come back over and over again"!!! The chilaquiles Benedict was outta control delicious.  Apparently they make their barbacoa in house, which is amazing.  The time they take to stack the tortillas with the cheese in between each layer.  The very close to perfectly poached egg on top and the green chili hollandaise was sooo delicious I could have had a whole extra little ramekin of that on the side!  Only complaint was that the potatoes on the side were under seasoned (for me! Everyone is different mind you).  But honestly this Benedict was so good it didn't need a side of hashbrowns!   3.  Coffee is really good!  I've recently become kind of a coffee snob and their house blend is smooth and not bitter at all.  I added cream and stevia and I wish I hadn't added the stevia because it almost seemed like the coffee had so much great natural sweetness that the cream would have been a perfect duo with that simple yellow mug of brew.   All in all I had a very enjoyable breakfast! I will be back for that exact dish over and over again because I'm a creature of habit! ;)   Super yum!
The food was amazing!!!! So quick and huge portions! However; be prepared to wait forever! We waited 2 and a half hours for a table of 4!

This place was delicious. Don't get me wrong, it is very pricey. Breakfast for just myself was $22. Drip Coffee was decent, but nothing to write home about. Peanut butter cup pancakes are out of this world. Give it a shot, just bring your wallet with you.

fast and friendly service!!! and they're vegan friendly!!! they offer tofu, soyrizo, and soy and almond milk. i got the tofu scramble with soyrizo, mushrooms, and caramelized onions,  hashbrowns with no butter, and sourdough toast with no butter. i also got coffee with almond milk! i have no complaints. i used to work at a breakfast place and they've really exceeded all my expectations.

OMG - this place is ridiculous! Please do yourself a favor and order the sweet potato pancakes...they will change your life. The chili verde benny was also amazing - I would have licked my plate if I could have! Very friendly and accommodating staff who are more than willing to make recommendations and let your order your breakfast your own way. Awesome!

Lovely place with cool, retro decor, good size patio.  All staff we encountered were quite friendly, as was the GM who stopped by the table more than once.  Great menu options with a combo of traditional favorites with a twist for more modern options.  I had the OMG French toast which was amazing.  AM cocktails looked delicious, but I opted for an iced tea.   The only issue we had was navigating my friend's stroller...but it is a HUGE double stroller, so not really an issue.  Will definitely be back for more!

Simply awesome!  I highly recommend this restaurant.  I got the gluten free pineapple upside down pancakes.  They were delicious and huge.  I would've had enough with just one.  I can't wait to eat there again to try other things on the menu.  Service is great, outdoor patio is dog friendly and overall there is a chill and retro vibe.  I can't wait for them to open in downtown Gilbert!

I love this restaurant.  They have a great menu selection and the food is outstanding.  I would give it 5 stars if the wait wasn't so long.  Expect to wait 45-60 minutes if you come to Snooze on a Saturday.  Every time I've ever driven past the restaurant, I always see people waiting outside for a table.    The gluten free pineapple upside down pancakes are my favorite.  They are delicious and the best gluten free pancakes I've ever had.  Yum!  I wish I could have some right now.
This is a must!  Fun breakfast place on ASU campus Tempe AZ.  Corn Beef Hash was great with poached eggs.  Also Snooze Continental with Grapefruit Brûlée - Nice!

The food is not worth the wait.  I knew what the wait was going to be like.  My family and I waited over an hour to be seated.  Our food arrived cold.  With pancakes, it's not the biggest of deals if it's cold because you just kind of deal and  you do not want to send food back.    I ordered the pot pie with gravy.  My meal was stone cold.  The waitress came by after awhile and asked how everything was.  I usually just go with the flow but when I waited an hour to be seated and waited 20 minutes on top of that to get my food, I didn't think I was speaking out of turn.  The waitress offered to "re-fire" my meal but the idea of reheating my meal was not appetizing because each food item re-microwaved would be not the best.  After 10 minutes, the manager came by and offered to re-make my meal.  No thanks, get me out of here.  Too little too late.  I would compare my experience to dining at banquet eating cold catered food.  Pre-made food sitting out presented well.

I went here because I really enjoyed Snooze in Fort Collins, CO. The Snooze in Phoenix lived up to my expectations! The pancakes are huge and delicious. I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a big breakfast or brunch.

If I could give our waitress 10 stars I would! Stacey thanks for being an amazing and hands down the best waitress! She was very very nice, she helped my friend choose one pancake out and she said you guys have to try the sweet potato one! My friend was nervous it'd taste like sweet potato and Stacey was so sure she'd like it that she bought us it! The waitress bought us a pancake to try, just because she was so confident about it...an oh goodness I'm glad she did! It was amazing ! Yes the restaurant was noisy, especially being sat by the front door but I could still hear my friend talking across from me without yelling. We were also surprised at 12:30 on a Monday was busy! We only wait 20 mins so it was fine. I did the duo eggs Benedict and it was delicious! I really like this place, the one in Tempe is also good service. I will be back just because of Stacey.

I showed up here on a Monday. 30 minute wait but I was curious so no big hurry. I finally grab a seat a counter. I was offered coffee a first time then never again. If you like their coffee you have to serve yourself in the corner where it's free for the waiters. The person behind the bar is way to busy to be attentive. Plus I was the oldest dude in the place and felt ignored. I'll live.   The food was OK what there was of it. My rent is less than my omelet was. It's up charge city. And the omelette was smaller than the palm of my hand. Pancakes also underwhelming. Worst part my $25 breakfast arrived cold. Would never go back again. Ever!!

We came here for brunch on Saturday around 9. I would say the earlier you get here, the better . This place filled up quickly, but everyone seems as though they got sat pretty quickly  I started off with a cocktail of grapefruit juice, sparkling wine, and tequila. I can't remember the name of this drink, but it was pretty tasty and not super sweet. I then decided to get the Snooze Spuds Deluxe because it seemed to have everything else I wanted squeezed into one dish (potatoes, cheese, eggs, veggies, and meat). I added spinach, bacon, ham, and jack cheese to mine with over easy eggs. A few people ordered pancakes, so I got to try some of theirs.   My Spuds were delicious. They were very flavorful and filling. It was basically a mix of a hash, omelette, and over easy eggs. A perfect combination in my opinion. I also got to try the french toast (good, but not a fan of coconut) and the cinnamon bun pancake. Oh my god....that cinnamon bun pancake was so amazing. I only needed 1 pancake.   You're near the campus, so I'm guessing a lot of people working there were students, but they all were great and handled our large party very well. I will come back .

I stepped inside and felt like I was in the Jetsons. Very modern, retro. Love the decor. I've been here twice and it is a fun spot for breakfast, brunch or lunch. On my last visit I got the stuffed French toast. I was disappointed by the thin slices of bread used for the toast. They should use texas toast or challach to make the dish better. The filling was also lacking in flavor. On a previous visit, I tried hash browns that were baked and seemed almost raw in the middle- a very starchy potato grainy taste. I would not order those again. Overall, an ok place. I want to try the pancakes that they are famous for.

BACKGROUND   There is no cooler place to eat pancakes in all of Phoenix than Snooze.   SNOOZE AM EATERY: THE HISTORY   Snooze has locations in Colorado, California and 4 in the Phoenix area (Camelback, College, Gilbert and Kierland).   Every Snooze has the iconic super hype decor and edgy lighting. (see pics)   And of course, their amazing menu which includes all sorts of yummy eggs and hollandaise specials, sandwiches and many sides,  BUT LET'S TALK ABOUT THE PANCAKES!!  Pineapple Upside Down Pancakes Sweet Potato Pancakes  Drunken Punk'n Pancakes Blueberry Danish Pancakes  Pancake of the Day Chocolate Chip Pancakes  Peanut Butter Cup Pancakes   And my favorite: Pancake Flight - which is where you can chose any 3 from above! (see pics)  And my next favorite:  The huge selection of breakfast cocktails:  various mimosas, bloodys and mules. (see pics)  CONCLUSION   This is the type of place you can eat at as many times as you want and never get bored.   The service is always decent.   Prices are very reasonable.   5/5 RECOMMEND   OF NOTE   *Tip: Don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit for the morning rush on the weekends.  *Hours: 6:30am - 2:30pm Daily  *For more information: SnoozeEatery.com

Food was amazing, service was on point, and the spot had a great atmosphere. I was actually worried because I had a not so great experience last time I was here, but today was the complete opposite. I will be coming back, a lot!
Had the pancakes, hash browns and egg whites. Wife and daughter had vegan/vegetarian breakfast burrito. Neither one of them could finish burrito and they said it was very good.

Absolutely love this place! One of my favorite breakfast places in all of Arizona! Everything is cooked fresh and tastes amazing! The wait is kinda long but that's expected since everyone wants to eat here. Their pancakes are to die for and their hot cocoa is A+.

We went on a Saturday morning around 10:30 so the wait was clearly expected. Postinos was the perfect place for a Mimosa appetizer to wait out the wait. 40 minutes later, we were seated. The service was great!  The décor and such was right up my alley. I loved the Jacks, the brand colors and the games! The food was simply amazing. We ordered the Bella! Bella! Benny and the OMG! French Toast with a side of bacon. OMG. It was ALL fantastic!  Cannot wait to try the pancake flight!

Have been to this location several times and have felt differently each time. I've tried new things every time I go there, but this last time I was there I found my favorite menu item. To be honest I've never really understood the hype about the pancakes here. Don't get me wrong they are tasty, there just isn't really anything that excites me about them. What does get me excited though is the Breakfast Pot Pie. The rich gravy perfectly compliments the flaky puff pastry with your choice of eggs and a side of hash browns. If you're looking for something savory but still rich this is the option for you. Will definitely be getting this again when I go back.

Finally tried Snooze and glad we did  Have driven by Snooze many times over the last couple of months but never put 2 + 2 together to figure out that's what all the people were waiting for... though they were hanging out at the juice joint next door.   Pro's  ~Friendly staff ~Dog friendly patio ~I love a breakfast joint that can get my bacon right the first time around..I like it burned to a crisp literally and that's just what I got  ~Coffee is great ~Pancakes are amazing.. we ordered blueberry pancake instead of toast and they were mmm.mmm good. Stuffed with nice, big, fresh, juicy, real blueberries  ~The hash browns are great too ~Ping pong to play if you're not lucky enough to get there early ~Complimentary coffee while you wait for a table   Con's ~Long wait depending on what time you arrive.. Our first visit we came at 7am and we got seated right away, 2nd visit we got there at 10:30 am right smack in the middle of their brunch rush... we ended up ordering pancakes to go...they were just as good as eating them their ~If you choose to sit at the bar it's a little slower service as the bar is also prepping drinks for the whole restaurant  Overall 4 stars... we will be back for sure

I had been warned it gets busy so I went early, like 7AM on a Saturday.  By the time I left about 7:45 there were only a few inside tables left.  There is nobody snoozing in the place.  All the employees were cheerful and seeing to it the customers were taken care of.  I had their take on corned beef hash and eggs and it was good.  If it wasn't so far out of my normal path I would be a frequent visitor.

I was pretty excited when I heard that Snooze opened up in my area, and have to say it's a great addition to the ASU area as well. If you are worried about parking there is a public parking garage just right next to Snooze, however they do not validate parking, so you will have to pay, I didn't mind because it meant easy parking and no having dig for change for parking meter, or feeding the parking meter my credit card info.   It was a Wednesday morning and I was in the mood for breakfast so I grabbed my son and daughter, who happen to both be home, which is rare and told them lets head off to breakfast.   I went with the Chiaquiles Benedict, barbacoa beef over tortillas in ranchero sauce, melted cheese, poached eggs, roasted pobalno hollandaise sauce, Pico de Gallo & cotija cheese with a chocolate chip pancake.  I have to say these are some of the best tasting benedicts I have had in a while, I just loved all the flavors and textures, and the hollandaise sauce is what makes this dish blend perfectly.  The Chocolate chip pancake was great too, just what the little kid inside me was craving, fluffy, and chocolaty good!   My daughter and son loved there dishes as well, and my son was surprised that I knew about Snooze, sometimes I think he doesn't know me at all haha.   Another great breakfast at Snooze!

It was April's Breakfast Club UYE meet up and the place picked was Snooze AM Eatery, I have say I was pretty excited to try this place out, and before I even got there I knew I wanted the Pineapple Upside-down Pancakes, how good does that sound?? Oh I was so ready to give it a try!  After everyone was seated we all glanced the menu and after looking at all the great things, I was unsure of what to get, everything sounded soo good.  When it came time to order I went with the Chilaquiles Benedict.  I love eggs benedict and when you can get them styled differently that makes me happy. The Chilaquiles Benedict is barbacoa beef over ranchero sauced tortillas & melted cheese topped with poached eggs & a cream cheesy hollandaise sauce pico de gallo & cotija cheese with a side of hash potatoes.  This dish was visually stunning, and it tasted just as great, very flavourful dish, loved every bite.   Though I didn't get what I originally was wanting, I was not disappointed at all. I loved my dish and look forward to going back to try some more.
I wish I could have breakfast here every day. Loved it!!!! Tea was great, coffee was great servers super nice and helpful, atmosphere wonderful. Just an amazing place!!!! I highly recommend.

I heard good things about this place but know it's always busy and a little bit of a wait so I never bothered before now.  We had a large party and were waiting for about 30 mins to be seated but the wait was definitely worth it. The food here is incredible. I had the sweet potato mash and it was crunchy, delicious, well cooked and the sauce was spot on. Something I enjoyed was the portion wasn't bigger than my head. When food is so good I tend to over eat but the size was just right.  The server was extremely pleasant and answered a few questions from our group helping us decide on what to order (It's a fairly big menu). I tried some of the hash browns too and it was up there with the best I've had.   I felt the seating was cramped for a group our size but in no way can it bring this place down to 4 stars. Snooze is a beast of a brunch spot.

My son was in town visiting us with his girlfriend. They wanted to go somewhere for breakfast after I picked them up from the airport. I thought this place, located in Kierland would be the perfect spot. It was a little cold to sit on the patio - however they do have patio heaters which were nice. It was a Saturday morning and our wait wasn't too bad. They told us it would be about 30 minutes, but it was really only 20!  We had breakfast tacos and pancakes. Everything was yummy!  They brought a sample of their pancake of the day with their homemade cinnamon sauce. I could have eaten only that!  Next time I guess. Great food, great ambiance and friendly staff!

#givespiceboiaraise2017 Spice boi gives service far above his pay-grade. At first unassuming in his short shorts and stache, it soon became clear his service is superior. We came in, a feeble trio- dehydrated and sallow from our previous night of sin. Spice Boi was the angel we didn't know we needed . He brought us not only a pancake-but a life changing experience . Jesus himself wept over this pancake, the syrup made from his tears. The pancakes, light and fluffy .Like tiny fairies dancing on our tongues. This pancake could end wars, or start them.   We left revitalized and renewed with a new purpose, #givespiceboiaraise2017

Came there on a Saturday afternoon, yes for breakfast after a spa treatment.  The wait was 20 mins, GAME!  I heard it can be up to 1 hour (yikes).  So 10 mins in, they text me - Table is ready.  Woot woot!  Love the atmosphere.  Cool tables, chairs, and decor.  I got seated in the back of the place, nice.  I got a green hot tea.  They give you the full on leaves and everything (you know it is pretty good tea).  I got the Breakfast Pot Pie, it was ok.  It was a little bland, needed to add a tab of salt.  I had to get the chocolate chip pancake as a side.  YUM!  The service was great too!  Hash browns could have been a bit crispier.

I don't see myself coming back here.  I met a customer here for breakfast. Customer had eggs Benedict which looked very dry. I had a poached egg which was served below room temp. My coffee was also lukewarm at best and served with a 1/2 shot of creamer. I would've sent it all back and went somewhere else but I was with a customer and didn't want to complain or make a scene. And the flies! Maybe it's the time of year, but I was taken aback with the flies that were in the lobby. Even my customer commented.  Will not return. Do not recommend. There's plenty of restaurants in this area to patronize.  You don't need to subject yourself to mediocre service and sub-par food.

Great breakfast spot in downtown Gilbert! 70s diner theme, super cool decor and ambiance. Must be a pretty popular spot because we arrived at 8:15 am and they were already on a 15 minute wait, so keep this in mind when you go!   We sat inside and service was fairly quick and to the point. I was feeling basic and just got the 3 eggs with bacon, toast, and hash browns, but my husband ordered the breakfast burrito and it may have been the biggest I have ever seen. Really good portions for the prices. Regardless of them being busy, we were in and out in probably an hour. I noticed on our way out that their patio has corn hole and ping pong. It's a great spot for families!   Overall, great food, great time! Thanks Snooze, we will be back.

WE LOVE SNOOZE!! The food is outstanding... it's always one of those meals that you wish would never end! Their Bloody Mary selection is unlike any others I've seen. The staff is always on their toes and give great service!!! Everything about Snooze is what you would be looking for on the weekend or for lunch!

**Vegetarian Friendly**  Um, this place is AMAZING! It's my new favorite breakfast/brunch spot. Really cute indoor and outdoor area. I went on a weekday, and the service was extremely quick. I've heard this place is packed on the weekends so I would anticipate more time.   Entree: OMG French Toast It was such a great french toast. Four pieces, which is the perfect size to share, or eat all yourself. It comes with a salted caramel syrup that really pulls the entire dish together. I highly recommend it for anyone that loves french toast!   Side: Hashbrowns These are normally served in a cylinder shape, BUT I recommend ordering them "extra crispy" because they come flattened out, extra crunchy, and taste even better.   Can't wait to come back!

The service is always amazing! Their food is delicious,  definitely worth the wait. Although the wait for a table is usually long,  once you are seated,  service is prompt,  attentive,  and the food comes fast. This is our favorite breakfast spot.

This was an awesome experience.  We did have to wait a while to get in but it was worth it.  The food was amazing -- tasty, healthy, fresh, and copious.  The service was perfect.  They let me bring my dog and sit on the patio.  I only wish it were open in the evening too.  LOL.  I can't wait to return and hope to bring out of town guests!

30+ of us met here for Breakfast during ASU Family weekend 7AM on a Saturday and despite them forgetting my meal it was phenomenal! I had typical Eggs Benedict which were great and several people tried other versions of the eggs Benedict and loved it.  I didn't hear a complaint and judging by the lines I saw throughout the day and the weekend ... yup they serve an awesome breakfast!  You can sit outside or inside - great place I plan on going back to.

Wasn't impressed by the service and felt very rushed! Just wanted to have a relaxing breakfast and write in my journal plus wanted to order some pancakes after I ate my burrito but didn't have a chance cause the waitress pretty much tossed the bill at me and said nothing to me. Maybe she was having a bad day but you lost a 1st time guessed and I will go back to Liberty Market who have excellent customer service!

Amazing pancakes!  We had a few samples brought out for our group this morning and they were perfect. We had the server pick the spread and it would not have been my first choice, glad we let him. They were perfect! !

I would highly recommend not visiting this location. I've been at least 5 times and unfortunately the service is spotty, at best.   The first few times I just chalked it up to a server, the kitchen, or the barista having a bad day, but after the 5th time, I believe this location must be poorly managed.   Twice I've waited 10 minutes or longer to be acknowledged by a server after being seated. About two thirds of the times, our order is messed up.  This last time: after waiting 20 minutes, we sat and waited 10 more to be acknowledged. By then we were ready to order and I was dying for a cup of coffee. All food came out fast and was good. I was never asked if I wanted my coffee or water refilled. Once we finished eating, we sat for another 10 minutes while our server was either on a break or just conversing with another patron. Mind you, there was a line out the door of people waiting for a table. Our table could've been turned over a minimum of 10 minutes faster... probably more like 20 if she had been attentive.   However, because this is an ongoing problem at this location, I don't think this was totally the server's fault. I believe the management has not trained people properly and/or has other issues in the implementation of their systems they are not addressing.   It is unfortunate, as the food (aside from order mistakes) usually tastes great and it's a great place to take large families. Maybe if the management spent some time at some at really busy restaurants observing how an attentive staff can turn tables over faster and make customers happier, they'd see how they can improve.   TLDR; Great food, poor service. Head to the Tempe location.
Snooze was so good!! We had an order for our office and the order was correct and still hot! I had the banana Nutella French toast and I've never had anything better. Highly Recommend this place !

I'LL BE BACK! Rate 4.5 ( most likely will have a wait time of 20 min or longer  if you go after 9a). *First time I went to go(in CO @union station) the wait was 1.5 hours. Skipped that...and tried this location...HAPPY I WENT!  Customer Service: Very friendly and knowledgeable about the food... which helped me make my decsion.  Atmosphere: Busy, kinda loud (just cause so many people were there), good for small and large groups.  Food: Delicious and genourse portions (left w/ a full but not too stuffed tummy)  Chili Verde Benedict : Corn tortilla w/ Shredded beef(barboca(sp?)), pico de gallo, poached eggs sprinkled w/ cheese. Came w/ hash browns.  Cornbeef Hash w/ French toast (OMG): Shredded beef and potatoes (hashbrown style) crispy on the outside and tastey...yum!  OMG French Toast(name fits the dish) : Vanilla flavor enriched w/ syrup, coconut, and strawberries.

Just got done eating at Snooze. Nick greeted us at the door about as friendly as a host could be. Cisco, our waiter was absolutely the best. Friendly and prompt service. I had the delicious breakfast tacos and a chocolate pancake that was to die for. Definitely one of my new favorites.

Snooze is one of my favorite brunch spots in the valley. I love that they offer pancake trios so you can try different flavors. Their menu items are fun and so is their atmosphere. The mimosas are great - lots of flavors to choose from. Just be prepared for a long wait! On Saturdays or Sundays you may waiting on a table for an hour or more.

Delicious food. Great service. Wonderful drinks. What more could you ask for? I love this place. Dog friendly. The flight of pancakes is a good way to figure out which one you like the best, but I liked them all!!

Not what I was expecting from the typical hipster breakfast joint in the biltmore. In fact the food was amazing along with a great vintage atmosphere that could be considered a mix from the contemporary 50's with some retro 70's to spice it up. The price matched the food with everything being made from scratch along with some of the best country gravy I've ever had! I recommend anyone to go and check out the food, the ambiance, and the very nice ladies that dish you up your food along with great customer service!

If I was to review this purely on food, I'd probably give it 5 stars. I've tried a few different things here and have not been diaper whatsoever. Even the coffee is amazing lol. The only drawback is that the breakfast and brunch crowd is always so so crazy. I don't think I've ever had less than a 45 min wait. But I still wait because the food is worth it! The place itself has a retro vibe to it with cool decor. I do recommend it!

What a Gem!  Welcome to Phoenix Snooze!!  I have been hearing about this place for years from my sister who goes to the Denver location whenever she is there.  Once we found out it was here in Phoenix we were ready to go!  I went with her suggestion and ordered a pancake flight.  This is a genius idea and gives you your choice of 3 pancakes of your choosing.  I had their pineapple upside down, apricot buttermilk and a BanaNutella.  They were absolutely fabulous!  I know we are all trying to cut back or avoid carbs these days but this is definitely worth the splurge!  If it makes you feel better, go hike a mountain first then get some delicious pancakes!! I will be back for sure!

Expect to wait awhile if you're coming during the school year during the weekend brunch rush. This is easily one of the better breakfast places in Tempe. When I come here with a friend we like to split the gluten free pancake flight and regular 2 egg breakfast. My friend has celiac disease and they are very accommodating. The gluten free pancakes are just as good as the regular ones, super fluffy and sweet. Make sure to ask about some of the flavors that aren't listed on the menu, the cinnamon roll and sweet potato are my personal favorites. The hashbrowns and eggs are also spot on.
Great food, short wait times, a lot of GF options. The fresh pressed apple juice is AMAZING! Also loved the GF pancakes and seasoned potatoes!

We enjoy each and every visit to Snooze, our food and service is always 5 stars! You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. My daughters favorite is the pineapple upside down pancakes. We always enjoy sitting at the bar, because the bartenders are so friendly and attentive. Today was a memorable visit, I was able to test try Lisa's bacon cocktail that she will be serving on Bacon Day! It was awesome, a little spicy, sweet, and refreshing. We will definitely be visiting on Bacon Day to enjoy her signature cocktail again! Hopefully it will be added to the menu.

I got the standard eggs, ham and hash brown. It was absolutely delicious. My sister had an omelet with ham and mushrooms and said it was very good. Also said the coffee was good. Our server Angela was phenomenal. Made sure we were taken care of. Definitely coming back.

Food is not only delicious, but I value their commitment to quality ingredients, local, fair trade, and organic when possible. Love their willingness to customize meals with no attitude. Cool, friendly staff, funky place, good vibe. Brunch does require a wait, but the complimentary coffee helps, and this place is worth the wait!

I have been wanting to try this place for a while now and still didn't really get to try it. I went there with my pooch and sat on the patio. Despite my flaky friend not showing up I decided to stay. It was a cloudy day and a little chilly so I ordered a hot almond milk latte. (I love places that offer more than the normal milk n soy options.) One of the staff members was very willing to turn on one of the outside heaters for me. Almost immediately after ordering my Latte it started raining. They rapidly put up the umbrellas in an attempt to keep my pooch and I dry. This is when i received several drama filled phone calls and stirred up emotion for me. I was crying, wet, and had a miserable dog. I got my latte to go.   I am writing this review Because of the great smiling service I received. I had multiple check ins by several different staff members. They truly did everything they could. Thanks guys- keep up the good work.   Can't wait to try your food.

First time here, love the vibe. Got a seat outside on the patio. Had great service from Melinda. She hooked it up w a tasty pancake while we waited for our food. My harvest Benny ended up not being my fav which wasn't a big deal to me but the management ended up giving me a discount. I dig this place. Everyone that works here seems happy which feeds the over all positive welcome vibe.

I had previously left a 4 star review so I came back in hopes of another great experience. This visit wasn't so pleasant. While I was seated quickly, I had a very strange food experience and less than stellar service.  I ordered a pancake and when it arrived it was stone cold. I flipped It over to see if it was undercooked or something and It revealed big slash marks in the pancake which put me off the rest of my breakfast. I couldn't wave anyone down because my waiter forgot I was there so by the time I was remembered, it was too late. The waiter explained that the cuts were to make sure it was done?!?! Uh if you have to destroy one side of a thin pancake to determine the doneness, you shouldn't be making them. I made perfect pancakes when I was 10 years old and never had to do that nor any other place I have ever had pancakes had the underside look like that.  On the positive, they did apologize and remove the charge from my bill. I just will refrain from the pancakes at this location going forward and continue to flip them over in the future.

Great casual diner to grab some delicious breakfast. My favorites are the breakfast tacos, OMG French toast, and the eggs with hash browns. This place will not disappoint and very reasonably priced as well.

Delicioso! La combinación de eggs benedict con chilaquiles es brillante! Mi esposa y yo compartimos también french toast de vainilla se llaman OMG. Los hubiera preferido sin el coco rallado pero de cualquier forma excelente.  Llegamos un poco tarde aprox a la 1 y tardaron en darnos mesa pero comprensible por que había mucha gente. Hay veces que prefiero ver lleno a vacío!  Cielo nublado por lo que nos sentamos afuera y estuvo muy agradable.   Pidan el café! Tiene un sabor agradable

Came here with my family including my 3 year old and had an outstanding breakfast. Place was packed with lots of people and had a great vibe. We were told there was a 35 minute wait so we sat at a high top outside in the meantime and enjoyed yummy pineapple mimosas and the kids had juice. The table took about 45 minutes but the time flew by just hanging out and having a great time. Everybody's meal was outstanding, fresh and extremely flavorful. The portions were spot on and left you satisfied and not overly stuffed and gross feeling after. It was a great way to spend a Sunday morning with family and we will be back for sure.

Snooze is consistently awesome. Food - beverages - service...  The only downfall is that your food almost always hits the table before a glass of water and/or your coffee does.  Not sure if that's a big deal to everyone. I'm just normally thirsty AF.

Ummm.. Worth the wait is all I can say.   Positives:  This old fashioned diner style place is adorable. I was wondering why the wait was so long.. But soon figured it out after my first bite. Wow! It is a fun place to go when you have the time.  Both the savory and sweet dishes are amazing.  I preferred mine, the eggs Benedict to the pancakes but those were also crazy good. I recommend ordering a side of bacon as it was delicious.   Negatives: Don't go here if you're in a rush. You will certainly have to wait your turn

Yes. One of our favorite spots. It may not be a favorite locally owned place but their food is delicious and the staff is always friendly. Will defiantly continue to come here. Try the Benedict's and pancakes we have never gone wrong.

Eggs Benedict - salsa verde is untouchable.  Wow so freaking delicious.  I seriously day dream about this stuff.  I don't know how to explain it other then you won't be disappointed.  It has so much flavor and every bite will take you closer to heaven.

The place is average. Like most people have commented it's not worth all the hype. The specialty items on the menu and morning drinks make it unique. The service is average. For as many people as they have on staff, I'd expect better service.  Personally, I still prefer Liberty Market or the Farmouse.

The place oversell their service. You can be waiting for a 90 min. Crazy wasting time. Go somewhere else or get there earlier. Not a good experience. Offering to get you the food and you eat somewhere else.

In town for a wedding and we showed up around 10 on a Friday.  20 minute wait but it was totally worth it.  Not only was this one of the most flavorful and delicious breakfasts Ive ever had, but our waiter Flip (I think was his name) was above and beyond.  I've honestly never had a waiter foresee the needs of the table so quickly and instantly.  You'd thing this was a $200 a plate steak house.  Amazing service and amazing food, I will definitely be returning!

Yum!! We ordered the pancake of the day as a appetizer and it was coconut mocha! It was really good & one pancake was just enough for my fiancé & I to share. Wasn't too sweet or heavy either!  We both opted for the house made granola, Greek yogurt, grapefruit and hashbrowns! Everything was Delish! Overall the breakfast was pretty heavy on the sugar but we are on vacation so it was a good indulgence   Service was great, we sat outside on the patio & it was a beautiful morning.  I would recommend the cake of the day!

Amazing and relaxed breakfast spot!! The decor as you walk in is out of this world--literally it looks like you stepped into the 1950s. The staff was so receptive and kind and seated my friend and I right away. Snooze's menu is extensive, but their main feature is their pancakes. I ended up getting their egg scramble, which comes with three choices of topings (on them) and and toast and hashbrowns. I got my scramble filled with chicken sausage, Spinach and feta; and selected rye toast as my side. Oh wow, the scramble was so delicious! Everything was so fresh, light, and tasty--only thing I added was a little bit of peppet for some spice otherwise everything was great! This includes the rye toast that came with their homemade jam!! The hashbrown cake rounded everything out and was just enough for a great 11am breakfast!!  I love that Snooze uses local ingredients in all of their breakfast and brunch items! Totally check them out when you need to hit the snooze and may miss making your own breakfast!!

Quinoa hot cereal and eggs Benedict were to die for! Our waitress was so accommodating as she allowed me to combine my eggs benedict with two different kinds as I could not decide between the Bella Bella and the Benny Goodman. So they gave me one of each so that was great!   Great coffee, great patio seating, and just great food!

This place is fantastic! We are here visiting and wanted to find a great breakfast place. I came across this recommendation and got in the car and showed up. The menu has tons of options, the servers are really attentive and everyone was super friendly. Coffee selection is very good and boy, the breakfast drink menu was fantastic! Tje food was genersouly portioned and very very good! A job well done by Snooze!
Great food, great atmosphere, and great mimosas! I love the décor and also love the outside seating area!  One of our favorite places to get breakfast!

Sunday morning breakfast .... Get there before 8:30am or be prepared to wait. Food delicious Spouse had pancakes and we are pancake snobs, no one ever can meet our expectations.
