These were blueberry pancakes and they were as close to homemade as I've tasted. DElicious Mom and I split an egg/spinach sandwich on ciabatta with holland aide aioli. Kitchen split in two plates for us always a very classy touch. Aioli served in side instead of sandwich ...great move so each ca put as little or much as they want. Ciabatta was fresh and soft, aioli was just the right flavor smack for the sandwich. Only complaint is they should have soy creamer not just soy milk. Our Sunday morning was late March so at that hour it was beautiful and cool.  But all they have is garage doors open and patios with umbrellas. Owners are from Colorado ... Obviously don't have a concept of 120 degree weather.  They should be made to eat an entire lunch meal on patio from April in and rethink their cooling strategy  Sales will certainly tell.  No matter how delicious the food is, it can't be enjoyed under little shade and no cooling
The Sandwhich I Am is amazing! Hash browns are addicting! Get the pancake flight. Great service and awesome decor. This is a HUGE plus for our neighborhood. Will continue to go back
Best breakfast spot!! Amazing Bloody Mary's... Pancakes are beyond words.  They also have a great selection of healthy choice!!

Hmm...trying to understand all of the 5 star reviews. I definitely need to give this place another try, I think. We came in late this morning (ok fine it was closer to noon) for some brunch. The place was hoppin' and we were told there was a 30-45 minute wait. We grabbed some coffee at the complimentary station (a plus!) and took a seat to wait. After about 15 minutes the hostess offered up 2 spots at the "communal" table to anyone who wanted to take it, so we snatched it up!  It took quite awhile to get a waitress over for our drink orders, and this lady was NOT happy. Couldn't crack a smile to even fake it. So that was a bummer. After about 20 minutes, the food came out. The food was pretty good, I'm missing where all of the rave food reviews are coming from, but I don't doubt that other items on the menu are fabulous. I got the eggs benedict (one traditional style and the other "Bunny! Bunny! Benni" I believe it was called, which had shaved prosciutto, arugula, balsamic...I was not blown away by any of it. The hash brown cake that came with it was kind of bland and a bit under-cooked. My fiancé (!) had the breakfast burrito. It was gigantic and he devoured every bite and loved it. Will try again, order something else, and hope for a server who can muster up a smile :)

This was a quick breakfast stop for me as I headed to the airport and it was worth it!! Nice decor. An updated modern venue. On ASU campus. Hours are 6:30-2:30 pm. I sat at the counter and the young lady served with a smile. The food came out in a reasonable amount of time. The portion sizes were great and will have you happy and full! I ordered the OMG French toast and highly recommend it!! I also had a side of chicken sausage, it was the best I had so far!! And it was flat like a patty versus the links you normally see. Great atmosphere and breakfast!

It's ok, the food wasn't unique in taste. Staff was great though.  I got the breakfast tacos. They're ok, but taste wise nothing flavorful. I ordered mushrooms and avocado with it. They barely put any mushrooms on there and then didn't put the avocado. When we asked for it they brought out maybe 1/3 of an avocado so 1 Slides for each taco for $2.  Grapefruit mimosa was really good.
I met up with some friends here when I was heading out of town.  They had great food and was very kid friendly.  The pancakes were very good.
Always great food. Always quick service. My favorite breakfast place. Good music good vibes and great Columbian coffee to get your day started off. Staff is full of energy.

I heard a lot of great reviews about this place so I decided to check it out because of their famous pancakes. When I arrived the line was so long so I opted to take out. One of the waiters was very accommodating however the one of the ones up in front didn't seem to care if I was there. I waited about 30 minutes and when I finally sat down to eat my food. The beacon was burnt the egg was under cooked and the pancakes were alittle dry and hard. I hate to say the food didn't even compensate for the service. I was disappointed. Unfortunate for the first time experience.
Has great breakfast options but I'm not sure I would wait in line for a long time to receive this service.  Honestly, I go sometimes because I know Michael Phelps eats here A TON!

Wow. Just wow. I had the blueberry pancake. Delicious!!  The service is great and our waitress JENNA is on point. She is very attentive. Bonus! House coffee (Guatemalan blend) is my fave. Come super early it gets busy!!

A friend invited me to this gem and I immediately knew why. The warm and welcoming staff took care of me like an honored guest in their home. The atmosphere was nostalgic with out being corny. It feels like a small family business, but runs like a well oiled machine. I hope they open one in Hawaii soon.

After hearing countless reviews and people raving about Snooze we decided to brave the crowds and long wait on a Sunday morning, bad idea. After a quoted forty-five Minute waited we received our table was ready via text... It wasn't quite "ready yet", after arriving to the counter we where told it would be just one minute.. Or twenty more of standing inside being pushed and shove by the crowd, after being told three times our table was being cleaned, and six or seven tables being sat before us, I watched as the host cleared a table a few rows in and FINALLY sat us, we then waited ten minutes to be greeted by a server who was visually displeased. As the meal progressed getting the smallest things to the table as water and ketchup seemed to not only be the most excruciatingly painful thing for our server but also took plenty of time.. The food was okay, took a bit longer then expected, but the service left a sour taste in our group of sevens mouth that we just couldn't shake.. I don't know if I'll give snooze a second shot or not, the service was some of the worst I've had in the industry.
Delicious! Perfect egg Benedict and awesome flight of pancakes. Will definitely come back the next time we visit our son at ASU

My first visit I ordered the breakfast tacos and they were delicious. My second trip I ordered the breakfast burrito and the green chili had a little spice. I had added ham with the burrito and it was most pleasing.   Their americanos are pretty good. However,  I cannot say the same about the coffee pancakes. Otherwise, great service and great food.
Probably best breakfast in town. Cage free eggs and best pancakes and great service from Charles and Echo.
Visiting from Maryland and this brunch place was so good! I got the Ham Benedict III which is eggs Benedict and it was great! My friend got the pineapple upside down pancakes and they were sooo good!

Went here for breakfast the other morning and I loved it! Place is very cute inside. When we got there our waitress told us that their specialties were pancakes and benedicts so I opted for their chilaquiles Benedict and was very satisfied! My husband got the huevos rancheros with chorizo and that was really good too! We are within walking distance so we will definitely be back for more :)

Well food not bad but good also, take long time and also was cold really cold, friend also have cold food, 5 out of 10, coffee was cold if I want a ice coffee I would ask for it 5 out of 10, us timer service awful, all waiters was on all the tables, is like it to many hands to making a cake, keep asking for service over all 2 out of 10, won't come back

Went there last week for the first time And I have to admit the service was not as good as I expected. My girlfriend and I waited for almost 30 mins for our food to come out. When the food did actually come out, it was already cold so we asked for it to be heated up again. The food was decent, but the fact that we had to wait for another 15 mins longer to get a nice heated brunch was quite unreasonable. I'd probably go back one day to give it another try, but not any time soon.

We got to Snooze on an early Saturday morning around 8am.  We got there and there was no wait. We were seated outside and I decided to get the corn beef hash.  You are able to substitute your hash browns or toast for a pancake for I decided to get a pineapple upside down pancake instead of toast.  I almost ate the whole thing.  The pancake was probably one of the best pancakes I have ever had in a really long time.  It wasn't too sweet and it was really fluffy.  I left a happy camper.  I will come back again and my recommendation is to come early to avoid the waits because as we were leaving, there was at least six or seven people waiting.

ONCE WAS ENOUGH.....My wife and I had been here once, the service was slow and it took 25min. for our food to get to the table. The food was good , and the place was packed. on our second visit there may have been 20 customers in the place and just as many staff. The girl who seated us threw 2 menus on the table and walked off. 16 min. later nobody had taken our drink orders or said a word to us. The server was playing with a customers dog. we left and will never return. Hipsters may love this joint and the trendy setting , Snooze and Hipsters have one thing in common ALL SHOW AND NO GO.

All you need to know is that you should go ! !   If I lived here I'd eat here once a week.   Yes, it is busy but all good things are.    The staff is very nice and the service is performed perfectly.  EXCELLENT ! !

Sweet or savory. No matter what you order from the menu, the food is delicious! Great staff with wonderful service. We drive out of our way to visit this Snooze location because we get treated by the manager, Travis.
Best breakfast spot in the valley!! Love this place. I want to go back tomorrow for the sweet potato pancakes.

I have been wanting to try this place. Every time I drove by there has always been a long wait. When we were able to try it on a Monday morning. We got seated right away. After sitting down it was extremely cold and loud inside. When we asked our server (girl with tats and piercings) if we could move outside and we got major attitude. After moving outside our new server was friendlier. My husband got the breakfast burrito and I got the Sammy we both thought the food was good but a little overpriced for what you get. We didn't think this place was anything special.

I'm not exactly unbiased here. I relocated from Denver. Year ago and my former residence was next to the Littleton location. It's not uncommon to have a 30 minute wait Tuesday morning at 10:00am. I love ALL the Benedict's and infused alcohols make for a fun breakfast too. The Town and Country location (great choice btw, good culture match) is of the same quality and it shows in the staff. A must try for foodies and families that like fun, good food and great atmosphere.

Kiersten, the assistant general manager, really went above and beyond for me today! I am in the service industry as well and always appreciate genuine hospitality and a desire to help others. Will definitely be recommending Snooze to the guests at my hotel.

The free coffee is a great start and it taste freshly brewed. The whole ambience is amazing and the chicken sausage has a little kick but great flavor. The black beans have a zesty flavor and the menu has so much more that you just have to try

I really love the interior design and the free coffee during the wait. We went at 7:45 to avoid the rush but we still ended up waiting about 20 minutes. I can't imagine going during peak times. Our waitress seemed really busy but she was super nice cause she even wrote on our to go boxes which pancake is which cause we were confused earlier. The food was good but it wasn't anything extraordinary. If the wait was longer, I would have no problem going to some other breakfast place.
Wow what a waste of time... rancid food and way over priced. Stay away unless you hate yourself. Recommend farm house down the road or even IHOP hahaha

I have been here numerous times now and the customer service keeps getting better and better! Their staff are always friendly and super inviting! Not to mention to food is also great! Their pancakes are the best I have had! I totally recommend the blueberry pancakes. I recently brought my mom with me and she said their French toast was the best she has ever had!

We walked to Snooze from home with our dog this am to try it for the first time.  My wife was VERY excited and had been talking about it for weeks.  Although they were busy, we left our name and they asked for a cell# in order to text us when our table was ready.  What a great idea and why isn't everyone doing this???  The hostess said about ten minutes and was spot on.  We sat on the patio where our dog was not only welcomed but doted on and brought fresh water.  I love anyplace that loves my pooch!  Onto breakfast!  The menu is different, very different.  Be prepared to expand your breakfast horizons and I mean that in a most awesome way!  If I were going to say anything at all negative about this place (which I'm not) it would be the "coffee narrative". The coffee, while good, is not worthy of the two page slightly pretentious story of how it came to be on our table.  So...I had a sweet potato pancake with pecans and caramel syrup that was like revisiting Thanksgiving only better, and two totally different, totally awesome versions of eggs Benedict.  My wife had two other versions of the Benedict and we literally wiped the plates.  I'd be here all day describing them so you'll just have to go and try it.  We will definitely be back!

I really like Snooze, so I'm happy to now have one in my neighborhood.  I've already visited this location a few times and I'd have to say it gets better every time.  On my last visit, I had the OMG.  It was the bomb.  I also had an iced caramel mocha, which also was the bomb.  The wait staff and baristas, bomb.  Even the managers, BOMB.  I will be back soon and often.  Thank you!

On campus in Tempe, went on a Saturday morning so the wait was long as expected but once we were sat we had a great waiter and delicious food. One of my favorites now! I tried the Snooze Simple dish with 3 eggs, choice of meat, hash browns, and toast! It was a perfect amount of food for the price and it was delicious! Can't wait to come back!
Friendly staff and pretty good food.  Gets busy during the school year, so plan for that.

The first time I went to Snooze was in Denver, so I set my expectations high considering my wonderful experience. I came to visit my boyfriend in Gilbert and noticed a location in town, therefore I couldn't resist stopping in to tame my breakfast-loving appetite. This location did NOT disappoint.   Upon entering, I immediately noticed the similar decor. I'm sure the decor is parallel among all the Snooze locations and it gives it a classy charm. Although we had to wait, a waitress came by to ask if we wanted to start with anything to drink while we waited. The Snooze experience was off to a good start!  Once seated, my boyfriend and I browsed over the menu of atypical breakfast fare. Snooze has your basic eggs and pancakes, but they know how to take it up a notch to keep customers coming back for more. Our server immediately came to take our drink orders, then we made our breakfast decisions. Customer service seemed to be a priority at Snooze.  My boyfriend ordered the Sandwich I Am. Although it wasn't up my alley, it sure pleased him! The pretzel bun seemed to really make the sandwich what it was, and the hollandaise sauce to top on was a surprisingly good touch! If you're into bacon, my boyfriend recommends ordering some bacon to put on the sandwich. The bacon (which I tried) is some of the best bacon I've ever had.  I had the three egg omelet with hashbrowns. The eggs were nice and fluffy and the vegetables were fresh. However, the hashbrowns definitely stole the show! I'm very picky about my hashbrowns, but these were not too greasy and not too soggy. They had the perfect texture and had nice crispy bits. I could easily just eat the hashbrowns as a meal. Make sure you order some if your meal doesn't already come with them.  All in all, I highly recommend coming to Snooze. Great customer service, great food. This place still stands as my favorite breakfast joint (even as a Chicago foodie!).

Snooze is a special breakfast eatery. Service is top notch, the ambiance is warm and friendly and the food choices fit most every palate. The flights of pancakes make it possible for everyone at your table to sample their deliciousness. I could go on but you should try it yourself. Oh and btw, on the weekend if you arrive after 9 expect a wait to be seated. It's ok...it's worth it.
Everything was really good from food to  service and even the ambience. The wait was really long but so worth it. I would definitely recommend it if you don't mind waiting an hr to eat.

I have been to Snooze several times for weekend Brunch and it is always, hands down, a phenomenal experience. I don't know why I continue to be surprised by how quickly and friendly their staff works to get customers seated and served (without making the dining experience feel rushed) - especially being that they are one of the most popular places in town to catch a Sunday brunch.   The last two times I have dined there, I have had Jessica as my server and she was phenomenal - especially considering we had a large group with several children in our party. She was so kind and patient with our out of town guests (who had never dined at Snooze before) offering up a variety of her favorite choices. She was so sweet and friendly with the children (they LOVED her!) and made sure our waters (and mimosas) stayed full.   She checked on us often without being over bearing and all of her recommendation on food were perfect. We had a range of savory and sweet selections and I, honestly, couldn't find one thing to complain about from any of it. From start to finish every experience I have had and every member of their staff was wonderful.   There is just a great vibe and energy that exudes from Snooze and the delicious food just makes it the total brunch package. We will be back time and time again.

First time finally trying this place out.  I've been here 4 times but it is always too busy to get a seat without waiting 1-2 hours.  This time we came at 730am on a Sunday which was the perfect time since dining room was half full and patio is empty.  The menu is eclectic and different from any other breakfast place.  They have a list of hollandaise concoctions, breakfast tacos that are to die for, many different pancake options and the typical breakfast fare such as omelettes, eggs etc.  the service was fast and super friendly.  We had 3 different servers talk to us and make sure we were taken care of.  We will definitely be coming back and if there is a wait, it is indeed worth waiting.  Until next time.

Have I ever had a bad experience at Snooze? No I have not!   To be honest, Snooze is probably my favorite breakfast joint. I love every single thing I've tried there (and I've tried a lot). My favorite thing on the menu to order are their different variations of Eggs Benedict. I'm a sucker for some good EB.   And then there is this heavenly creation called the Pineapple Upside Down Pancake. Stop. Or don't. Either way, I'm about that pancake.   The servers, despite waking up before dawn, are always in chipper moods and are quick at accommodating your needs. While you wait, they're even out on the patio grabbing drink orders to get you started. "I'll have like 8 of your various mimosas please."  I adore this place. The decor is super unique, it makes you feel like you've traveled back in time with all of the super retro patterns, but it is definitely a great way to start your morning with all of those sunny, bright colors.   Seriously, Snooze is always top of my list for breakfast. (Ask all of my friends)
This place is amazing. Really nice service and unique twist on traditional breakfast. I live in the west valley but will be making the haul for this place.
The eggs Benedict are really good and the best part is you can choose two kinds and get half and half!!   The wait can be long but it's worth it!
One of the best breakfast restaurants around (right up there with crackers)  The Eggs benedict were awesome.   Can't wait to return.
Always amazing! The staff, food, and drinks are top awesome! The wait may be a bit long but soooo worth it! Definitely try one their daily pancakes!

After a quick AM flight from ONT into PHX, on a rainy Saturday morning, we decided to partake in the most important meal of the week - Brunch.  A quick look on Yelp for some good eats and SnoozeAM had all the stars and solid reviews to coerce us into taking the drive into Tempe.  The line was long, wait time longer but low and behold two seats were available at the bar. We giggled with glee as we swooped in on the coveted bar stools. Immediately we were greeted and given menus, and we already knew that we were ready for our Mary's. I had a spicy Bloody Mary and my Love had the Beet Juice Mary. Different but good. More on the refreshing side. Very nice!  I ordered the egg white frittata Florentine and hubby had the "pick two" eggs Benedict ... chilaquiles and pulled pork. He wasn't a fan of the chilaquiles but loved the pork one.  Earlier we debated on whether or not we should split a pancake. Our server must have overheard this small debate because she came out with this amazing complimentary pecan caramel pancake for us to share!  Fifth star earned!  Menu is full of goodness and we would for sure go back!  Five stars " brunch and beyond!" Review for SnoozeAM!

We live minutes down the street. My husband and I ordered takeout on a Sunday morning. Everything was cold but the taste of the OMG French toast was amazing. The breakfast tacos were Ok I'm sure they would have tasted better if they were hot. We never received a drink for my son's kids meal. I would give this place another try but wouldn't order take out again.

Went here for my brothers birthday.  The wait was a little long, but totally worth it.  The waiter was very polite and quick.  He was on top of our drinks and grabbing us refills.  I had asked him to "surprise me" and his concoction was simply amazing.  They even have a soyrizo "meat" option for those of us on a plant based diet.  I'll be back!
The best Eggs Benedict that I've ever had!! I ordered a half entree which was more than filling! Will absolutely be back!

My boyfriend and I came in with high expectations and they were definitely met! For 9:30 am on a Tuesday they were very busy, and we were told there would be a 15 minute wait, or we could sit at the bar right then. We chose to sit at the bar. Our coffee was brought right away and our cup was never less than half full! Our food came very quickly and was delicious! I ordered the quinoa porridge and it was AMAZING. My boyfriend got the OMG french toast and he absolutely loved it too. The service was amazing as well, very friendly and attention! Thank you snooze!
Awesome breakfast place with a laid back casual atmosphere but super nice food. My wife and I split the pot pie and Bella Bella Bennys twice. Both are great choices.
My new go-to breakfast joint in the neighborhood. Yay, Denver! Thanks for bringing us #Snooze!

I used to go to Snooze when I lived in Denver. I was beyond excited to see it in my neighborhood a few months ago!  Pros: Breakfast tacos are amaze-ing Coffee drinks Bloody Mary's Patio in the fall Management is on top of things  Cons: Service can be kind of slow Always a wait on the weekends
Was not worth the long wait. Eggs Benedict was tiny, ask for the hashbrown a extra crispy or else they come in an ice cream scoop shape and are soft. Food took over 30 minutes to come out.

I'm a huge fan of Snooze at home in SD, so I was really excited to see how the the Snooze in my new home fares against my other home. Verdict: very reliable. Same delicious options, similarly great staff, and same indecision in what the heck I want to order!! (Thank goodness for flights!)   I came with a party of 40 and we were able to make reservations for outside, which was really nice since I'd been accustomed to waiting for AGES in San Diego. From what I've heard from other friends, the wait here in Gilbert is similarly long. But hey, what would you do for a reliable and moderately priced brunch?! I definitely think I'll be coming back around when I want a good brunch fix and a small piece of home! (oh or just a bunch of different bennies!)

I was so happy to find this place when I came for a visit. Staff was on point, food was amazing, and the design/atmosphere of the place was great. Was so grateful for the gluten free options that they had.

Great place to go for an energetic atmosphere. The place is very colorful and really upbeat in spirit. The cocktail selection is really unique and the menu is a lot on the healthy side so that's a plus. This is definitely one to visit again and make it one of my favs for breakfast.

My favorite breakfast spot! Substitutions encouraged meaning it's great for picky eaters and wonderful selections! The tacos and burrito are always a hit as well as the spuds deluxe. They always are offering free drinks and pancakes too! Overall a great experience

Everything about this place is so great....the decor, the AMAZING food and the best waitress, Jessica, that anyone can ask for!  The pancakes are to die for and while I don't like Eggs Benedict normally the Chili Verde one with pork was a great one.  The service is top notch and me and my girlfriends learned so much about this place and what they stand for...thanks again to Jessica.  I only wish we had something like this in our little town of Brentwood, CA!  It would make a killing.  Can't wait to try other locations during my travels but this place is worth any wait.  Jessica is a top notch waitress who you can tell truly loves the company and her job.  Thanks again for making it a wonderful experience Jessica...you rock!!  YUM

I'm a Denver-ite, so I'm of course a huge Snooze fan/regular. I'm easily won over with decadent pancakes and incredibly boozy iced coffee.  Visited the Tempe location with a friend and was not disappointed. We got chilaquiles benedict, salsa verde benedict, OMG french toast & a PB cup pancake. For starters - WAY too much food for two people but, we're gluttons for punishment and breakfast foods so we stuffed ourselves into oblivion. The sweet eats are always my favorite - but the benedicts were damn good too. The chilaquiles was my favorite of the two.  Only downside is the wait times are almost always SO. LONG. But, that's a sign of a good place, no? We put in for two and were told about a 30-45 min wait, which is pretty standard around late Sunday brunch time. They serve coffee in the standing area while you wait though, so that's a nice occupier. However, if bar top seating comes open it's first come first serve and we scooped up two spots about 15 minutes into the wait. Scoooooore! It's also located on campus, so take that for what it's worth - we figured it would be filled with boozing college kids (because you know, we're SO old & far removed from that lifestyle in our late 20's ha!), but it wasn't at all an issue.   Eat the pancake flight. Get the AM Manhattan. Then go home & take a nap.

I ate here yesterday, and it made me sick as a DOG! I will NEVER eat here again!  To give you some context, I do not have a sensitive stomach; friends often refer to me as having a stomach of the Gods. I can have bloody mary's for breakfast, chipotle for lunch (with all of their salsas), and indian food for dinner... without so much as a rumble from my tummy.  That being said, I ate one of their new sammies, the name of which escapes me. But basically, it was a pretzel bun, topped with cheesy eggs, a sausage patty, and cheddar hollondaise sauce... and one of the worst mistakes of my life.   I am still recovering, unable to eat or keep fluids down, but I do seem to be improving slowly.   Before this awful experience, I had eaten at the Snooze in Denver and found it to be a decent breakfast spot with bizarre, overly sweet pancakes. For that experience, I give them three stars... for this last experience, I give them none (but yelp makes me give at least one).  And getting sick once, is one too many times for me. This should NEVER happen at ANY resturant. Will definitely NOT be returning.
Had the corned beef hash with eggs and a side of hash browns,outstanding the coffee is brewed medium,the service is always with a smile perfect breakfast for spring training

I am writing this review based on service. We went in on a Friday morning around 820. There was no wait and a bunch of tables inside or outside. We got a table for 2 inside against the window, sat down and looked at the menu. Another party of 2 sits down two tables from us about 5 minutes later. Now we are waiting for a waitress to at least take our order or offer us coffee or water. Now it's about 10 minutes and then the waitress comes and takes the order of the party of 2 and even brought them water. She made about 3 trips to that table and didn't even acknowledge us. It's not my job to flag her down .....it wasn't busy and she should have noticed us. It's been 20 minutes so my wife and I just get up and say eff this place and go to The Farmhouse(service there is excellent got our food in 15 minutes). I will give this place another chance and see if service is still the same but I'll make sure I'll bring a white person with us so we can get some service. just my opinion.
Some of the best pancakes I've ever had! Service is a bit slow sometimes but overall a must every time I'm in Phoenix.

Really great breakfast spot with unique and delicious foods. The egg white frittata was really good, nice sized portion. My husband said his corned beef hash was one of the best he's ever had.  We've never had a pineapple upside down pancake and it didn't disappoint us. Even their wheat toast was on point.

Probably the best breakfast I have had in awhile! Was so amazing I wish I could make you taste it while reading this review. I got the snooze classic and my man got the steak & eggs benny! They both were perfection! Our server was amazing as well, very down to earth and super nice. We will definitely be back. I honestly do not know how anyone could rate this place any less than 5 stars. We are impressed!

Busy breakfast spot with lots of creative and yummy sounding choices from eggs Benedict to breakfast sandwiches, French toast and pancakes. It's a bright and cheery interior with lots of booths and after 8 am a crowd of people waiting.  We sat at the counter which was nice and enjoyed the almost fresh squeezed OJ while we waited for our food. I tried the cinnamon roll pancake (sweet concoction of crunchy pecans and caramel topping a large fluffy pancake) that was very good and my wife had the breakfast sandwich which came with crunch hash browns and was more than she could eat.  I'd definitely go back - especially if I'm up early.
First time at this location and Victoria is AMAZING. Couldn't ask for a better first time experience. THANK YOU. #victoriaforpresident

First timer! Grabbing a quick bite for a late lunch and decided to go with breakfast. I got a pretty basic egg white omelet with toast and hashbrowns. The jam was good.   Standard and decently priced. Ambience of the restaurant was nice and the size is what you would expect for being right in the middle of a college campus. Weekends this place is packed but when we came after 12 on a Monday there was plenty of room.

Anyone who knows me or reads my reviews knows that I LOVE brunch!! Snooze is awesome! I went to get my snowboard waxed across the street and one of the employees suggested this place.   I got a plate with smoked salmon and other delicious things that I can no longer remember but tasted delicious. They give a lot of food and I had enough for a second meal later that day. If it weren't a weekday and I didnt have class later, I would have definitely gotten a drink, or two.... They looked delicious! Instead, I got tomato juice, which I also love. My friend got their pancakes and we got to try 3 of them. The sweet potato pancakes tasted like heaven. i was extremely skeptical and did NOT want to taste them, but am SO glad I did.   We decided that we are definitely coming back and bringing more people so we can get a lot more food and try EVERYTHING. :)

I've been wanting to go to Snooze for months, but they get so busy on weekends! I begged my husband to get up by 7am so we could head there early. We arrived with plenty of open tables. I had the pancake flight - pumpkin, sweet potato, chocolate peanut butter cup, and my husband had the corned beef hash. I also had a mimosa with orange juice and the dirty drunken chai. I was drunk before 8am. :D The food was fantastic, staff is super friendly, and I love the ambiance. I can't wait to go back!

Best breakfast in Tempe! I have probably been here about 4 times since it opened and it's now my go to breakfast spot in Tempe.  The decor is so fresh and cute but also inviting. Every time I've been the servers are great and always able to give suggestions. I have had all of the eggs Benedict but my absolute favorite is the chiliquiles benedict! It's eggs benedict with salsa, barbacoa, and a stack of tortillas instead of an English muffin. Seriously delicious! If you can't decide which eggs Benedict you want you can do half and half.  Speaking of half and half, my boyfriend was deciding between 2 different french toasts and our server said he could do half of each. They seriously go above and beyond to make their customers happy and encourage customization.   Next time you need a breakfast close to ASU or you want to show off Tempe to out of towners, come here!

Pancake Platter is amazing. Regular size cakes with great toppings and flavors. Got pineapple upside down, I Want Samoa and Blueberry Danish. Blueberry was my favorite by far with that lemon cream cheese filling.

On reading my prior review, I was contacted by someone from Snooze and they offered to pay for me giving them another shot at their Benedict. They sent me a handwritten note, which impressed me- few people do that!  I returned and everything was perfect. The dish was seasoned very well and cooked to perfection; the atmosphere was buzzing and the servers very prompt and friendly. Such a cool location too.   I'm stoked I found another terrific brunch place in Tempe!
Never been here and didn't gush about all the food. Shrimp and Grits is out now now and it was like I was in NOLA. Normally place skimp on the spice on this dish but as expected Snooze doesn't.

It was packed out when we got here. Waited 20 min for 2 people. Music was a little to loud.   My sister got the quinoa porridge. She loved it!  I got the blueberry pancake. Soooooo good!   Definitely coming back!

Best Brunch joint around! I love Snooze- the food, the drinks, the service, the overall vibe. I've never had a bad meal at Snooze and I love to try different things from the menu every time I go. Their specials are always spectacular too, especially when they throw out random pancakes. If you're in the Highland & 51 area, skip all of the other breakfast joints and head straight to Snooze for a great meal at a great price- You won't be sorry!

Ordered 2 breakfast burritos -   One of them had ranchero sauce which taste basically like tomato paste - no flavor at all, no spice at all.   The other was ordered with green chile - equally lacking in flavor but better than the ranchero.   The green chile burrito was also ordered with avocado, a 2.50 cost, and there was no avocado present in the burrito at all.   Both burritos contained more black beans than any other ingredient - there were maybe 1-2 scrambled eggs in each burrito but how could you taste the egg when every bite contained mostly black beans?  Both burritos had hashed Browns in them, however, my definition of hash browns is crispy fried potato strings and these were virtually raw sliced potatoes with not a single bit of brown showing on them.   For my total cost being 16.50 for the green chile burrito and about 13 for the ranchero this is just a huge huge waste of time and money. I could have eaten at Chelsea's kitchen and had an amazing chilaquiles with breakfast mimosas for the same price and been far far happier.  Honestly this is the biggest most overhyped breakfast restaurant I've encountered with prices that are on par with a resort and food on par with a high school cafeteria.   Save your time and money and go elsewhere.

Wowzers! Pineapple Upside Down pancake is out of this world yummy. Perfectly poached eggs. Crispy hash browns upon request. Bloody Mary ...mmmm good. Good service. The food was so good I went back again a couple days later while in town and brought a friend.

I was here Saturday for breakfast.  The wait was 50 minutes, so plan on sitting and chatting for an hour or so before breakfast.  The food is your standard breakfast fare with a cool Snooze flare; like shaped hash browns and pancake of the day.  If you're having the Snooze Breakfast (3 eggs, meat, hash browns, and toast) try the pulled pork (DELISH!) and adds a unique element to breakfast.  The frittata is a healthier option and looked amazing (my friend ordered it.) Snooze has a full bar with unique cocktails that support nursing your hangover or simply enjoying Sunday morning mimosas; try them out for an enhanced breakfast experience.  The backyard patio has fun/games/misters/ and it's freaking hot in AZ so go early or in the spring/winter/fall...    To the restaurant:  I recommend putting a water and coffee station out on the patio; the water station inside is usually blocked with people waiting for their table because it's 120 degrees out! You do a good job with the misters to keep guests cool"ish"; but I recommend big fans and extra sunshades for the front patio!  This would upgrade my review to 5-stars.
It is a great place to eat. The food is delicious. One suggestion is that fruit should be one of the side choices instead of charging extra.
What a breakfast!  It was busy and we thought we would have to wait to be seated... But we got right in. Great service and outstanding food. I need to come back for their array of Bloody Mary drinks.
Decor is adorable, food is ok. I don't feel like the quality of food matches the prices. My French toast was a little on the soggy side.

Snooze is best if you get there before 8:30am. They are one of the breakfast places that got it right for seating - outdoor seating in the front & back plus indoor. Wait time isn't so bad. We each had the duo eggs Benedict. I had both the Benny's - definitely recommend. My husband had the chile verde Benedict - also recommend.   Overall, great/friendly staff, good menu choices and the Bloody Mary mix is good. Maybe someday they'll start rimming the glasses and up the garnish.

Only waited about 15 minutes on a busy Saturday morning because we were willing to sit outside.    Excellent, fresh food which makes the high prices tolerable.    Our favs .... apple juice, bacon, and chiliquilles -- out of this world.  No issues with service or speed.  Very pleasant experience.

Have been here twice and think the place is adorable . The hostess has greeted us warmly, the servers are super friendly and helpful and the coffee is delish. Had an omelete, good but a little dry , and the corn beef hash which was super good , this is definately a great addition to town and country center.

A month back some girlfriends and I came in for breakfast we enjoyed our visit. We had to wait a while to be seated and the bloody marys could have been a little better but the service and food was great! A girlfriend picked the multiple types of pancakes and she thoroughly enjoyed all of them. I would recommend this place. They also have a huge breakfast burrito if your really hungry!
Good food, service is a little slow.  Somewhat pricey.  The variety of pancakes is awesome!

The Breakfast Pot-Pie is my go to choice when I step foot into this place! You have the option to add or subtract certain veggies/meats which is a plus! Great open setting right in the middle of the ASU campus. If you want great food with an inside or outside setting, I recommend this place for breakfast/brunch!   PS - They serve alcohol & have "bags" outside for yourself and others to play!
The food is great but the lines can be very long. Weekday mornings are better than weekends. Otherwise, be prepared to wait.

Really good food albeit a bit expensive for what you get depending on what you order sometimes. This is a nice place to come for breakfast or brunch. I would recommended it if you have been thinking about trying it sometime. Just make sure you get here early as it has always been incredibly busy whenever I come here.

Decor: A  Food:C+ Service: B+   I had been hearing positive things about Snooze for a while, so I thought it was time to give the place a try. My friend and I arrived there at 1:30ish on a Sunday afternoon, about an hour before closing so we were sat immediately. Service was prompt and friendly, no complaints there. I immediately noticed the fun decor they used for the inside, I really enjoyed the retro/60s vibe they had going on. They had a fairly wide selection on their menu, which I appreciated, there were vegan/ gluten free option.s The food came out at an average speed, I got the corned beef hash, my friend had pancakes of sorts. I was fairly unimpressed by the corned beef hash, it was fairly unoriginal. The beef was masked by the potatoes, and the portion was super small. My friend raved about her pancakes though, so they were able to make up for it there. I would return, but I definitely wouldn't order the hash again.
Best breakfast place in downtown Gilbert if you like to drink in the morning! The corn beef hash is amazing, as are the bloody's.

Snooze made my day! Right after they opened I ate outdoors.  The atmosphere, music  and view if the mountain were perfect. I had the choose two Benedict option and I had one Benny Goodman and one with the shredded  pork and green chili. The sausage Patty had an awesome brown crust and great flavor. The hash browns were perfect , I requested them crispy and they had just a touch of spice/heat. I found the all of my food to be seasoned just right.  Gloria was our server and she was super attentive, was happy to share her knowledge and had great suggestions.  I will be back again tomorrow to do it again!

Definitely a great place for brunch, lunch and light drinking! A friend recommended this place for brunch after we hiked Squaw Peak Trail and it was the perfect fit after a hot day of hiking. The restaurant itself is very trendy and quite popular so I suggest getting there early to avoid the brunch and lunch rush.   I wanted a meal that was not too heavy yet still filled me up so I chose "3 Eggs Any Style." It comes with 3 eggs that are cooked however you want them, a fistful of seasoned hashbrowns and a wide variety of bread to choose from for toast. Although the meal I had was simple, it was absolutely delicious and the hashbrowns are what sold me on this place as a whole. The hashbrowns are already seasoned to perfection (in my opinion at least) and are crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside.   Other than some of the items on the menu being a little overpriced, I give this place 2 thumbs up and I definitely see this place becoming my new breakfast/brunch spot!

I went with some old high school friends to catch up and enjoy some brunch. It had just recently opened so it was insanely packed, so it took about 40 min just to get a seat! I got the breakfast burrito, and it was enormous! It could probably feed a small village for a meal. The burrito itself was just your standard affair of breakfast ingredients with a southwestern twist of beans, pico de gallo, and green chile sauce. I had a bite of my friend's order of sweet potato pancakes, and let me tell you, those suckers were rich! I definitely don't think I could have finished it if I had ordered them myself, but they were absolutely delicious.  Overall, the portions were huge (even by American standards), the decor and atmosphere was trendy yet homey, and the staff was very friendly. I would definitely go again for my brunch fix.

OMG, this place is so so so so so yummy...and there's a line out the door for it on the weekends that I just can't force myself to stand in, otherwise I'd be there more often! I had one of the eggs bennie and one of their dessert-like pancakes. So delicious. Great for kids. Love the booths!

I make sure to visit Snooze when I'm in Tempe.  Always great service and food.  Love having a lot of gluten free options.  Everyone in our party shared pancakes and everyone agreed they were hands down the best pancakes ever.  Grilled cheese and tomato soup was another favorite. Cannot wait to visit again soon.

Wait times are normally long, but worth the wait. I had an amazing breakfast sandwich here! I will be returning again very soon. Employees are so nice and polite. Even very welcoming of dogs on the patio. I had a great experience at this location and will definitely return again and again!

Traveling for work (alone) so I avoided the long wait by sitting at the counter. Food was decent. Prices were reasonable. Service? Well, if two pretty girls hadn't sat next to me I might have gotten some attention. I wasn't asked if it was my first time there, wasn't offered the specials, and had to ask Steve for a place-setting. Had to wait for my check after leaving my credit card on the counter for nearly 10 minutes. He's capable of good service because he even gave these girls free pancakes! You'd think I was chopped liver or had a face covered in warts by how few times he even looked at me. Don't sit in his section and your experience might be better.

Snooze has a pretty trendy atmosphere overall. Well decorated with a light and bright feel throughout. It's located basically on ASU campus. I came in on a Sunday afternoon and they told me it was going to be a 45 minute wait and considering the area, I'm sure that's pretty typical. The good news is it only ended up being a 20 minute wait. Not much seating in the tiny waiting area but I was lucky enough to snag a chair. Free wifi that you don't need a code for, and I thought it was cool that they text you when your table is ready so you don't have to sit there and wait for your name to be called or carry around one of those weird little things that vibrate.   We sat outside and even though it was like 98 degrees, sitting under the umbrella was surprisingly not that hot. I ordered the Sandwich I Am with a Pineapple Upside Down Pancake.  Everything was FANTASTIC. The pancake was unbelievably tasty. Might sound stupid but it tasted exactly like...you guessed it...pineapple upside down cake! The consistency was perfect and the cinnamon butter on top was delicious. My Sandwich I Am was sort of like a McDonald's sausage and egg biscuit but with real ingredients, and I mean that in a good way. Loved the pretzel bread bun. The hash browns were on point too.   I've gotta comment on our server, Jenna. She was awesome. Super friendly, gave thoughtful recommendations, all around great customer service. She even hooked it up with her favorite pancake since we're out of towners and don't have the pleasure of experiencing Snooze whenever we please. Super cool.   I'm legitimately salty that I don't live here and probably won't be able to visit Snooze AM again for quite some time. Keep it up y'all!  Here's my overall ratings: Atmosphere- 4/5 Quality/value- 4.5/5 Food- 4.5/5 Service- 4.5/5 Coffee- 4/5
The pineapple upside down pancake is delicious!  The service was fantastic.  I love that they sent out a sample to try.. Good iced tea is always a bonus.  I will come back next time I visit the area!

I was looking for a good pancake spot so I invited some friends to join me at Snooze for early breakfast. As a newer location, the décor resembled their other restaurants. The signatory yellow light fixtures corresponded with a good number of round tables. The structure also facilitated a row of stools facing the large windows, and a full bar in the back. By extension, the sidewalk patio added character and spaciousness to the restaurant. Fortunately, we arrived early enough and did not have to wait for a table.  The Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup ($7.50) came with a conventional bread and cheese sandwich, tomato soup, and hash brown. There was a light crunch on the bread, but not enough cheese to translate into that gooey experience I was looking for. For the price, I was expecting better value and taste on the sandwich. The tomato soup was rich, hearty, and had a slight kick in the end. The hash brown was soft and needed more crispy edges. It was not the best grilled cheese, but it did hit the spot.  The Pancake Flight ($9) came with our choice of blueberry pancake, sweet potato pancake, and the chocolate ganache pancake. All three of us agreed the sweet potato pancake was the most impressive, as the buttermilk and caramel flavors accompanied a touch of ginger butter and handfuls of pecans tossed on top. The server endorsed the blueberry pancake, but it tasted rather conventional. I wished there were wholesome blueberries embedded, and that these pancakes were easier to cut into. The dark chocolate ganache concoction was without depth and the least impressive.  Service was very sporadic and not warm or welcoming as I expected of breakfast places. Overall, the food were nowhere close to the experience I previously had at their sister restaurants. The food hit the spot but there was no wow factor whatsoever. Additionally, I thought the execution on the Grilled Cheese was very poor for the price and a restaurant of this caliber. The server also gave approval to a blueberry pancake that was rather sub par. Overhyped. I will not be coming back.

Two words: Da Bomb. Food: incredible! I had the corned beef hash, eggs, and flour tortillas  with a half order of French toast. Amazing! The hash was made with REAL corned beef. Not totally the canned salty stuff. It was cooked to perfection.  Service: totally awesome. Not one discrepancy from any of the folks working there. Truly a happy crew that pulls as a team. Loved the place. Will definitely return again and again.

Went here for the first time this morning. I was meeting a friend with a baby so I went 25 mins before we were to meet so that she didn't have to  (I had seen in reviews that Saturday mornings were terribly crowded). I arrived about 8:40am and had a table by 8:45! I was so surprised. I told the hostess my plan and they went ahead and seated me anyway. The staff was great and the food was really tasty. I had the breakfast tacos. They were really good but I didn't finish just because I had gotten full from the pancake flight we shared.   The retro decor is also super cute. I can't wait to go back on a day I don't have to work. Mimosas!!!

WOW!   Pretty much one of the best breakfast places I have encountered in recent years.  Clean, cheerful atmosphere.  Great music.  Outstanding Service.  But most of all........the single best order of Bacon, yes, Bacon, I have ever had in a restaurant -- bar none.  Most pre-cook it, and toss it on the grill for a few seconds.  Others, and this is outright sacrilege, deep fry it..........But this is a place we will return to again and again.
Wonderful way to wake up!  Eat here for delicious breakfast finds not same old tired egg dishes.

Another one of my favorite breakfast joints on Gilbert, Snooze delivers! I especially like the Bloody Mary options here, they're made very well and always consistent. The outdoor patio area is also a very nice touch when you are brunching and boozing with friends. The food here is exceptional as well as the friendly service.

I come to snooze often with my husband and father in law  on the weekends. Although there is usually a wait it is well worth it because the food is always good and staff is amazing. This past Sunday we were there and our server was Alyssa. My FIL asked Alyssa what the best French toast was (thinking he could get any of them because they have gluten free bread- he has celiac) and she says the Drunk'n Monkey. Quickly she realized it was made with banana bread and couldn't be done gluten free. Now I bet if you are reading this you think I'm going to complain but you are so wrong. She made another recommendation (the OMG French toast) and everything was great. Before our breakfast came out she brought an apology pancake (the gluten free blueberry Danish I think) and it was delicious and my FIL loved it. It truly is the little things like that when you are dining out that make your experience so much better. My husband and I got two things and split, we had the cinnamon roll pancake (which I dream about, it is seasonal and not on menu but they will still make it for you if you ask) and a breakfast scramble which were both delicious. We are probably going to ask for Alyssa next time we come, she was fantastic!

Hands down best breakfast/brunch experience I've ever had. The food is phenomenal and the staff is warm and welcoming. I've eaten at this snooze location several t mes with friends and even when I went to sit at the bar by myself I felt as though I was sitting in a friends home. I love love love love snooze and the snooze family.  Whether you're craving savory or sweet I guarantee they have what you need to motivate you to quit hitting the snooze button and try out snooze.

Breakfast Cocktails!!  Great laid back atmosphere here. They play up to date music and reggae, which gives the place positive vibes. My waiter was excellent & very friendly. I came on  Friday morning and it was pretty packed. I had to wait about 15 mins for a table for one , since the bar area was also full. I ordered the Mountain Mule cocktail. It was light and refreshing. You could tell there were fresh ingredients used. I didnt even taste the alcohol!   I ordered the breakfast pot pie. It was really tasty. The sausage gravy has a nice hint of herbs, and just the right consistency. The crust was phyllo dough and it was nice & flaky. I did have to send my entree back due to it being on the cold side, but that was a quick fix and worth the wait. I hope they bring this to Vegas.. it would be perfect for those needing to recoup from partying the night before on the strip!
Had the best experience this morning at snooze. Our server Liz was incredible. She really made the whole experience that much better, not to mention the food is incredible. Thanks Liz!
I ordered the chocolate chip pancakes and they were so delicious! My only complaint is that the service was pretty slow even though they weren't packed. I will definitely return here again though!

Standard breakfast food, but it was great to have such a great selection of it. Modern takes at comfort food side by side the good old standard breakfast picks. My husband loved their bloody so much he is still talking about it months later.

I love Snooze I have been to the main location in Phoenix and to the one in Tempe I was apprehensive to try the Gilbert one since it just opened and probably needed some time to work out any glitches that any new restaurant would come across. I came in right before closing they seated us immediately. The waitress was sweet and kind, the food was very good and comparable to the other locations with one exception - the hash-browns. I don't know what went wrong there but they were not good and that's normally my favorite part. They were dry and unpleasant. Everything else though was perfect. I don't understand the complaints on time - do not try to come here on a Saturday or Sunday morning and expect to be seating within 20/30 minutes. It's a very popular restaurant and it's rather small space for interior seating. I highly recommend just not at a high volume time.

I see why there is a 45 minute wait!  I had the pot pie and it was great with creamy sausage gravy on it.  Nice amounts of sausage with the flaky crust (not sure how it stayed flaky the whole time!)   Service was excellent, attentive, and quick. Even though we had to wait, they apologized for the delay though we expected it considering how many people there were. All in all a great experience with good unique food!    Be aware that the menu is limited and doesn't offer all things typical at a breakfast place, such as skillets, but you can customize to your hearts content.  If you are waiting, go hang out in the back of the restaurant. They will text you when your table is almost ready.  You can also go hang out at Whole Foods or Trader Joe's.

I'm always looking for new breakfast places. I've been all over the valley trying different places and this one is neck and neck with one of my favorites. My wife is very picky and never clears her plate and here she cleared hers and ate some of mine! The patio is nice and the service was pretty good. I would say the food is what I would come here for, not so much the service. Not saying it was bad but the food is amazing. My only complaint was that it took almost 10 minutes for my latte but in their defense it was extremely busy. I recommend the OMG! French toast. It's not too sweet and filling but not to the point where I want to fall asleep in my chair.  I had some of my wife's hashbrowns and next time I'll be getting a side of those too!

This is our favorite breakfast spot, but today was a little disappointing. We like to go here between 7-8 when it's not crazy busy. Today we went at 7:30 lots of open tables & booths. 1. Know you clientele ( older customers might prefer a booth)  my wife and I share a meal almost all the time. We have our favorites here, but we strayed away and tried some thing new. The chili verde benny. The pulled pork was almost non existent  and what was there was fatty and not appealing. The corn tortillas were under cooked and cheese was not to be found. The poached eggs & hash browns were good as was the Hollandaise sauce, pico de gallo was also minimal. The side of bacon was not up to Snooze caliber. ( smaller than normal portion) Every visit before has been an easy 4-5 stars  this visit was about 2 1/2 stars but I gave it 3. Snooze don't start slipping. I can't remember our servers name she was very nice but on our check it said Clore Dog  very confusing. Also one of the male servers standing out in the open eating and the he went an sat in the corner by his self.

So I ate here this past weekend and it was okay. Maybe I should have ordered something different. Service was very attentive and sweet. It gets extremely packed so your best bet is to get here early or sit at the bar which is not bad at all!

Amazing food.  It took me forever to decide what to order because everything looked amazing.   I got the Benny duo.  Two different types of eggs Benedict.  Delicious.  My wife got the peach cobbler pancakes.  They were huge and tasted like cake.  We will definitely be coming back again and again.   This is the best breakfast I've had.
The service was amazing. They allow substitutions and have healthy options! The period are also pretty large. I would definitely come back again

I had never been to Phoenix before and I tried Snooze for breakfast. A great menu with vegetarian options. Outdoor seating, trendy atmosphere near college. Service was friendly, food great and the special mimosa hit the spot !

Been to a Snooze establishment before and loved it so much that I thought I'd try out the Gilbert location.  Absolutely terrible. We were seated pretty quickly as it was a slow weekday morning. However, our waitress completely neglected us (a party of two). The waitress' friends were seated next to us and were given all the service. Not to mention, the entire staff kept on making rounds to check on their friends... I'm guessing a previous employee here? Anyway. They got their drinks before we did and we were never checked on for refills. Such crap service which sucks because the food is so good.  Also, if you don't get a booth, you get a small table that's pretty close distance to the next table over. Usually not a problem. However with all the staff constantly checking on their friend, we had butts in our faces for the duration of our time there. Lol not cool.

Outstanding coffee. Delicious food. Extremely good service. Busy Friday morning but server made time to recommend her favorites and refill our table's iced tea and coffee. Halfway through a delicious breakfast of lox, goat cheese and cress, a server brought over a pancake. On the house. Pineapple Upside Downcake. Readers, this was properly amazing. Not too sweet, but the right combo of rich and fruity. Seriously, possibly the best pancake we've ever had (and not made, either).

I literally took two bites on the drinkin monkey French toast and decided to write a review. It's so amazing that I might just buy other one to take home with me. If you had not eaten here before I highly suggest Juans tacos and the drunkin monkey French toast!! I'm definitely coming back.

It just happens that we've eaten here twice in the last month or so, and I have to say that we love this place. The vibe is quintessential college-town hip, and the food is fresh and delicious, made with care and quality ingredients. The service has been very good, with a large staff that is always eager to please. Our breakfast choices have been shrimp & grits, corned beef hash & eggs, a breakfast burrito, and huevos rancheros. Every one has been excellent. If we're ever in the area again, this is our go to spot for breakfast.

After waiting for a brief time  -- and enjoying coffee outside and people watching -- we were expecting a good experience!  Not to be! the poached eggs were so "vinegary" -- they were uneatable!  The muffins for the eggs Benedict were saturated w/ the water from the eggs -- unappetizing! Truly disappointed w/ the noise level -- could not converse w/ table mates or server w/o shouting!  We won't be back!

Let me make this very very clear:  This is the BEST food you will ever have in your life.  Ok, now that we have that established...let me take some time to convince you as to why.  The Pineapple upside down pancakes are so good that every other pancake for the rest of your life will be dry and tasteless in comparison. Unless of course you can convince the chef to make you coffee and donut pancakes. Also FREAKING amazing.  The sandwich I am, three egg scramble, upstream benny (or ANY of the benny's for that matter) are slap yo mama good.  Oh and the best part? A Colorado based company!! When I moved from Denver a couple of years ago, I was devestated (no, but really, I was) that I wouldn't get to make my regular weekend stop into Snooze. And lo and behold, they came to Arizona! This is the second location in the valley. The other location is off of 20th and Camelback.  Just a side note, the wait times can be a little long, but I GUARANTEE that every minute is worth it when you take your first bite. Guarantee it.

Hallelujah, Snooze has come to Phoenix!!!!  As a Denver native, I can only hope to describe to you non-Denverites the culture of Snooze. It has made all other breakfast places seem dismal. The quality of food is astounding, the atmosphere is upbeat and trendy and the servers are the friendliest, hippest people you will ever meet. You will never wait less tan an hour for a table, but the wait has always been worth it.  Snooze Phoenix is no different. They have captured the essence of the hipster vibe of Denver and brought it to the valley quite nicely.  The food, again will never disappoint. If you've never been, here are my suggestions:  Always ask what the pancake of the day is. Always.  Sweet: Pancake Flight with a Pineapple Upside Down Pancake, the Pancake of the Day and a Cinnamon Roll pancake.  Savory: 3 Egg Scramble with hollandaise, avocado and pico de gallo and corn tortillas.  There is nothing but love in my heart for Snooze. Now, Snooze, please get your booties out to Orange County next!!!
So yummy!! 2nd time here and not disappointed! Lox Benedict and Bella Benedict did  not disappoint! Peanut butter pancake....worth the calories!!!

Great spot for brekkie. A Little bit of a wait which is why they lost one star. I like how you can get two different Benedicts and different pancakes on the same plate. The menu is unique and the service was friendly.

I love cute, hip breakfast places and snooze is definitely working in bring a cute hip breakfast spot, even if it's not quite there yet.   Cool decor. Awesome patio and open-air bar seating.  Good selection of mimosas and bloody Mary's ($6-8 each).  Food looked good, even though we didn't order anything.  Good location at the old Town and country mall, but I wish it were closer to central.  Staff was friendly, but definitely still working out the kinks. We had quite a wait for two mimosas and a beer.  Overall, I'm giving Snooze the benefit if the doubt and I will definitely be back to sample the menu.   Ps, I don't know if it will ever make it to five star status since it's part if a CA/CO chain.

Between the fun and the food, relaxed atmosphere you could ask for a better way to start a Saturday morning!  The games to keep the kids and adults occupied while waiting for breakfast to arrive makes the time fly and enjoyable!  The food was very good, I had the Verde Benedict and Ashley the breakfast pot pie.  The kids really enjoyed their hot chocolates and kid breakfasts!

I have only been to this fabulous establishment twice and I love the service and the food !! I have to give a shout out to my wonderful hostess Heather .. she was very attentive and super sweet !! This is why I will return to this great place ..
Food was ok. Gluten free toast was good and the hash browns are delicious. It's really loud inside. Too loud for my preference in the morning. Good experience overall though.

Went here for a brunch date with a close friend...it was a 20 minute wait but totally worth it!  Any place that offers beer for breakfast is number one in my book!! Get the brewmosa and you wont be sorry!   Ordered the Chilaquiles Benedict and I never wanted it to end! It was heaven in my mouth!  Service was good and the atmosphere great. I loved the mix of music they had going on and it wasnt too loud or too quiet!   Definitely will be back to try some stuffed french toast and a Palomosa!

This is straight up the best breakfast find of the century!  The menu looks so damn good I almost ate it!!  Seriously the pancakes are the best in the world and the Bfast tacos are legit with flavor, hash browns are delectable!

Looking for your stereotypical brunch place after a morning run, we stumbled up Snooze AM (thanks to Yelp). Bright, cheery, and clean, it's what you'd expect from an upscale brunch chain.   Coffee was great and refills plentiful. Plenty of options, savory and sweet. The omelets were done well, and the hashbrowns were...unique. In a good way. Portions weren't grossly large, which I actually appreciate in a restaurant. Quality, not quantity.  Server was a bit of a space cadet and service was pretty slow, but it may have been a one-off, so I can't knock the place for that.
My fiancé and I dined her frequently when they first opened, but the quality of the good and the service rapidly declined. Such a disappointment. I'll choose Luci's any day.

I went to Snooze several months ago, around when it first opened. I totally spaced on writing a review. D'oh! But I remember everything so well, I'll just go ahead and write one anyway. 4 months later. Gonna be super accurate.  I went here with 2 other friends of mine during peak brunch hour. i.e., when yo' ass rolls out of bed on a Saturday around 10:30AM. It was pretty crowded, but we only ended up waiting about 20 minutes or so. I just stood outside and snapped pictures of their awesome sign. Such pretty typography + signage (insert nerdy laugh-snort). Once inside and seated, I became increasingly impressed by their fantastic brand consistency. Everything felt so...cool and retro. What the Hell guys, why didn't you hire me as your graphic designer!? I would've traded my work for food. Anyway, our orders were promptly taken by extremely friendly staff. It DID take an overly long time for our food to arrive, but they hadn't been open very long and it was ridiculously busy, so I wasn't too surprised by that. Once the food came, I snarfed it down and washed food particles away with some delicious mimosas. I don't have a massive appetite usually, but I felt their dishes were perfectly proportionate. Just enough food to fill you up, but not too much to put you into a brunch food coma for the rest of the afternoon. I wish I could recall exactly what I ate, but I'm writing this review 4 months later, so my memory is a bit wonky. Oh, remember a few sentences ago when I said our food took a while to arrive? They felt the need to make up for that by gifting us a free pancake that tasted like A FREAKIN' SAMOA. Yeah, I forgive you. Like immediately. Overall, everything was really tasty and appropriately priced. Staff was genuinely kind and really easy to interact with. It gave me the opportunity to crack a bunch of cheesy jokes with our server.   I haven't been back since, mostly because I just eat a banana for breakfast when I wake up in the morning. But next time I get HONGRAY for some brunch, I'll definitely hit this place up. Plus, I can ride my bicycle there! Wow dude!  bye

I was hungry for pancakes but decided against them. They have all sweet toppings, soI chose the Bella Bella Benny hollandaise instead. It was good though wary since the meat was prosciutto.  Other party members had the Ham Benedict III and Juan's Breakfast Tacos.  We arrived early at 9:15 amenity a 30 minute wait, we were told. The wait was much longer and they lost new business  and the restaurant next door received those customers. There is complementary coffee while you wait which is a major plus!    The food was very tasty and we'd definitely return! I had the option to substitute pancakes for the hash browns for a $3.50 surcharge. That's quite a hefty substitute fee!

I love the concept of this restaurant. They have a community table, bright colors, friendly staff and excellent food. The only downfall i'd say is the pancakes are a little to thick for my liking but the flavor was pretty good. We will be back

Great service and a cool environment...  BUT,  - the food is a little pricey, especially for simple breakfast food. - food was warm, but definitely not as hot as I would like my eggs Benedict. (Pretty luke warm to be honest) - did the pancake flight, flavor of the day was so gross neither my guest or I finished.  (Also pretty dry, not quite pizza crust dry but almost there.)  Wouldn't recommend going out of your way to go here for breakfast.  However, if you go try the pineapple upside down cake pancakes. They were the least dry I tried while here!  Will not be coming back, but did not have a terrible experience here.

Great breakfast food. Got the Snooze Spuds (a plate of hashbrowns and cheese with your choice of add-ins) and the daily Banana Fosters pancake on the side. I didn't realize the pancake would be so HUGE! But everything was really good and the service was great. Go with a hearty appetite if you want to try more than one thing.

Awesome food! I had the pancake flight and my husband had the corned beef hash. This is by far one of the best breakfasts we have had during our time in the Phoenix area!  I didn't realize it when I found them on yelp, but was delighted to find out that this place also has locations in SanDiego, and was the same place I had raved to my friends and family about when I got back from visiting there. If you are around this area, visit this restaurant!  AMAZING food!

I've been to the other one in Gilbert, but this one is quite a different feel. I think it might habe to do with the location being on ASU's campus, so it's a bit "collegey". The decor is cute and classy but it definitely caters more to a college scene.  My friend at for breakfast at 8am and it was about 80% occupied for the indoor seating. No one was out on the patio seating area as yet because it was a tad too chilly still. By the time we left though, the line was out the door onto the sidewalk at almost 10am.  I ordered the Benny duo (one of each type of eggs benedict) with the Bella! Bella! Benny and the Chili Verde Benedict with pulled pork. So the chili sauced tortilla that they had as the "bread" for the Chili Verde Benedict was very different, but I wasn't too sold on it. It might be the texture or the corn tortilla flavor overpowering the rest of the benedict... it wasn't a hit for me. The hollandaise, egg and pulled pork though were pretty good. For the Bella! Bella! Benny, the slice of ciabata bread it came on was so thin and just underwhelming. The prosciutto, egg and hollandaise sauce again were spot on. But with how salty prosciutto is, I felt like there should be a more hearty piece/type of bread to balance out that natural saltiness of the prosciutto.   The meal came with hash browns which to me was the only perfect (for me) item on my plate. The outside brown and crisp on the outside, moist and cooked just right on the inside. My other complaint is that they neither have blue cheese dressing nor ranch dressing/dipping sauce, and those are my sauces of choice for potatoes (I don'tlike ketchup).  Another thing is Snooze changes their menu, but it always has a lot of similarities to the one before. It's like they remix items that are on the menu. They have a lot of great ideas and sometimes they're great (like their fall menu was) and sometimes they fall short - like the current menu.
Love the atmosphere of Snooze, the great attitude of the hospitality staff, the food and music. I will come here as often as I get back into town.
Gravy was way to salty, coffee was weak. Great location though. Blah blah blah blah review review review review review
I like to try out the pancakes of the day ussually really good
Good service with bad food except the smoked ham it's delicious.  Coffee was week a brewing problem. Tables were dirty and the menu was grimy.

Unimpressed. Basic. Alright.  Please save your appetite and time - go to the location in Tempe/Scottsdale. We made plans to spend our afternoon brunch sitting down at one of our favorite restaurants. Instead of going to our typical locations we decided to switch it up and try the location in Gilbert.  The service was unfortunately inattentive. After receiving our food we literally lost our server and the server assistant for 10 minutes. We ended up getting up to ask the bartender for condiments.  Food was mediocre - the food was thrown on to the plate and the overall look of our dishes was unappealing. I don't know how the same restaurant and the same dish could possibly tasted so different from other times we've eaten at Snooze but it did.  I ordered the hash brown and chorizo meal. While he order the benny duo combination along with a side of peanut butter and chip pancakes.  Just save your money and go to the other locations. They have more attentive staff and put more effort into their meals.

I love Snooze and my brother and I had been planning to go here all week when I came to visit. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is that they sent out an omelette when I'd ordered a scramble and had to wait about 10 min to get the correct order. Otherwise the food was delicious (albeit a cold pancake that sat while I waited for the rest of the food to come out).  I always get the pineapple upside down pancake (gluten-free). It's the best pancake they have IMO. Also (eventually) got the egg scramble with goat cheese, spinach and mushrooms. I could have done without the hashbrowns. I tried just get the pancake instead of the toast and hashbrowns which I think is a fair trade out, but apparently you have to pay an additional $4 for the pancake whether you want to trade out both or just one of them (which doesn't make sense to me, but oh well).  Their lattes are good. I asked for a latte with almond milk and a little honey and cinnamon. It was delicious.

best breakfast I've had in a long, long time.   what I love about this place is how customizable it is. the menu encourages you to get creative. don't worry about messing up a combination, because it's darn near impossible to go wrong here!  this was my first time experiencing a "pancake flight" and let me tell you - I hope it's not my last. pancakes were really unique, e.g. pineapple upside down cake, blueberry danish, sweet potato, etc. pineapple was my favorite.   they have almond milk, which is always a plus.   friendly wait staff, despite being crazy busy on super bowl sunday AM.   I will definitely be back here next time I'm in the area!

Love this place! My husband and I went to the one in Boulder back in October and couldn't wait for this one at the Town and Country shopping center to open.   Being a vegan, I loved that they had options to make my breakfast without meat/dairy. While my husband loved that he could have whatever his meatlover heart desired. I have had the tofu scramble with the soyrizo which is delicious! My husband loves the sausage. The pancake of the day when we were there the first time was a sticky bun pancake, we ordered one for the table as dessert and I had a couple bites, it was heaven!   There is usually a wait, even during the week. But they will text you when your table is ready and you can go shopping at Nordstrom Rack right next door or take advantage of the games they have on their patio. They also have Bloody Mary's and mimosas, and great coffee. I know I'll be back! I love a good breakfast spot!

I'm loving all the new restaurants that are opening in Tempe and Snooze is no exception!  My boyfriend and I visited for breakfast and it wasn't too busy so we were seated right away - it's a pretty big place. We opted for seats at the counter by the window so we could stare outside (and we had a good view of the ping pong table, which was entertaining.)  I ordered the late harvest benny which is sweet potato polenta topped with more sweet potatoes, eggs, fennel and kale and served with hashbrowns. My boyfriend ordered the breakfast pot pie. We both really enjoyed our choices. I love the combination of the sweet potato polenta with the eggs paired with the hashbrowns. Plus, the cream cheese hollandaise gave a nice sweet balance to this savory dish. All mixed together it made for a tasty breakfast hash. And it was very filling.  Overall I really liked the atmosphere, the service was good and the food was yummy. It will be great to go here when it's nice enough to open up the large windows.

We first tried this restaurant in Denver and gave it 5 stars. While visiting ASU, we were ecstatic to find a location on campus. We placed our name on the list and were told it was about an hour and fifteen minute wait.    We weren't deterred because if it was good as Denver, it would be worth the wait.  We returned from walking around the campus in the estimated time and were seated shortly after.  As with Denver, the wait was worth it.  Friendly staff and great food! The French toast is a must try and is our favorite.
