I added pico de gallo to my plate, and it balanced the flavors for me instantly. The rest of the family enjoyed their breakfasts, the pancakes and bfast tacos very well received, and we all left satisfied. I'll return!  Cheers! RS

Very clean cool place to eat breakfast. Service is stellar we met many staff on our first trip here quite friendly. The food is good stuff bit of a twist on some dishes that turns out to be a success for sure. Bit packed weekends but stop in during the week to avoid waiting.

New favorite breakfast placeCan't say enough. I could eat here everyday for a week and wouldn't taste half of all my favs!! Having a full bar and amazing signature drinks helps. Here's a sneak peak.....

Update: I was contacted by Kelcie with Snooze AM and she offered a genuine apology. In her response, it was clear that they take pride in providing excellent customer service. I really appreciated the sincere response I received. Thank you!   I found this review in my drafts and apparently forgot to post it after our visit a few months ago:  We have been to the Snooze AM Scottsdale location and we always had a fantastic experience, so we were hoping the Gilbert location would be great as well.  When we arrived, we were seated almost immediately and the server was very friendly. The food took a while to come out after we ordered, but we were in no hurry. When the food finally arrived, the person who brought the food out was snippy, which made it all the more difficult to have to tell her that my order was incorrect. This clearly was an inconvenience to her. A few minutes later, the original sever came by and saw there was an issue with the order and said a new burrito would be out shortly.  The new burrito eventually came out, but by that time my entire family had already finished their meals, and the plates had been cleared. Our kids were starting to get restless, so my husband took them outside. I ate my food as quickly as possible and left. This visit was a bit of a let down, but we love the food so we will likely give them another chance in the future.

We arrived on a Sunday and of course they were crowded. We were told it would be a 45 minute wait time but actually wait time was just 15 minutes. We ate outside, next to a heater.   The location is in the ASU college area, so their was a lot of college students. We started out with mimosas. I ordered the Om French toast and  my fiancé had the breakfast burrito. The mimosa were great. The atmosphere was marvelous being outside amongst the chirping birds. Although it was 50 degrees it was still comfortable because of the numerous heaters. The service was excellent, staff very pleasant and welcoming. Checked on us numerous times . The food was delicious, wanted to order a second plate because it was so good. Definitely, a five star!!!!
I always enjoy Snooze. I've had many of their dishes and I always go back to one of the bennies. My friend loves Juan's breakfast tacos also and the mimosas are on point!
Had Jessica twice over this past weekend! Super friendly & amazing service- rockstar!   Food is always delicious

Hands down my favorite go to breakfast spot! NEED I say more! The place is always full of smiling guest and staff! The Ambience and atmosphere although is joyful. I've been here a few times and i can't say I ever seen an out of order or dirty establishment. If you go the this location you won't receive bad customer service or cold food. I'd recommend this place to anyone check out the pics. Mouthwatering!

The wait for this place was 20ish min on a Saturday, so not the worst but also not the best. I hear downtown Gilbert is getting super popular with the new hipster shops and restaurants popping up, so maybe this is the new normal for the area. The place is eye-catching, and the decor is trendy with pops of orange accents.   The weather was gorgeous out, so we were able to sit outside and take in a little sun while we were waiting already starving haha. We were told there was complimentary coffee while we waited, but it was out and we kind of just stood there looking awkward and waiting for them to refill We all had variations of the benedicts, and were pleased but not blown away. We all agreed it was solid and could definitely compare to the bennies in SF that we endured an hour-long wait for. Seems like a solid place to hang out with friends for breakfast or brunch.

I wanted pancakes but I also wanted Eggs Benedict. You see, this is the problem when you travel by yourself. You can't get two plates and share. Well, you *can* still get two plates but then you're just being a pig.  Since I was so indecisive today, I got a "Benny Duo" where you can have one Benedict of one type and one of another. The first was with smoked salmon on a slice of pumpernickel. Tasty and excellent. The egg was perfect. The second was with green chile and a potato base of some sort. Also excellent. The chile had a little bit of a zing to it and it improved with a bit of Cholula.  Service was excellent, sitting at the breakfast counter. Coffee was refilled and it was good coffee.

I am writing this because it has been 2 days and I am still annoyed. I went to Snooze on a Thursday morning at 6:15 believing they were open. I walked up to the door and tried opening it, which it was locked. A lady was cleaning the door and instead of smiling or acknowledging my presence, she completely ignored me. She didn't say what time they were open until I asked and again never smiled. I am a firm believer of customer service and regardless of the situation, if you work in customer service, you should always be kind and considerate acknowledging anyone that helps pay your bills.
The wait is worth it! And in Saturday morning you can visit the local farmers market while you wait. Excellent breakfasts  and the BEST BACON I have ever had! Serious Yum!

This place is truly a gem, and Arizona is lucky to have a couple franchises located around town. The food is amazing, and will not disappoint. The cool atomic/ retro vibe makes for a fun and interesting atmosphere. Staff is overall very friendly, and they try their best to get you handled right away even though the place is always packed.  I recently ordered a very large catering order for a business meeting, and I was so impressed how well they put the food together. Cute boxes, warm food, and extremely happy guests at my meeting...I felt like I really stepped my party planning skills up! I actually heard one of them squeal in excitement that we got Snooze for breakfast. Do yourselves a favor, and go now!
OK.  But definitely the place to be and be seen.
Im not a pancake person but it was pretty good. Sandiago, CA seems better than the PHX restaurant.

Awesome staff, amazing food. We need one in Tucson!! I've never waited so long or been so happy I did. Of course it was Mother's Day so waiting was absolutely expected! Not typically a "sweet breakfast" kind of person but their blueberry danish pancake was just the right amount of sweet and something I would absolutely go back for. However, the real surprise was the breakfast pot pie. Incredible. I thought no way would this be good but I tried it and I will never be the same.

Well the thing is that if you wait 45 minutes for a table you expect that your food is going to be hot or at least kinda warm once you get it, unfortunately it was not. It was pretty packed too so the food took awhile to come out. I found the blueberry pancake to be borderline disgusting, it didn't even have blueberries in it. It was just not very good blueberry sauce and watery frosting. I would have given this place 1 star but the server was pretty good considering how busy she was. I definitely won't be coming back and don't understand the hype. I would prefer IHOB over this place.

The food is so good, the service is always top notch, and their cocktails are stellar. The only reason I'd give 4 out of 5 stars is because it's a challenge to get into this place. It's no surprise they're always on a wait, it's a really great place to have breakfast. Shout out to one of the servers Joe, we try to get him if he's there. He's funny and treats his guests right

Always love coming here! I'm not a big sweets person (especially for breakfast) but OH MY their pineapple upside down pancake is ahhmazing. I definitely recommend checking this place out if you haven't yet. Just be cautious that there's usually a wait (and for good reason).

Really good, high quality food. It is one of my favorite spots for breakfast! I have been here a few times and they never disappoint. The ambience of the restaurant is very hip and open. Others too like this place, so there usually is a long wait on the weekends-we went on a Monday afternoon and there was no wait and plenty of space for our big party.   I had the Breakfast pot pie, with a side of hashbrowns. Everything on the plate was delicious, it is a dish I have not seen anywhere else. If you haven't been here or are a regular, it is something to try on their menu. The portions seemed rather hearty, so come hungry; if not, sharing is always an option.!

Yeah just like most Snooze locations, it's really hard to go wrong when dining at one. If you're a fan of brunch and breakfast, then this place is for you.  Pancakes? They got 'em. French Toast? They got that. Other breakfast and brunch stuff...yeah, whatever, they go that too. There's just too much good stuff on the menu.  Just like any other Snooze location, their decor is sleek, colorful and modern...and classy. Well, at least that's how I feel each time I dine. On top of that, I've never had bad service at a Snooze location and this visit was no different. That's pretty good considering that I think the entire staff is probably attending ASU which is literally across the street. Like seriously, across the street. Anyway, the server was very friendly.  "So what did you have, Jeff? I really want to know. That's why I'm reading this review."...said no one ever. However, if you must ask, I had the Drunken Monkey French Toast. Why? Because I love French Toast, and the name was intriguing...and the description sounded good.  Funny story, it was good. The End.  Okay not really the end.  Although the portion size was a little smaller than your typical Jeff S. standards would consider worthy, the fact that it was a nicely arranged dish of carbs in the form of sugar, bread,fruit...and sugar, it was good enough for me to overlook the less than Herculean serving size (i.e., mere mortal serving size). Yeah, the rest of you normal eaters will probably be fine. I'll be sure to include the obligatory picture.  So would I eat here again? I'm pretty sure the answer to that should be pretty obvious, but in case you are fairly dense, the answer is "yes". Why? Because I love the food, the atmosphere and well, breakfast food in general. The only downside is that currently I don't find myself in this part of town that often, but no need to worry, I'm sure at some point in time I'll make my way back and this place will be at the top of my breakfast list.

Great breakfast spot in the heart of downtown Gilbert! I love going here on a Sunday afternoon because they're open until 2:30pm and serve up their delicious breakfast items until then.  I like their tofu scramble and they also have soyrizo if you want a little kick! Their menu doesn't have many vegan options listed, but just ask and they can cook something up for you. I usually get a tofu scramble, which comes with a side of hashbrowns and they'll cook it solely in oil if you ask. Their normal oil is an oil/butter mixture, so if you're vegan like me, that's a no go...but they're able to accommodate.   Their fresh fruit is awesome too...usually comprised of blueberries, strawberries, and pineapple. I love fruit like that....that's not all melon.  I haven't tried any adult beverages there yet but their mimosas look divine!

This place is great! On the weekends it's a mad house, but any weekday morning you shouldn't have to worry about a wait. It's a fun atmosphere, they play classic 80s music and the staff is a bit quirky themselves. The pulled pork is my favorite. But if you're thinking you want a full portion I'd definitely skip it or plan on ordering more.  I've ordered items with the pulled pork a few times hoping for a decent portion but it never happens. They offer great food and have a wide variety of coffee options.

Wonderful kind and personable service. There was a mix-up between the difference of a double shot and single shot but luckily it wasn't alcohol. The server and manager were quick to remedy the miscommunication. Usually we have to get our coffee from a coffee shop and food from somewhere else. This place has it all. Thank-you Snooze for the yummy brunch and strong coffee. We now can see our colors much more vividly.

We have eaten here twice now and been blown away each time. The Benedict dishes are outstanding, and I like the way you can try two as a meal. You can do a variety-of-an-item-option for the pancakes as well... and it's a good thing with choices like Sweet Potato, Blueberry Danish and Peach Pie Pancakes (say that 5 times fast!) This past visit, we had the Pineapple Upside Down Pancake, and oh. my. god. The coffee is high quality... and I'm a bit of a coffee snob. We enjoyed reading the story about it on the nifty tri-fold drink menu gracing each table, though I was so involved with that ridiculous pancake, I've forgotten where they buy it from. Great stuff all around.

The first time I came here a few months ago I immediately liked the place the decor and the atmosphere were light and fun and I enjoyed my breakfast especially the cinnamon roll pancakes I was in for my second visit on Monday looked like the same place but sure did not taste the same ordered the corned beef hash and it was very skimpy and greasy and some how two out of the four drinks we ordered from the bar had a bug in it they did remake them and they took 20% off our bill with so many other places in the area probably won't be back.

Holy crap, if I could give a place six stars I absolutely would. The extensive menu selection should not be the only thing that makes you want to come here; service was great, they messed up part of our order and fixed it quickly and didn't charge us. Sweet and sour combinations for breakfast are incredible. My only gripe with my meal which was eggs with pesto or something of that sort... There was so much pesto it was really hard to taste anything else. But this for sure is an amazing breakfast place. The sweet potato pancakes are delightful.

If you love pancakes, you would be in heaven! they are sooooo moist and flavourful, but the sweetness is just about right.   The pineapple upside down one has sooo much things going on, while not overpowering the pineapple flavour from the pancakes. The chocolate ones are sooo chocolaty but yet not overly sweet.  The chorizo side is really tasty; mixed their hashbrown with one of their hot sauces was another good option if you choose to go the savory route. but you can always add a little extra and have the pancakes to come with your savory brunch dish, so you don't have to face the sweet or savory dilemma :D

Snooze has a fun atmosphere. I also love their many eggs benedict options. My kids love their pancakes of course. Most things are pretty great here. Coffee isn't amazing and the bill can be a little pricey for our family of 5. Still, when we see this chain, we know we'll get some good, consistent food.
Fabulous brunch place!! I love the sweet stuff on the menu. The specialty pancakes are amazing!  There is parking available in the asu Fulton garage if you can't find a meter.

My friend who used to live in Denver, where I believe Snooze is based, told me before they opened that the food was wonderful. Well, she was right. I can't believe my good fortune that they moved into the Town & Country in my 'hood. I came after a doctor's appt because I was starving from fasting.   I sat at the bar and was immediately greeted by the friendly bartender. Another lady saw my bandage from having blood drawn and was considerate enough to ask me if I wanted a piece of toast or something. I ended up ordering a "flight" of pancakes where you can order 1 of 3 different flavors. Whoever decided to offer that option is, in my opinion, a brilliant person. I also love that they have such distinct and interesting pancake options. I ended up noshing on carrot cake (which ended up being the fave), sweet potato and a "pancake of the day" which had chocolate chips and cherries. I got a side of the house-made chicken sausage which was amazing. I'm not sure what herbs they seasoned with but it looks like a pounded, cubed steak. But it was very moist and not too salty.   I've only been back there another time since and I exercised the half and half option for their "art of hollandaise" items. Another great option! I got to try two kinds of but the winner was the Havana Benny. Here's the description: Shaved Niman Ranch ham and slow roasted pork served over a savory Swiss cheese bread pudding and topped with poached eggs, Dijon hollandaise and diced house pickles. The ham was really the winning ingredient here but all of it came together nicely.   I noticed this place draws a varying demographic. I saw families with kids and grandmas like one would see at IHOP. But I also saw hipsters on the patio and at the bar. I'm not sure if the place's popularity is at play or because it's new, but weekends, expect an hour wait for brunch. Otherwise, try to go on a week day.

Not really worth the hype. My husband had the "awesome" eggs benedict duo that everyone raves about - they are very small and just okay. I had the blueberry danish pancakes and they were good, but anything with THAT much sugar involved is going to be good. Other than the cream cheese topping they were pretty standard, I only ate half because I don't want to get diabetes.   We went early beat the crowds (7:30AM on a Saturday). The service and cold brew coffee were great but the food is not good enough for the price and usual wait time required. There are much better options nearby for quality breakfasts.

Snooze is just what I need when in Tempe.  On hot summer's days I like to get my fill to prepare for the sweaty day.  On this particular day at Snooze, coffee was ordered and so was what they called a breakfast pot pie.  And HOW GOOD IS THIS sausage gravy?  So delicious! The biscuits were flaky and I ordered the egg over easy (this was alright...)  The real surprise on my plate was the circle thick hash browns...it appeared to be cupped and cooked.  The environment was fun and we didn't have to wait too long to get a seat.
Yummy place! Got free pancakes , the burrito was delicious the French toast was delicious and the pancakes where delicious!  Coffee is muy Bueno too

If this were my last breakfast--- Id be happy. Absolutely the best egg white, spinach, red pepper and bacon omelette I've ever eaten. Delicious! Worth the wait. If you're lucky you can grab a seat at the counter. Not s long of a weight.

I love this place! Occasionally on a Friday, my co-worker and I will sneak over for a delicious breakfast burrito - so worth it. The customer service is great. We've ordered to-go meals and were offered a coffee while we waited outside by the fountain. Most recently, we were seated, but a server was not assigned to our table. We notified the first server we saw who informed us of the error. Our servers were over shortly after, but the original server we notified made it a point to check on us and even brought a pancake of goodness over while we waited for our food. Try it, you'll like it!

Fantastic breakfast! Service was amazing & fun. These people seem to really live what they do! Lots of good for you & not so healthily breakfast choices with tons of flavor! Definitely recommend if you are in the area!
Looked it up on yelp decided to check it out. Cool Place for it being so trendy. Food was great so was the service

They say insanity is repeating the same action expecting a different result. I have been to several locations of Snooze throughout the valley and while the food tastes good, it always arrives at my table at room temperature. I like hot food so to stop the insanity I will not return to Snooze.
The Ham Benedicts lll was ok. The ham was very tasty but the hollandaise sauce lacked the lemony taste I expected and was too thin.

Two of the meals I've had here were easily two of the most delicious meals I have ever had. Service is super friendly. They have multiple kinds of hollandaise.  The wait can be kinda long on weekends. We have waited 45 minutes a couple of times. It was worth the wait though.  Restroom is good.

Reasonable prices and best server, Tori, who is cute as a bunny.  We went for breakfast on a Friday around 8:30.  It wasn't busy then but it was  really starting to jump when we left.    I tried one of their 'known for' dishes, corned beef hash.  It was excellent, not dry, and had a beautiful crunch.  The eggs were cooked perfectly also.  I tried a bite of my boyfriend's caramel apple pancake and now I'm obsessed with trying to recreate this at home.  Back to Tori...very sweet and efficient and offered to get us to go cups of our coffee/tea.    I'm hoping work will bring me back soon so I can visit again!

Stopped by Snooze AM Tempe last weekend, second visit to the chain and the first at this location.  Atmosphere - Nice layout, we had a table inside but would look to sit outside as the weather changes. My only dislike was having the A/C vents pointed right at some tables which made it too cold when it kicked on.  Service - Great. The estimated wait time was exactly what they quoted. The waitress was great in her very positive demeanor and her speed. Food came out very quick which was a plus.  Food - Really good and creative menu. Breakfast Pot Pie - Tasty and the perfect size for my wife, the crust is very flakey and gravy is good. Snooze Spuds Deluxe - Good dish and if I were to re-order I'd make two changes to my order. First, don't order the chorizo, it tasted nothing like chorizo and I even asked the waitress if it wasn't the chicken sausage but she confirmed it was chorizo. Second, take their recommendation to put an egg or two on top, without them it is a little too dry. I'd like to them to put on a little more cheese on it.  Overall, a very good place and I'm going up to four stars based on the service.

First time here and came in for a Saturday brunch around 1pm. Overall this was a great choice for a weekend brunch and will be going back.  Seating/Atmosphere - Greeted when we entered and after short wait for a table to open we were seated. Very pleasant staff. Open format, music, great for families or adults. It is not quiet and I can see where the music volume is close to making it unenjoyable. Too hot for the outdoor seating but will go back when the weather cools down to sit outside.   Service - Very good, she was pleasant, smiling and covered everything. I wouldn't call it fast but they were full. Service speed and attention needs to pick up to get to 5 stars. Everyone that worked there seemed to be having fun, keeping the atmosphere upbeat.  Food - Everything was very good. MMM MMM Mimosa - The best morning drink I've had in a while, the pomegranate liquor added flavor and worked with the OJ. Corned Beef Hash - A good portion of corned beef hash that worked with the caramelized poblano chilies they added. The hash had chunks of corned beef mixed with the hash brown, not soggy like I've had at other locations. Eggs were cooked perfectly to my order.  OMG Fresh Toast - Can't say enough about this dish, perfect blend of flavors. Stuffed with mascarpone and then topped with vanilla crème, salted caramel, fresh strawberries and toasted coconut.  It had a perfect balance and wasn't overly sweet.  Really cool menu with at least four more items that I want to go back to try, which will be very soon. Then I'll go back to try them all a few more times.

I stumbled upon this place with a friend when we were on this side of town and glad that we did! It was about 110 degrees that day, so luckily we were able to be seated in an outdoor table right away. Otherwise, it would have been about a 45-50 minute wait. Although the heat made it a bit uncomfortable, the patio area is completely shaded so it wasn't too awful. Service was pretty prompt and prices were reasonable.   Judging from what other people were ordering, it seems like they're known for their pancakes. For those who can't decide which pancakes to get, you can pick 2 different ones with the same price and still be charged that same amount! My friend decided upon the sweet potato pancake and the pineapple upside down pancake. They were nice enough to put them on separate plates too so that you can taste each one individually. Both were really good, and the sweetness was not overdone with too much cream or syrup like in some other places. I ordered the Early Harvest Benny, which was delicious - egg was poached perfectly and I never knew pesto could go so well with Hollandaise sauce!  If I HAD to complain about something, the hash browns were just OK. My preference is having them a bit crisper on the outside. Having an outdoor cooling mist would have been nice too on a hot day. Overall, I really enjoyed my meal would would come back for sure. A lot of brunch places put emphasis on quantity over quality and it's nice to see there's one that doesn't make the same sacrifice! I'd give this a 4.5, but since there are no half stars on here, I'll give the benefit of the doubt and round up to a 5.

Came here for lunch on a weekday because I was working nearby at the Biltmore Resort.  I ordered the breakfast tacos on flour tortillas.  It was really tasty.  I was surprised that they offered a creamy aioli type sauce on the side instead of salsa, since it was tacos, but the sauce turned out to be a good addition to the tacos.  The amount of food was just right for me, which means that most other people would need to order a side or something to feel full.  The food is excellent, but I could do without the loud club music playing over the speakers at noon on a Thursday....

Awesome food and the best service every time I come they were so nice and took care of my dog like he was a paying customer. Love this place, try the corned beef and the snooze fashioned. Will be coming back as much as possible.
Cool spot in downtown Tempe. The decor takes you back to more retro times.  Fav dish: chilaquiles benedict

Stopped for breakfast on a Saturday morning before there was a wait for a table. There was a wait as we were leaving. Everything was very good... great service, and great food. We enjoyed the Eggs Benedict, Pancakes, and an egg dish. All worth having again. The patio was hopping and there are tables where folks had their dogs too. We'll be back!

Snooze easily tops my list of best breakfast spots in the area. The atmosphere, service, and food are all excellent. I love how easy it is to customize the meal, and everyone I dined with agreed the food was delicious. Even the coffee is good which is not always true at many breakfast spots.

The staff is not only cute and spunky, they are great at their jobs. I had eggs and hash browns , both of which were perfect. And I just couldn't resist so I ordered the peanut butter cup pancake and it was, by far, the best pancake I've ever eaten! I wish we had one of these in Dallas!
Great food! Great atmosphere. Waitress was great and even brought us a delicious special that wasn't on the menu. I would go again! Bloody Mary was amazing too!

"I will choose to do what I can fabulously." ? Clinton Kelly  And on a warm sunny morning, I chose to brunch fabulously!  The wait on Saturday was about an hour.  There was a surplus of people shopping at the Farmer's Market and downtown Gilbert is just generally a nightmare on the weekends.  But the wait is well worth it once you're seated in front of some eggs benedict and a nice cold Michelada.  These are the moments that makes waking up insanely early for spin class well worth it.  I love the Benny Duo.  I like being able to choose two different eggs benedict options and try out more than one flavor profile.  I had chosen The Benny Goodman and Bella! Bella! Benny.  The poached eggs on both benedicts were cooked to perfection.  I don't think I've had poached eggs done to this level of perfection.  One poke and it was just spewing liquid gold all over my plate. Bliss.  Anyways, let's talk benedicts:  Benny Goodman [Lox style salmon and cream cheese served over toasted rye and topped with poached cage free eggs, cream cheese hollandaise blended with sun dried tomato and caper relish]:  I love me a good lox and bagel in the morning so when I saw that Snooze offered it in benedicts form, I had to order it.  I just love salmon so much!  Rye bread is also my choice of bread as well so it was really a no-brainer.  I got to say though, the Benny Goodman left some to be desired.  The pieces of salmon were so minuscule that it could easily be forgotten.  If they offered more pieces of salmon and in bigger chunks, it would be great.  Bella! Bella! Benny [Thin slices of prosciutto, Taleggio cheese, and perfectly poached eggs on toasted ciabatta, topped with cream cheese hollandaise, balsamic glaze and arugula. Ciao Bella!]: Now the Bella Bella was pretty great.  I loved the saltiness from the prosciutto and the peppery taste of the arugula.  It was a well-balanced combination.    So yes.  I love Snooze and will be back.  They're food is well executed, prices are great, and the wait time is bearable.  That Bangkok Bloody Mary is insane.  Grab a glass and wait for a table because it's worth your wait!

Great breakfast spot!! But be aware that there's always a bit of a waiting time, since it's packed! What I recommended would be to sit at the bar if you're solo. Staff is friendly even when it's very busy. They take your order right away so you don't wait around. Food is extraordinary. Undecided between two? No problem. They have the option of half order of one and half order of the other. And I was really pleased to taste the Bella Bella Benny and the Benny Goodman. The Italian version of the eggs Benedict comes on ciabatta bread and balsamic drizzle. Delicious! The acidity of the balsamic makes an excellent contrast with the sweetness of the hollandaise sauce. The goodman salmon one was also good, but I wouldn't order it again. They also have items a la carte if you don't want the preselected side. I would be back, maybe on earlier hours to skip the line! ;-)

I really enjoyed eating here. The food was great. However the service was very slow. Which was somewhat disappointing for my birthday brunch. Other than that we had a nice time. Their mimosas and Bellinis were Very tasty.

This is probably my favorite brunch joint that I've found so far in Phoenix.  I've had the Early Harvest Benny (delicious and filling yet feels somewhat healthy - mushrooms are good for you, right?) and the Breakfast Pot Pie (you walk out feeling like you just ate a camel), and both were great in their own way.  Looking at all the other satisfied customers around me, though, I can tell that I haven't even made a dent into all the delicious offerings on the menu.  Prices are very reasonable, and service is friendly.  Even better - a large variety of alcoholic brunch drinks!  Perfect for coming off a night shift.  They even have some sort of drink special for medical providers on certain mornings (yay, thank you Snooze!!!!).    Can't wait for my next night month.

Look. STOP, don't even continue the research for a breakfast place if that's what you're looking for.   This is the place you were looking for. It may be busy with a justified wait but you'll be very happy.

Recently checked this little place out and I am so glad I did! It's a bit hard to get to, since it is practically on ASU campus. My advice is if you see a parking space even vaguely nearby, take it.The meters take card and are cheap, but the garage next door has always been somewhere in the range of $10 cash. Blah. Onto the food! Amazing! I ordered the Snooze Continental that consists of a grapefruit brulee (a half grapefruit with caramelized sugar over the top), 2 pieces of toast and greek yogurt with house granola/drizzled honey on top! Delicious and pretty healthy too.Seriously some of THE BEST breakfast food I have had. The latte was good and the environment was nice and for being on campus, it isn't deafeningly loud like a lot of college places are. Service was great and friendly! Will return, and if I can get over the parking situation, I can see it becoming a favorite! A plus too when they didn't talk smack over my U of A card ;)

Such a cool place for breakfast!  Incredibly creative dishes.  My husband couldn't decide between the many variations of eggs Benedict, but they had an option to pick two different ones, how awesome is that?  They also have a similar option for pancakes (too many delicious flavors to choose from so you can pick three)!  The food was delicious.  Oh and the service was stellar - Joe was so friendly and attentive, he started our day off right.  We will definitely be back.

My roommate and I decided to try this place for a late brunch on a Saturday.  The wait was about 40-50 minutes but that was something we expected. Luckily they text you when your table is ready so we did a bit of shopping while we waited. Our waitress was really nice and attentive despite the morning rush. I ordered the Ham Benedict III which was absolutely delicious, and my roommate had the Sandwich I Am which was also very tasty. Both came with hash browns that were amazing! It was a tiny bit loud, but otherwise a very pleasant atmosphere!  Overall a great experience, I will definitely be back.

Delicious breakfast. They text to notify you when your table is ready. Plus they have a ping pong table and games to keep you entertained during your wait. This helped a lot with our 9 yr old. Barely noticed the time go by. Free coffee and good music. Good brunch spot for the central phoenix folk. Any place that has a good selection of eggs benedict wins with me.

I have been wanting to try this place for sooooo long. Just needed someone to get up early on a Sunday and come with! It was after noon when we arrived (Sorry, I hate mornings!) and it was quite busy but there is a lot of seating so the wait time was expected to be only 20-30 minutes. We opted to sit at the bar instead where you can select off their Breakfast Cocktail menu (whaaaaa???) and enjoy dining there instead of having to wait. The morning cocktails are nothing less of fabulous. Traditional mimosas OR, one's with pineapple juice, or with tequila instead of OJ and then each one has a little special twist to it. Ours were very blah and mostly just juice so I asked the bartender to add more alcohol. She did so that was nice. Her service unfortunately was not so hot. She just seemed like she didn't want to be there and that we were just a nusiance to her for the most part. We had to remind her and wait quite a while to get water that we asked for and to place an order. I would have rated it higher based on the food and drinks but the service was just less than mediocre. So then I go right to, well I can just go to TC Eggington's or BLD for great food and at least the service is typically friendlier. I would probably go again if in that area but I can't see going out of my way. The breakfast menu itsef was pretty impressive and I went with the OMG french toast but it didn't blow me away. Not quite as much flavor and sweetness I was expecting but still a very nice dish. He ordered the Benny Goodman which was an open faced breakfast sandwich with poached egg and salmon and asked for sauces/accompaniments on the side. Not something I would ever want to have but he seemed to like it. It's a nice place. Great area. You can browse around the Rack or hop over to Biltmore to shop after. But I am big on being treated like you want me there and want me to come back and they, I can honestly say, did not!
Delicious!  Now I understand why they're always so busy.  Great food, friendly service, super cute patio. I had the pancake flight, and it changed my life

I enjoyed going to snooze, but I don't think I'll go back.  First off, the wait to get in to this place is ridiculous.  The food is not quite good enough to merit the wait, in other words the food quality to wait ratio is a bit off.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good, and even better than most breakfast places, but at the end of the day I'd much rather wait for something incredible rather than good.  The atmosphere of the place is super weird.  It's like the Jetsons meets your grandmothers newly redone kitchen.  Doesn't really mesh well.    At the end of the meal, I was satisfied, but I asked myself, "does this feel unique?" and my answer was no.  In all aspects it felt like a chain restaurant.  The service was friendly but not personal.  The food was tasty but not exceptional.    I think three stars is the right score, and A-OK is the right rating.

Pretty good food. I didn't enjoy the music they had on. And the mimosas are not my favorite.  I'm thinking they use a dry champagne? I probably won't go back. There are way to many nice breakfast jounts!
So good, love this place. Great food, good drinks. Little pricey but worth it

Worst service!! First I would like to say I never do this. But we were excited to go try it out. Got there in time not really busy. Had service right away took our order and never saw our waitress again. I had to ask 2 different waiters for drinks.  When they second waiter told our waitress she just looked pissied off. Food was terrible not worth 40$  we will never go back.. wast of time and money.good luck if you go!

We just love this place! Our server was Savannah,  we had to ask because it said Sav Blanc on the check! Haha! Loved it....anyways, my dad was in town from Reno and had a blueberry pancake, which he loved! My niece and I had the loaded hashbrowns and the pancake flight. We tried the sweet potato, pineapple upside down and blueberry danish....omg....yum! Sister had the breakfast pot pie and brother had French toast with fruit. Everything was amazing as well as the service. Cant wait to go back.

Wow! Just fantastic. Picture this....its 10 am in what is about to become a 115° day in Phx and we walk in and they say immediate seating on the patio. The niece and I look at each other but our hunger takes over and we agree to go for it. We're approached by Joe, who cracks a joke about her ordering a cappuccino but she hasn't had her coffee yet so she does not care that it's gonna be a scorcher today. He helps us navigate the menu and we ordered the pancake flight which we had about 6 choices (you get 3) and we chose pineapple upside down cake with a creme anglaise, sweet potato with brown butter butter and the daily special which was like a smoothie kind of flavor on a white chocolate pancake. Yum!! We also shared the hash browns with cheese and 2 choices of meats, sauces or veggies. We got onions, bacon and spinach (.75). Plenty to share. 2 drinks later and 31 bucks. Totally reasonable and absolutely delicious. Top all that off with Joe's amazing service and you have a recipe for "Im going back"!

Hands down the best breakfast joint I have ever been to.  The most creative and delicious pancake combinations I've have ever seen.  If your not a fan of pancakes this place also scrambles eggs to perfection and makes the most succulent pieces of bacon. The wait staff is personable pleasant and the service is always speedy.  The only downside is the long wait times that is always indicative of good food and great service

This place is so amazing ! We used to love butters and all those other places until we discovered snooze it's clean food, fresh and delicious it can't get better than this !!! LOVE the benny goodman Benedict !
This is one of the finest places for breakfast in Tempe. It is right at the little village at ASU.  It is a must when you are in town.

Never knew pancakes could be prepared in so many wonderful ways! I'd recommend the pancake sampler (3) and indulge in some new varieties, including the pancake of the day.   I also ordered the chicken patty. It was flavorful, but a bit more salty than I'd prefer.

Stylish and eclectic atmosphere with really yummy breakfast food! Staff is nice and attentive, very good place for breakfast or brunch. This particular location can get kind of crowded and difficult to get to though because the college is so close. Also, you have to pay for parking and may have a walk a distance. However, it's close to a parking garage (still have to pay and walk, but it's covered!). Recommended for a brunch once in a while!

Fun, FUN brunch place. Snooze really has it's own unique ambiance...a little bit like a fun diner, a lot like a modern bistro, and mostly just an overall great place to eat. There's not as much of a wait on weekdays, if that's your thing.

Today was my first Snooze experience and I cannot wait to go back! I want to try everything on the menu! Perfect portion sizes and appropriate pricing. The caramel apple mimosa is delicious! Definitely a new favorite. Love the trendy, upbeat atmosphere as well as great service. Would recommend to everyone!

Where to begin? The food and the service was nothing short of perfection!   Right in the center of AZ State University. A very hipster spot with college kids flowing in and out. A nice stop for breakfast/brunch.   Prices are moderately fair. I recommend the breakfast burrito. Very filling and delicious.

Food was really yummy!! The service was great also!! Definitely go back again! Hot Chocolate was delicious wish it was a little warmer.. And the OMG French Toast was divine!! It started to rain they put up umbrella's fast and the heaters were on because it was windy and cold!!
The service is awesome, Caitlin was the best! The corned beef was the best I have had anywhere in the USA! Add to that the great bloody Mary's!

I am sort of torn between two or three stars. I have had really great service and meals here that I would rate as four or five stars, yet I have also had around the same number of experiences that were pretty awful.  If you come here on one of the good days, you can expect great breakfast food for a somewhat higher than average cost. Although, when they are on point the prices are completely worth it for the meal.   Be warned though, when they fall short of loose dining standards, your experience can be very negative. I'm not sure if they have off days or times or what, but if you are unfortunate enough to come on one of those days here is what you can expect (and what has happened to me several times now): a server whom is either incompetent or rude (they read the same sometimes), wrong or missing items when you receive your meal, undercooked or overcooked food (ex. Bacon can be slimy and transparent or burnt black and hard), an empty water and coffee cup the entire time you are there, and an overwhelming sense of dissatisfaction when you just spent $30 on a breakfast that Denny's could've put to shame for $5.   All in all, try this place out. When they do things right this place is awesome. Just be weary of those "off" times.

I have visited twice. My timing was good, no wait. Bonus! The food is wonderful. My daughter swears by the pancakes, the usual flavors plus a daily special flavor. The bennies are the best. The harvest and the Goodman are fantastic! The downside has been the service, especially bad on my first visit, better more recently.  Worth the visit.

This is a great modern eatery. The food is not traditional. The chefs have imagination and creativity. The flavors are great. The variety of pancakes is amazing. The pot pie was flavor sensation. This is a go. Be aware peak times have waits so be ready. Can't knock them a star for that. If you make great food you'll have a wait.

Quite possibly the slowest breakfast place in Arizona. Took the waiter 17 minutes to bring a drink. Improve your service and your attitude. They also have plenty of people waiting and plenty of empty tables. Quit trying to have people spend money on drinks and actually seat them! The food is good but for the service why pay the high prices?!
Good coffee, great food, even better service!! I recommend sitting at the breakfast bar. Get the eggs benedict, because that is living, my friends.
Delicious! Eggs benedict mix and match? Yes please! perfect place for a relaxing Sunday brunch with delicious mimosa options.  Definitely making it a more regular spot.
Iced mocha and Snooze Spuds Deluxe are always fantastic! Great atmosphere and don't forget the open seating at the bar if the wait is to long
I love this place. The food is great   The only thing us older people didn't care for was the music. The service and food was great

I've heard a lot of great things about this place and woke up early enough to go eat breakfast before the morning rush. We got there at about 7:30am on a Saturday and was quickly greeted by the host and taken to our table. We ordered the mmm mm mimosa and Bangkok bloody mary. The mimosa was good and very tart and gave me a nice buzz. the Bangkok bloody mary was very interesting but had a lingering fish sauce taste that I think most people might not like. We ordered the OMG french toast and the Reuben and the dishes were pretty amazing! the french toast was fluffy and soft and very flavorful. the corned beef was tender and delicious and I loved the soft pretzel bun! The décor is very cute and welcoming and we will definitely come back again to try their pancakes!

I have been to Snooze 5 times, but have only eaten here twice. The 3 times I was forced to turn away were because of 60-75 minute wait times.   The food is great and I have been pleased with all of the meals and drinks I have sampled off their menu, but the current trendiness and long wait times make me more likely to choose a different breakfast place in this area.   It's not really justifiable to eat here unless you really have a lot of time on your hands. Today we waited 35 minutes to be sat and another 40 waiting for food. Staff was friendly and pleasant and the patio table we sat at was very nice, but, again, it's just a crazy amount of time to devout to breakfast.  If they could find a way to seat and feed people in a more reasonable amount of time, Snooze would be worth WAY more stars.

If you're going to Snooze, get there about an hour before you plan on being hungry. The wait is crazy. We have tried to go 2 prior times and was advised of waits in excess of 75 minutes... For eggs!? Needless to say, we didn't wait.   We arrived today and only had to wait for 35 minutes, which seemed reasonable given the other wait experiences.   We were seated and noticed the decor to be nice and the service to be friendly. The food was good, albeit smaller portion than I expected for $11.50. The Bloody Mary was a little blah, nothing special and the coffee was decent.  It was good. Not great.   I will be back... Depending on the wait.
This place is lit. I got the Mexican Benedict and it was amazing! French toasts was really good as well! Avoid going on Sunday's if you want to be served faster

This place has everything you could possibly want in a brunch spot. The staff is really friendly -like not just-doing-my-job nice, but genuinely-glad-you're-here nice. So nice, in fact that after we ordered our breakfast, they brought us an order of the pancake of the day because they thought we should try it. Normally, I'm not a sweets-for-breakfast lover but this pancake, peanut butter jelly time, was so delicious it basically restored my faith in humanity. That's not a gimmick statement, I actually felt that way after eating it. If I lived in this town, I would be here weekly, if not more.

I love this spot. The food is awesome and the service is unbeatable!!! Alex was one of the best servers I have ever had! Plus the patio is dog friendly.  The wait was about 50 minutes for Saturday brunch but it was worth it. You can get a drink at the bar while you wait. I love the adult hot cocoa options, plus you can play ping pong while waiting. We found a couple who was willing to play doubles to help pass the time. Fun times.  Alex had lots of suggestions, all of which were delicious.  He brought us some samples of the options we were trying to decide between.  I have tried all the Benedict options, I like them all. The stuffed french toast is really good if you are looking for something sweet. The oatmeal is good, but seems to be better during winter months. They change the recipe up a couple times a year pending what is in season at the time. I highly recommend waiting for a table during busy times,  it is well worth it.

We have been trying to come, being ASU territory it tends to be busy. Decided to come early, well worth it. The sandwich I am is mouth watering good, soft pretzel bun was perfect. My partner got the eggs Benedict, beyond pleased. Will be returning for another adventure in good eating.

I have now been to all the Snooze locations and enjoy their breakfast offerings. The pancakes are always sweet and delicious, and the bennies are very flavorful. I love the mix and match menu options for both pancakes and eggs benedict. That makes it easier for us. But this place is SO crowded. Plan on waiting up to 45 minutes on the weekend for sure. But hit them up - really fine breakfast goodies ... skip the hash browns though (they're kinda meh.)

Your food is just as scrumptious here as at any of your other locations. I get that you're new and working out a few of the kinks. Let me help you... Dude at the welcome station wrote down my phone number for texting incorrectly - twice. So we waited an extra 15 minutes until someone else was smart enough to call out our name. Your servers are quite inattentive. I'd like my water refreshed, I'd like my coffee refreshed, I'd like someone to ask how I'm doing. Snap it up folks - good food calls me back, but inferior service sends me down the street.

Just as wonderful as your Denver location, but bigger. A good 20 minute wait early on a Saturday morning, which I thought was appropriate. Great hash browns, and that trio of pancakes cannot be beat. I tried the blueberry, the tropicalada, and the sweet potato pancakes. Unbelievable! And when your server says you can have breakfast any old way you want it, they mean it. Décor is kitschy and cute, the place is spanking clean too. Don't dilly-dally about, run and grab yourself some breakfast at Snooze.

A fun an unique menu that wasn't executed very well. A long (65 minute wait) left our family of five crammed into a 4 top. The Benedicts were well cooked but simply not that tasty. For a family of 5 the bill was $100ish. Could have gone to Denny's, Village Inn or Egg I Am and had a much better experience for a more reasonable price.

The wait is long during weekend brunch. The reason for my 3 star review is because of the staff at the front. When you check in, your number is given to the system. When they text you, the message says your table is almost ready which means to check back in with the staff. Well I didn't know that since the message didn't say to go to the front and check in and I received 5 that said your table is almost ready. When I finally approached the front, I had my dog with me and was told the table is ready but I would have to walk him around to the back. Then as i was waiting in the back, they gave my table away for me not being in the front where the girl can walk me back...needless to say, those girls were unapologetic contributed to nothing to help me and didn't work to solve my frustration. It was quite an ordeal. The food was great but I won't be returning to this location because of such awful personnel. Do what you're paid to do...which is give customers good service.
The breakfast burrito (add bacon) was bomb.com. Would love to try be breakfast tacos. I'll be back again

We had brunch here on a Friday morning. The menu looks great with lots of vegetarian options, which made the 1 hour long wait worth it. Also the location is great, so walking around the vicinity while we waited helped pass time.  They have a good selection of cocktails. I tried the spicy bloody mary and it was delicious. We then ordered the OMG french toast to share. It was great, not too heavy or sweet with fresh strawberries and salted caramel.   I then ordered the benny duo: benedict with soyrizo sans ham and the winter harvest benny. It was brought to me with meat in it, very disappointing-hence the lower star review. They did remove the item from my bill, but the mistake was off putting.   This is a great place for brunch, just be sure to check your meal before digging in.

I was staying at the hotel next door and came by to pick up breakfast before work. The waitress and waiter at the time were both really friendly - I asked for some recommendations and ended up ordering the eggs benedict, choosing two different kinds to try. The waitress also treated me to a blueberry pancake since it was my first time there, and she felt it was worth trying. It was way too much food for one meal, but the leftovers that afternoon were still pretty tasty. Overall, it definitely hit the spot for 1.5-2 meals.

Wonderful breakfast experience. Great patio, heaters, dog friendly (outside) wonderful music selection and friendly staff. What a great compliment to all the eateries that have recently opened in Tempe! The food has been wonderful! The hash browns are delish!
Fantastic service and Amazing food. Order the spring frittata if you get a chance, you wont be dissapointed.

Relaxed and retro-chic atmosphere. I had the ridiculously good Banana Nutella Situation. The fluffy brioche French toast made the ideal base for the extremely creamy and flavorful  banana and Nutella cream sauces. Toasted nuts and plantain chips balance out the sweetness and creaminess.
Great food and great service but long wait times and overpriced food! Waited 45 minutes for our table. I love the French toast neat and eggs. Next time I'll try the mimosas

Snooze has locations all over.  I tired to go to the one in San Fran once and the line was down the street and on its way around the corner at 7:30 am and they don't open until 8am.  Needless to say we picked a different place to eat.  So when I passed by a location in Phoenix I was excited but I wanted bfast and it was dinner time so I filed it in my mental roller deck to come back. Needless to say the conference fed us EVERY MONRING and the food was good and plentiful so I never got over to the location I found.  Then the morning I was leaving I was starving and of course my conference was over and I didn't have time for bfast in the hotel.  I was going to stop at Star-Bee's but I needed gas so on-ward I went to do that before returning the car.  I pulled up bfast places and this place popped up on my way to the airport! PERFECT!  I stopped and noticed NO LINE so I parked and hopped out!  The place was full but still had seating.  To save some time I sat at the bar and was given a menu ASAP and asked what I wanted to drink.  The young lady working was SUPER NICE and had a few regulars sitting at her counter.  They knew about her and she knew and asked about them.  LOVE when that happens.    I perused the menu and eye-spied the pancake flight.  SCORE!  You get 3 pancakes and you can pick any flavors...NICE I can try a few!  I went with the sweet potato, blueberry and pineapple upside down pancakes.  OH BOY! I was excited to try these and fill up before having to head to the airport.  I also got one egg scrambled.  I chatted up a couple over customers that were also at another conference that week.  We agreed the heat and humidity in Phoenix is HORRID and there is no love lost with the thunder storms.    My food arrived and no time and I dove in teeth first.  I tired the pineapple upside down pan-CAKE!  OH MAN SOOO GOOD!  Little bits of pineapple in the pan-CAKE!  You really DIDN'T need the syrup.  The butter was some mix that was PREFECT with the pineapple and it was light.  Next I tried the sweet potato and OMG SUPER DELISH!  It had some cinnamon butter mix that is making me drool just thinking about how DELISH it was!  Again I didn't need the syrup at all!  PREFECT!  Last was the blueberry pancake and it was good but typical.  I should have went for another DIFFERENT pancake to DELIGHT my taste buds!    Eggs were light and fluffy and good and the coffee was ON POINT...HOT and FRESH!  Simply DELISH!  I will have to try the one near me in the OC.     PS you can also get French toast with the pancake flight but I went with all pancakes since they have several different flavors to select from!

Love this place! The wait is well worth it every time!   Today Katie was our server and blew us away. We was very knowledgeable of the menu and anticipated our needs before we could even ask. The restaurant was very busy but she was alway attentive and super friendly! With both of us being in the industry this was very refreshing! Thank you Katie! We will make sure to request her every time!

I loved this place! The I had the breakfast tacos and they were so filling and delicious. The wait staff was great. They were soooo busy but we didn't have to wait long for our food or drinks. It's a great place for families and a fun place for brunch!!
Really delicious breakfast. Just so busy it takes forever to get seated. Other than the wait it was really good! I'll definitely go back again!

Tasty little spot, good for mimosa brunch.  If you're a fan of gourmet pancake combos, they have a lovely selection.  Chicken sausage, while sustainably and locally sourced (most of their ingredients are) did not quite hit the spot.  The menu needs pork sausage biscuits and gravy.  Their Benedict's were killer.

I enjoyed two cups of coffee and the front lobby ambience here this morning, for an hour, as I waited for my table and watched people who came in AFTER me get seated...before me.  (We'd requested a table for two, at the first available spot: inside, outside, at the bar....didn't care.)  We kept checking our text messages as we thought maybe we'd missed our text alert that our table was ready.  Nope, we hadn't missed anything.  Yet people were walking in and being taken right back because their party, by blind luck, happened to fit the correct size requirements for the table that was currently available.    I know I wasn't alone in my anger and confusion over why people who came in after me were being seated before me because I watched a steady stream of other waiting patrons walk up to check on what was going on with their table too.  This seating arrangement seems grossly unfair.  Did I mention that I did this for an hour before I finally got mad and left?  And the kicker?  When we finally told them to cancel our table and that we were leaving BOOM a table for 2 was suddenly available!  I was at the Snooze in downtown Denver two weeks ago where I enjoyed amazing food, stellar service and our party was seated in 15 minutes flat, with none of this seating stupidity.   Get your shit together, Snooze-Gilbert.  Honestly...

They say ignorance is bliss, and in this case I'd like to stay blissfully ignorant about the caloric content of the bombdiggity Pineapple Upside Down Pancakes and hot, crispy Chilaquiles Benedict and hashbrowns that I had here for breakfast when I had brunch with my best friend a few weeks ago, mmmmkay?  Thanks.

Booooo longest wait time ever. Not worth it, too expensive and no salt. Na I'll skip it. Had the two versions of the eggs Benedict  (steak, beef)  and it was so vanilla. Mimosas were good (6 out of10).

This is a wonderful place to enjoy a delicious brunch! My first experience with Snooze was in Denver a couple of years ago. Incredible! Since then, I've sought them out during my travels out West. My favorite thing on the menu is their B.E.A.T. Sandwich with avocado. It's fabulous! Their sweet potato pancakes are to die for and so is their French toast. Don't mind the wait! It's only proof of how good the food is. Service rocks, too!
Complimentary coffee whole you wait. Excellent breakfast whole family had a lot of fun.   A bit pricey but not expensive. Service was really good even on a busy holiday weekend

Took about an hr to get seated on a Sunday early afternoon. Not toooo surprised. Hostess was okay.   Waitress was nice, friendly, attentive.  The food was okay. Ordered two different eggs Benedict.  One was cold, the other kinda warm. My potatoes were kinda warm, not cold. She replaced the cold Benedict for me which was nice. Cinnamon roll pancake was good and came out hot.  It's been a few hours and now my stomach is upset. Hope it's not food poisoning.   Bloody marry was okay. Cold pressed coffee was good.   Very cute inside, fun menu.   Probably will not go back. Gave it three instead of two stars because the waitress was great.

You cannot go wrong at Snooze.  The coffee is the best. Selection is great.  It is best to get a plate with several types of  pancakes.  The Snooze in San Diego area has hoola hoops and fun toys to play with outside.  That could be a fun addition to Valley of the sun
Um, best breakfast ever. I hope I have one near me for the rest of my life.  I had the Benny Duo (?). The quinoa one rocked my world.

It's a really cool atmosphere to have breakfast in. The staff are all really friendly, and the decor/seating is unique in the best ways. The food was great. I got the pineapple upside down pancake. They were really big, enough for two mwals(there were 2 pancakes). The taste was good, but not as good as I was hoping though. My step-dad tried them and really liked them though, so it is really just individuals personal taste. I tried my mom's hash Browns and they were really good. Overall all three of us enjoyed our food and left as satisfied customers. It's a great place to go for breakfast.

95 minute wait for breakfast? Really? So here is the tip, go to the bar, but you might have to stand and eat. I did just that since I was solo. No wait, but not a great experience since people were trying to order drinks all around me. Did I mention I had to stand to eat?   The place plays very, very loud music. That is never a negative for me. I love music. If I think music is loud it is really loud. However, for a breakfast place it seemed strange. Don't go here with a hangover, migraine or if you do not like crowds. People were all over the place waiting to get in.   The coffee was not anything great but I have to admit the food was FAB! I got the sweet potato pancake and sausage links and it was seriously Delish!!!! It makes me sad because there are so many things I have heard are so good here. I want to go back but I probably wont. Well, maybe in the summer, on a beach holiday weekday?    *****Five stars for the food-and I rarely rank Breakfast food as a 5 star meal.   *1 for the wait and crowds  ****4 for the service. The staff members are kind and cheery. Definitely, not a Snooze;

Lets me start with, Savannah is great.   My visit was spur of the moment, and selected based on best food photos lol. We ordered the pancake flight-- blueberry, french toast and pineapple upside down cake. Although we did ask for one plain pancake. So idk how that happened but score for us. We also ordered the breakfast pot pie w hash-browns. I was kind of sad that I saw the OJ coming from a container after I was already drinking mine.  I immediately dug into the pot pie, the gravy was more of a cool temperature. I had my friend try it too to make sure I wasn't being overly critical, or maybe gravy comes cool? Anyway Savannah came back a little later, I told her "I think this is supposed to be warmer than this?" She immediately said she would have them remake it. Round two came out and this time it was at least warm in some areas. My only suggestion is to make the gravy hotter or make it from scratch when its ordered. The pancakes and french toast were BOMB! I loved the blueberry the most.  Every employee said a parting greeting as well. I thought that was a really nice touch. Ill be back and this time I'm ordering the Chilaquiles.

If you don't go to Snooze, you lose! Amazing unconventional versions of breakfast favorites. The breakfast tacos are fantastic tasting and 3 make for a big portion. The chipotle hollandaise sauce is an unexpected savory twist. The pancake varieties are all delicious. The corn beef hash is wonderful beyond words because the beef has a smoky BBQ flavor. Poblano peppers add flavor without excessive heat. The service is fast and friendly. Tip them well. They deserve it!  This is our favorite breakfast place in Gilbert.

Been here on their busy days, and not so busy days. Environment and atmosphere of the place is great, hostess was great and a couple waitresses were amazing at customer service. I wish i had gotten their names, unfortunately both times being here our server wasn't the best. Both occasions they were not attentive at all, didn't check up on us, except to take our order and give us our bill. The food is a hit or miss.. if im in the area ill most likely continue to eat here but i wouldnt drive out of my way to get breakfast/brunch here.

I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast food but oh man this place is amazing! Everything on their menu is great! I love that they have some delicious healthy options but honestly I can never go in without getting a pancake or two or three ;)  If you go on a weekend you can expect at least a 45 min wait but it's worth it! Service is always great!

Great staff, fun atmosphere and fab food, what more could you ask for?!?  We took our kids on a Sunday morning and had a 40 minute wait. But that was okay, because there were a lot of fun places to snap pictures around College Street plus Snooze had cornhole! The gluten free pancakes were delish and we will be back for the breakfast tacos!

This place was great!  From the moment we put our name  in (they text you when table is ready) to the time we left we had a great experience!  Their French toast was to die for! We also tried the quevos rancheros and it was amazing too.  Great service too!
the apple juice is fresh and delicious. the service was great. first time here and you know i'll be back.

Hands down the most creative "versions" of Eggs Benedict. I had the Benny Goodman;  lox and cream cheese. Absolutely delicious. I wish I could give this new spot I just discovered 5 stars, however their drink menu and back bar need an overhaul. Friendly staff and good music!

This place is awesome.  Excellent menu choices!  The options on the pancake menu are enough to get your nom nom brain going.    Snooze is centrally located and easy to find.  The store front faces Camelback Rd.  There is a small out door patio for dining outside.  I love it that their brunch cocktail menu is extensive and creative!!!  With about 4 or 5 Bloody Mary options, a few Mimosas and a few others, their brunch cocktail choices are truly impressive.  Return Factor:100%

One of the best breakfast spots in the east valley! It's ALWAYS packed and they don't take reservations. However, since the location is downtown you can easily pass the time at the farmers market on weekends or walk around and look at the cuteness of downtown. They will text you when your table is ready. The lattes and mochas are excellent, breakfast tacos (with flour tortillas, the corn falls apart easily) and all their pancakes are out of this world. Try the pancake flight so you can choose 3 different pancakes to try at once! You have to try this place at least once in your life!

We discovered snooze while we were in San Diego but that's a different review. I was excited to see they had several AZ locations. We had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table - worth it.  The staff gave great service and the manager was a WONDER WOMAN!  (Kristin?) she was everywhere and still had the time to have a nice conversation with us about the history of snooze. We all had different meals and had to taste each other's because they were so delicious. This place is a must no matter what city you are in.

I enjoy this breakfast spot, but going on a weekend morning is pretty tortuous. It's super crowded and the wait is pretty long. If you happen to go on an off time the food it pretty good. I enjoy the benedicts, but he hashbrowns are a bit bland and soft. I think this place gets a lot more hype than it's really worth. If you want to try some interesting pancakes that are really decadent and sweet then you'd love this place. They have a bunch of dessert type pancakes to choose from and you can mix and match which is nice.
